news_headline: Galaxy S21 Ultra 5G is designed to be epic in every way: Samsung
news_article: Samsung has introduced #GalaxyS21Ultra 5G with an iconic contour cut camera design, a 108MP pro-grade camera, 8K Video Snap and 100x Space Zoom. The device is powered by 5nm Processor - the fastest processor in a Galaxy ever and has an adaptive 120Hz Dynamic AMOLED display for smoother scrolling. Pre-order now and get benefits of ₹20000.

news_headline: WhatsApp delays privacy changes by 3 months, says 'No account to be deleted on Feb 8'
news_article: WhatsApp has announced it has opted to delay its new privacy policy changes by three months following user backlash over the company's data sharing practices. "No one will have their account suspended or deleted on February 8. We're also going to do a lot more to clear up the misinformation around how privacy and security works on WhatsApp," WhatsApp said.

news_headline: 'So glad you exist': Elon Musk wishes Wikipedia on its 20th birthday
news_article: Wishing Wikipedia on its 20th anniversary on Friday, Tesla's billionaire CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Happy birthday Wikipedia! So glad you exist." Founded on January 15, 2001, by American-British entrepreneur Jimmy Wales, Wikipedia is now the seventh-most popular website in the world. It hosts more than 55 million articles which attract 15 billion hits from visitors every month.

news_headline: Bill Gates becomes the biggest owner of farmland in US
news_article: The world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, has become the largest owner of farmland in the US. He owns 2,42,000 acres of farmland and nearly 27,000 acres of other land, according to an analysis by The Land Report, which tracks the country's biggest landowners. The title for largest landholdings overall goes to Liberty Media Chairman John Malone, who owns 22,00,000 acres.

news_headline: Delhi HC judge recuses self from hearing case against WhatsApp's new policy
news_article: Delhi High Court judge Justice Prathiba M Singh has recused herself from hearing the petition challenging WhatsApp's new Privacy Policy. Before recusing, Justice Singh objected to an email sent on behalf of Facebook or WhatsApp. The mail had requested her not to hear the case as she had earlier appeared in a connected case as a lawyer, media reports said.

news_headline: Tata Motors tweets 'tere mere pyaar ke charche' amid Tesla tie-up rumours, deletes it
news_article: Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday tweeted, "Aajkal tere mere pyaar ke charche har akhbaar mein, sabko malum hai aur sabko khabar ho gayi!", while tagging Elon Musk and Tesla, amid rumours of a joint venture between the two. The account, though unverified, is followed by Tata Motors' official handle. The tweet was deleted later.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Xiaomi blacklisted by US for its links to Chinese military
news_article: The US has blacklisted smartphone manufacturer Xiaomi for its links to the Chinese military. The move means US investors will be unable to purchase Xiaomi securities and will have to divest holdings they already own by November 11, 2021. Eight other businesses including state-owned aircraft maker COMAC were placed on the list of companies with connections to the Chinese military.

news_headline: Signal app goes down worldwide after adding millions of new users
news_article: Messaging app Signal is facing a global outage after adding millions of new users in recent days following a change in rival WhatsApp's privacy terms. Users reported messages failing to send. "We've been adding new servers and extra capacity at a record pace every single day this week nonstop, but today exceeded even our most optimistic projections," it said.

news_headline: Samsung Galaxy S21 phones to come without charger, earphones in the box
news_article: Samsung on Thursday said that its latest S21, S21 Plus and S21 Ultra smartphones will ship without a charger and earphones in the box. The company said it believes that gradually removing the accessories from the boxes could help make them more sustainable. Samsung's move comes after Apple recently stopped including earphones and power adapters in iPhone boxes.

news_headline: Xiaomi Co-Founder loses $3.6 billion after US blacklists the company
news_article:
Xiaomi Co-Founder and CEO Lei Jun lost about $3.6 billion as the stock plunged as much as 13% on Friday after the US blacklisted the smartphone maker for Chinese military links. 
Lei, who owns over 25% of Xiaomi, is now worth $27.5 billion, according to Bloomberg. Vice Chairman Lin Bin's fortune is also down $1.7 billion to $9.9 billion.

news_headline: Health, tech firms including Microsoft, Oracle to create 'vaccination passports'
news_article: The Vaccination Credential Initiative (VIC), a coalition of health and tech firms including Microsoft, Oracle and the Mayo Clinic, said it is developing an internationally-accepted digital certificate to verify if someone has taken the COVID-19 vaccine. The tech, similar to a passport, will help prevent people from falsely claiming to be immune to the deadly virus, the VIC said.

news_headline: Qualcomm to acquire Indian-origin Apple ex-exec's NUVIA for $1.4B
news_article: Qualcomm will acquire NUVIA, a chip startup founded by Apple veterans, for approximately $1.4 billion with plans to put the firm's technology into its smartphone, laptop, and automotive processors. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions. Under the deal, NUVIA Founders, including IIT Delhi-graduate and former Apple executive Manu Gulati, and their employees will join Qualcomm.

news_headline: Amazon's Ring Neighbors app bug exposed users' home addresses
news_article: A security flaw in Amazon-owned Ring's Neighbors app was exposing the precise locations and home addresses of users who had posted to the app. A Ring spokesperson said it fixed the issue soon after it became aware of the bug. The spokesperson added that Ring had not identified any evidence of users' information being accessed or used maliciously.

news_headline: Prime cancellation steps deceptive, undermine consumer will: Groups to US FTC
news_article: A group of US public interest advocates has asked the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to probe Amazon's process for cancelling Prime subscriptions. The group alleged that the steps to cancel are "designed to unfairly and deceptively undermine the will of the consumer" and may violate FTC rules as well as other consumer protection laws.

news_headline: Many platforms today devoted to yelling online: Wikipedia's Jimmy Wales
news_article: Wikipedia Co-founder Jimmy Wales said his platform's civility and neutrality is "particularly poignant today given that we have so many places online that seem to be devoted almost exclusively to people screaming and yelling at each other". Wales also added that "no personal attacks" was one of the oldest rules of the 20-year-old platform.

news_headline: Apple's MacBook Pros could see return of MagSafe charger this yr: Report
news_article: Apple is planning upgraded MacBook Pro laptops this year with faster processors, updated displays and the return of its MagSafe magnetic charger, Bloomberg reported. The new laptops are planned to come in 14-inch and 16-inch screen sizes. Both will be using versions of Apple's in-house Mac processors upgraded with more cores and enhanced graphics.

news_headline: Epic submits complaint against Apple, Google over Fortnite in UK
news_article: Epic Games has submitted a complaint against Google and Apple over Fortnite's removal from their stores to the UK's antitrust tribunal. Apple has abused its "dominant position", Epic has alleged. "Epic is not seeking damages from Apple or Google in the UK...or the US, it is simply seeking fair access and competition that will benefit all consumers," Epic said.

news_headline: Apple removes macOS feature that let its apps bypass firewalls: Report
news_article: Apple's macOS Big Sur 11.2 beta 2 has eliminated feature that allowed 53 Apple apps to bypass third-party firewalls, security tools, and VPN apps, ZDNet reported. The macOS Big Sur 11 included a ContentFilterExclusionList that let apps like the App Store and iCloud bypass firewalls. Researchers had earlier warned of security issues the list could cause.

news_headline: Bharti Global co-owned UK firm OneWeb gets $400M from SoftBank, Hughes
news_article: Bharti Global and the UK government's jointly owned internet satellite firm OneWeb has received additional funding of $400 million from SoftBank and Hughes Network Systems, which takes OneWeb's total funding to $1.4 billion. As part of the investment, SoftBank will gain a seat on OneWeb's board. Bharti, along with the UK government, had acquired OneWeb for $1 billion in November.

news_headline: Far-right activists got bitcoins worth $500k before US Capitol violence: Report
news_article: Bitcoin payments worth more than $500,000 were made to 22 different virtual wallets, most of them belonging to far-right activists and internet personalities in the US, before the US Capitol violence, cryptocurrency compliance startup Chainalysis said on Friday. The startup added that it has "strong evidence"  that the donor was a "now-deceased computer programmer based in France".

news_headline: Bharti Airtel divests 6,824 equity shares in Seynse Technologies
news_article: Telecom operator Bharti Airtel has divested 6,824 equity shares in Seynse Technologies, that was held through its wholly-owned subsidiary Nettle Infrastructure Investments, filing revealed. Airtel, however, did not disclose the price at which the shares were divested "for the reasons of confidentiality". Seynse is a financial technology company that created the Loan Singh platform.

news_headline: Tesla asks US safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla asked the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to declare its speed display issue as inconsequential to safety, reported Reuters. Over six lakh Tesla vehicles do not comply with safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements. Tesla said a majority of vehicles have since corrected the issue.

news_headline: Amazon to let others build their own assistants using Alexa's tech
news_article: Amazon announced the release of Alexa Custom Assistant, built directly on Alexa's technology, that would let firms create their own intelligent assistants. Fiat Chrysler Automobiles is the first Alexa Custom Assistant customer and has already started planning FCA-branded assistant's development. Alexa Custom Assistant is available in select countries, including Japan, India, Italy and Brazil.

news_headline: Amazon accused of colluding with publishers to raise e-book prices by 30%
news_article: A lawsuit filed against Amazon on Thursday alleged that the e-commerce platform entered into anticompetitive pricing agreements in 2015 with major publishers that allowed them to illegally increase e-book prices by 30%. The publishers named were Hachette, HarperCollins, Macmillan, Penguin Random House, and Simon & Schuster. Apple was found guilty of colluding with the same five publishers in 2013.

news_headline: Hardik, Krunal Pandya's father dies due to heart attack, Krunal leaves SMAT bio-bubble
news_article: Cricketers Hardik Pandya and Krunal Pandya's father Himanshu Pandya passed away due to a heart attack this morning. Baroda captain Krunal has left the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) bio-bubble in order to be with his family. Krunal wouldn't be taking part in the remaining matches of the tournament, Baroda Cricket Association (BCA) CEO Shishir Hattangadi told ANI.

news_headline: I felt naked, SCG guard told me to 'go where you belong': Indian fan on racial abuse
news_article: Sydney-based Team India fan Krishna Kumar has claimed he was racially profiled and abused during Sydney Test. He added a security guard told him to "go back where you belong". He further said he was targeted after attempting to bring four anti-racism banners into the ground. "I want justice. I want accountability. I was feeling stripped and naked," he added.

news_headline: Siraj faces abuse in Brisbane, video of crowd calling him 'grub' goes viral
news_article: Team India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj was repeatedly labelled a "grub" by a group of fans at the Gabba on the first day of the fourth Australia-India Test. "Siraj, give us a wave, give us a wave, give us a wave. Siraj, you bloody grub," a fan was heard saying in a viral video. Washington Sundar was reportedly also targeted.

news_headline: Rohit bowls a medium-pace ball to complete injured Saini's over, Karthik trolls him
news_article: Team India vice-captain Rohit Sharma bowled one medium-pace delivery to complete fast bowler Navdeep Saini's over after the latter got injured. Dinesh Karthik took to Twitter to troll him by using 'The Flash' GIF and wrote, "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami...better watch out, new fast bowler in the wings (Rohit Sharma) #absolutelyrapid."

news_headline: Arjun Tendulkar makes debut for senior Mumbai team at the age of 21, takes 1 wicket
news_article: Former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar on Friday made his debut for senior Mumbai team at the age of 21. Arjun featured in Mumbai's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match against Haryana. The left-arm fast bowler registered figures of 3-0-34-1. He dismissed Haryana opener Chaitanya Bishnoi for four runs off nine deliveries.

news_headline: Only 2 Indian players have played all the 4 Tests in series against Australia
news_article: Team India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara are the only two players who have featured in each of the four Tests in the ongoing series against Australia. India made four changes to their side for the fourth Test, fielding two debutants (Washington Sundar and T Natarajan). India had made two changes in the third Test from second Test.

news_headline: Just zip it: Warne, Waugh to Pant for chattering when bowler is about to bowl
news_article: Ex-Australian cricketers Mark Waugh and Shane Warne have criticised India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant for his "constant chatter" behind the stumps. "You’ve got to zip it [when a bowler is about to bowl]. I think...umpires have got to take some control in these situations," Waugh said. Warne said Pant should let batsmen concentrate when the bowler is starting to come in.

news_headline: Greg Chappell writes open letter to Tim Paine after he called Ashwin a 'd**khead'
news_article: After Australia captain Tim Paine was criticised for his behaviour in Sydney Test wherein he called Ravichandran Ashwin a 'd**khead', Greg Chappell wrote an open letter to him. "Best teams...I played with and against didn't use their mouths as weapons," he wrote. "Abuse isn't acceptable in any workplace and talk...in my opinion...is cheap. It doesn't show one's strength," he added.

news_headline: Rohit, Rahane laugh at Rishabh Pant after loud and failed appeal, video goes viral
news_article: During the 84th over of Australia's first innings in Brisbane Test, India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant started appealing for caught behind despite the batsman not having edged the ball. However, Pant did not receive any support from the slip cordon. Ajinkya Rahane and Rohit Sharma were seen laughing at Pant as he tried to convince the captain to take DRS.

news_headline: Prithvi Shaw hits Rohit Sharma with a stray throw, gets trolled after video goes viral
news_article: Team India vice-captain Rohit Sharma was hit on his fingers with a stray throw by substitute fielder Prithvi Shaw during the first day of the Brisbane Test. Reacting to a video shared by Cricket Australia, a fan tweeted, "Shaw trying to find a place in playing XI." "Shaw to Rohit: Na khelunga, na khelne dunga," wrote another.

news_headline: He was a full of life person: Kohli condoles demise of Pandya brothers' father
news_article: India captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to condole the demise of Himanshu Pandya, the father of Hardik Pandya and Krunal Pandya. "Heartbroken to hear about the demise of Hardik and Krunal's dad. Spoke to him a couple of times, looked a joyful and full of life person. May his soul rest in peace. Stay strong you two," Kohli wrote.

news_headline: 'At least you’ll play one game': Lyon recalls father's reaction to Test debut
news_article: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon, who is currently playing his 100th Test, recalled the reaction his father had to the news that his son would play a Test for Australia back in 2011. "I called mum and dad...I said, 'Dad you won’t believe this...I'm making my debut.' He goes, 'That’s all right, at least you’ll play one game'," Lyon said.

news_headline: Australia end Day 1 of Brisbane Test at 274/5 as Labuschagne slams hundred
news_article: Australia ended the first day of the Brisbane Test against India at 274/5. Marnus Labuschagne smashed 108 runs off 204 balls, which is his fifth Test hundred. Team India debutants T Natarajan and Washington Sundar picked up three wickets between themselves. Meanwhile, fast bowler Navdeep Saini complained of pain in his groin and is currently being monitored.

news_headline: Azharuddeen's bucket list at his house goes viral after his 37-ball hundred in a T20
news_article: A picture of Kerala opener Mohammed Azharuddeen's bucket list at his house has gone viral after he smashed a 37-ball hundred in a T20 match against Mumbai. "IPL, four hundreds in a Ranji season, own house, Benz, 2023 World Cup," his bucket list read. Azharuddeen's 37-ball hundred is the joint-third fastest ton by an Indian in T20 cricket history.

news_headline: 52-year-old rider dies while being airlifted to France after Dakar Rally crash
news_article: French motorcycle rider Pierre Cherpin has died five days after crashing during the seventh stage of Dakar Rally, organisers said on Friday. The 52-year-old, who was taking part in his fourth Dakar Rally, had undergone neurosurgery and was placed in a medically-induced coma after the crash in Saudi Arabia. He was being airlifted to France when he breathed his last.

news_headline: Australia's XI in Brisbane Test have taken 1,033 wickets, India's XI just 13 wickets
news_article: The ongoing Brisbane match is the first instance of a Test wherein a playing XI with a tally of fewer than 100 wickets is playing against an opposition with 1,000-plus wickets. India XI had taken just 13 wickets between them before Brisbane Test, while Australia XI had taken 1,033. India XI's tally is the lowest since Lord's Test in 1946.

news_headline: Natarajan did better than what was expected from him: Zaheer Khan
news_article: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan said debutant pacer T Natarajan did better than what was expected from him with his two-wicket haul on the first day of the Brisbane Test against Australia. "He didn't try to do too much extra. He just kept on bowling according to his strengths, in the areas we have generally seen him bowl," Zaheer added.

news_headline: Staying throughout Test series helped me improve my skills: Washington Sundar
news_article: Spinner Washington Sundar, who made his Test debut at The Gabba against Australia and dismissed Steve Smith on the first day of the fourth Test, said that staying with Team India during the first three Tests helped him improve his skills. "The facilities over here, the wicket over here, everything I felt...helped me get better with my skills," he stated.

news_headline: US Olympic medallist Klete Keller, arrested over Capitol riot, released from custody
news_article: US Olympic swimming gold medallist Klete Keller, who was arrested after being charged for participating in the attack on US Capitol by President Donald Trump supporters, has been released from federal custody. Keller was caught on camera among the rioters wearing his Olympics jacket. Keller participated in the Olympics in 2000, 2004 and 2008 and won five medals.

news_headline: Hanuma Vihari, who was ruled out of 4th Test due to injury, leaves for India
news_article: India batsman Hanuma Vihari, who was ruled out of the ongoing Brisbane Test due to a Grade 2 tear on his hamstring, left Australia on Friday. Vihari had picked the injury soon after he walked to bat during India's second innings at Sydney. He remained unbeaten at 23 after facing 161 balls to help India draw the match.

news_headline: Natarajan's story is what dreams are made of: Sehwag
news_article: After T Natarajan made his Test debut in the fourth Test against Australia and dismissed Marnus Labuschagne and Matthew Wade, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said 29-year-old's story is what dreams are made of. Natarajan made his ODI debut earlier in the tour replacing injured Navdeep Saini and then played in the three T20Is picking six wickets, replacing injured Varun Chakravarthy.

news_headline: Doesn't matter who's bowling, Indian bowling attacks are disciplined: Labuschagne
news_article: Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne, who scored 108 runs on the first day of the fourth Test, praised Team India's bowling attack for not giving away too many loose balls. "Doesn't matter who is bowling...They're very planned and strategic...They were pretty disciplined early and didn't give us many scoring opportunities in that first session," he added.

news_headline: Very surprised Kuldeep not playing Brisbane Test: Ajit Agarkar
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said he was "very surprised" by Kuldeep Yadav's omission from Team India's playing XI for the fourth Test against Australia in Brisbane. "Going with five bowlers, Washington Sundar playing as an all-rounder...Why not have another spinner? Gives you better balance in the attack...If the pitch flattens out and there isn't much for the quicks," he stated.

news_headline: Wayne Rooney retires from playing to become Derby County manager
news_article: England and Manchester United all-time record goalscorer Wayne Rooney has retired from playing to become Derby County's manager. Rooney has been Derby's acting interim manager since November but has now been given a two-and-a-half-year contract to take on the role permanently. The 35-year-old had moved to Derby last year in a player-coach role and scored seven goals in 35 matches.

news_headline: No need to play Bumrah in all 4 Tests vs Eng, need to look after him: Gambhir
news_article: After India pacer Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out of the Brisbane Test due to an abdominal strain, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said there's no need to play Bumrah in all four upcoming Tests against England at home in February-March. He added that it's important to look after him for India's tour of England and the T20 World Cup.

news_headline: Secret Service used porta-potty, Obama's toilet after being barred by Ivanka: Reports
news_article: US Secret Service has been paying $3,000/month since 2017 for an apartment near Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner's home in Washington to provide toilet facilities to agents protecting the couple, Washington Post reported. The report added Ivanka had barred them to use toilets at her home. Officials earlier resorted to a porta-potty, as well as bathroom of Barack Obama's home.

news_headline: Netherlands govt resigns after families wrongly accused of child welfare fraud
news_article: Netherlands PM Mark Rutte's government resigned on Friday after thousands of families were wrongly accused of child welfare fraud and told to repay the money. The action by tax authorities forced several families into financial hardship. The government will remain in place in a caretaker capacity until parliamentary elections in March but tax minister Eric Wiebes quit with immediate effect.

news_headline: Pigeon thought to have come from US not to be killed in Australia due to fake leg band
news_article: A pigeon that Australia declared a biosecurity risk won't be killed after a US bird organisation declared its identifying leg band was fake. The band suggested the bird found in Melbourne on December 26 was a racing pigeon that had left Oregon, 13,000 kilometres away, two months earlier. However, the band number belongs to a blue bar pigeon in US.

news_headline: Foreign students start campaign to return to Aus amid border closures
news_article: International students have urged Australian lawmakers in an official petition to exempt them from border closures citing "bad quality" online lessons and lack of schooling for some students. The petition has received nearly 3,000 signatures. It requires 12,000 signatures from Australian residents or citizens before February 10 for it to be tabled before lawmakers for a discussion.

news_headline: COVID-19 cases in Germany cross 20 lakh-mark as 22,368 test positive
news_article: The total cases of coronavirus in Germany crossed 20 lakh-mark as 22,368 people tested positive on Friday, Robert Koch Institute data showed. The coronavirus death toll in the country has risen to 44,994. This comes a day after German Chancellor Angela Merkel told top officials from her party that she wants "very fast action" to combat the spread of coronavirus.

news_headline: Not ruling out immunisation passports if situation changes: WHO
news_article: Michael Ryan, director of World Health Organization's health emergencies programme, on Friday said that WHO has not ruled out the possibility of introducing immunisation passports for international travel, if the situation with COVID-19 changes. Ryan said that until more data and vaccines are available, WHO does not feel it necessary to introduce additional barriers to the movement of people.

news_headline: UK will close all travel corridors from Monday: PM Johnson
news_article: UK PM Boris Johnson said that the country would close all travel corridors from Monday to "protect against the risk of as yet unidentified new strains". He added that UK would require all incoming passengers to test negative for COVID-19 within 72 hours of departure. The new rules would be in place until at least February 15, Johnson further said.

news_headline: Global coronavirus death toll exceeds 20 lakh mark
news_article: The death toll from coronavirus across the world rose to over 20 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US has reported the highest coronavirus deaths globally at over 3.9 lakh, followed by Brazil at 2,08,246 and India at 1,51,918, the tracker showed. COVID-19 has killed more people than malaria and tuberculosis combined in the past year.

news_headline: Brazil's Amazonas state running out of oxygen amid rise in COVID-19 deaths
news_article: Hospitals in Brazilian state of Amazonas are running out of oxygen amid rise in COVID-19 deaths, its government said on Thursday. Amazonas Congressman Marcelo Ramos said the state has appealed to US to send a military transport plane to the capital city Manaus with oxygen cylinders. According to media reports, people on respirators were dying due to suffocation in hospitals.

news_headline: US Olympic medallist Klete Keller, arrested over Capitol riot, released from custody
news_article: US Olympic swimming gold medallist Klete Keller, who was arrested after being charged for participating in the attack on US Capitol by President Donald Trump supporters, has been released from federal custody. Keller was caught on camera among the rioters wearing his Olympics jacket. Keller participated in the Olympics in 2000, 2004 and 2008 and won five medals.

news_headline: Far-right activists got bitcoins worth $500k before US Capitol violence: Report
news_article: Bitcoin payments worth more than $500,000 were made to 22 different virtual wallets, most of them belonging to far-right activists and internet personalities in the US, before the US Capitol violence, cryptocurrency compliance startup Chainalysis said on Friday. The startup added that it has "strong evidence"  that the donor was a "now-deceased computer programmer based in France".

news_headline: Indian-American Garima Verma named Digital Director to Jill Biden
news_article: Indian-American Garima Verma has been named as the Digital Director to incoming US First Lady Jill Biden, the Biden transition announced. Verma, who was born in India, had served as Audience Development and Content Strategist on the Biden-Harris campaign. "I'm honored and excited to serve as the Digital Director for our incredible First Lady Jill Biden," Verma tweeted.

news_headline: Palestinian Prez announces elections for first time in over 14 years
news_article: Palestine has announced its first round of parliamentary, presidential and National Council elections after a span of over 14 years. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas issued a decree on Friday ordering national elections be held within the next seven months, hence parliamentary elections will be held on May 22, presidential polls on July 31 and National Council polls on August 31.

news_headline: Search for crashed Indonesian plane's victims, other materials extended by 3 days
news_article: Indonesia's National Search and Rescue Agency (BASARNAS) has extended search for victims, cockpit voice recorder and other materials of Sriwijaya Air jet that had crashed into Java sea last week, for another three days till January 18. As many as 130 divers have been deployed for the search and rescue operations, BASARNAS' Operations Director Rasman MS said.

news_headline: Lawmakers could face prosecution for aiding Capitol riots: Pelosi
news_article: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has said that members of Congress may face prosecution if they have "aided and abetted" the Capitol riots. Pelosi's comments came after Democratic Representative Mikie Sherrill said she saw Congress members leading groups on "reconnaissance" tours of the Capitol on January 5. US President Donald Trump's supporters had stormed the Capitol building on January 6.

news_headline: COVID-19 vaccines may be too risky for elderly, terminally ill: Norway
news_article: Following the death of 23 people shortly after receiving their first shot, Norway warned that COVID-19 vaccines might be too risky for elderly and terminally ill people. "For those with the most severe frailty, even relatively mild vaccine side effects can have serious consequences," it added. About 33,000 people have received COVID-19 vaccines in Norway so far.

news_headline: China possibly committed 'genocide' against Uighur Muslims: US Report
news_article: A US Congressional Commission report said that China may have committed "genocide" against Uighurs and other minority Muslims in its Xinjiang region. "New evidence has also emerged of a systematic and widespread policy of forced sterilisation and birth suppression of the Uighur and other minority populations," the report stated. It also accused China of harassing Uighurs in the US.

news_headline: US imposes sanctions on 7 entities for working with Iran Shipping Lines
news_article: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo announced sanctions on seven entities and two individuals for working with Iran Shipping Lines, which is already under US sanctions. He added that US has also sanctioned three Iranian entities over conventional arms proliferation. Pompeo further said that he has expanded "metals-related sanctions targeting Iran's nuclear, military, and ballistic missile programs".

news_headline: Indonesia recovers data from crashed plane's flight recorder
news_article: Indonesia investigators said that they've successfully recovered data from the Sriwijaya Air jet's flight recorder that crashed into the sea on Saturday with 62 people on board. The recorder could help investigators figure out why the aircraft plunged about 10,000 feet in less than a minute before crashing into the sea. The search for the cockpit recorder is still underway.

news_headline: Indonesia earthquake kills at least 35, injures hundreds
news_article: At least 35 people died and hundreds were injured in a powerful earthquake on Indonesia's Sulawesi island on Friday. Thousands fled their homes for higher ground when the magnitude 6.2-quake struck 6 km northeast of the town of Majene. The aftershocks damaged more than 300 homes and two hotels, as well as flattening a hospital and a government building.

news_headline: 3 Houthi drones intercepted in Yemen by Saudi-led coalition
news_article: The Saudi-led coalition fighting Houthis in Yemen said it had intercepted and destroyed three explosive-laden drones launched by Iran-aligned Houthi movement towards Saudi Arabia, state media reported. These drones were launched from Yemen's port city of Hodeidah, state news agency SPA said. Meanwhile, Houthi-run Almasirah TV said the coalition had conducted airstrikes on Yemen's Sana'a.

news_headline: All countries must stand united against China's detentions: Trudeau
news_article: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Thursday called on countries across the world to stand united against China's detentions of foreign citizens and its "coercive diplomacy". "We must all stand together because who knows whose citizens might be next?" Trudeau added. China has detained two Canadians, former diplomat Michael Kovrig and businessman Michael Spavor, over suspicion of espionage.

news_headline: Hong Kong internet provider admits blocking pro-democracy website
news_article: Hong Kong Broadband Network (HKBN) has become the first internet service provider to admit blocking pro-democracy website HKChronicles under Beijing's National Security Law. South China Morning Post reported that HKBN had "complied with an official request" to disable customers' access to HKChronicles, which contained information related to the 2019 unrest in protest of the National Security Law.

news_headline: Facebook blocks creating of events near White House on Inauguration Day
news_article: Facebook has said it won't let users create events that take place "in close proximity" to White House, US Capitol building, or any state capitol buildings throughout the Inauguration Day. Facebook also said that it would block non-US accounts from creating any event in US, especially near the Capitol, which witnessed a violent attack on January 6 by Trump supporters.

news_headline: Nobody is above law: Maharashtra minister after son-in-law's arrest by NCB
news_article: A day after the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) arrested his son-in-law in a drug case, Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Nawab Malik said nobody is above the law and the law should be applied without any discrimination. Without mentioning the arrest, Malik tweeted, "Law will take its due course and justice will prevail. I respect and have immense faith in our judiciary."

news_headline: Around 50 TMC MLAs to join BJP next month, claims Dilip Ghosh
news_article: West Bengal BJP chief Dilip Ghosh on Wednesday said "at least 50 TMC MLAs will join the BJP next month". He was responding to West Bengal minister Jyotipriya Mallick who had claimed six-seven BJP MPs will soon join TMC. "I ask Mallick babu to persuade even one booth president to join his party, and I'll accept his claim," Ghosh added.

news_headline: Chandrababu Naidu burns Andhra govt orders on farmers in Bhogi bonfire
news_article: TDP President N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday burnt Andhra Pradesh government orders in Bhogi bonfire. The orders were related to fixing meters to pump set motors, zero-interest loans scheme and selection of farmers on basis of caste for welfare schemes, the ANI reported. Bhogi is part of the Pongal festival in which useless household articles are put in the bonfire.

news_headline: 41 TMC MLAs want to join us in WB: BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya
news_article: Ahead of the West Bengal Assembly elections this year, BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said, "I have a list of 41 MLAs who want to join BJP. If I take these legislators in BJP's fold, the Mamata Banerjee government will fall." He added, "We have decided that among these legislators, we will not take those whose image is not good."

news_headline: BS Hooda, Surjewala detained during march to Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh
news_article: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda and Congress General Secretary Randeep Surjewala were among the several Congress leaders who were detained on Friday while marching towards Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh in protest against the farm laws. "We're not afraid of going to jail. No matter how many times we are put in jail, the government cannot stop us," Hooda said.

news_headline: Tell us why Indira Gandhi labelled Punjabis as Khalistanis: Harsimrat to Rahul
news_article: SAD leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal criticised Congress' Rahul Gandhi after he showed support for farmers by participating in protests in Delhi. Kaur tweeted, "Before...crying crocodile tears at why Punjabis (are) being called Khalistanis, you should tell why your grandmother (Indira Gandhi) used same words for Punjabis, why your father got them slaughtered and why you labelled them as drug addicts?"

news_headline: Do you know what's more dangerous than coronavirus? It's BJP: Nusrat Jahan
news_article: While addressing people at an event in West Bengal's Basirhat, actress-turned-TMC MP Nusrat Jahan said, "Do you know what is more dangerous than corona? It is the BJP." Adding that the party doesn't understand "humanity" and "culture", Jahan said, "They (BJP) turn people against each other on the basis of religion and trigger riots."

news_headline: BSP to contest 2022 UP, Uttarakhand assembly elections on its own
news_article: BSP chief Mayawati has announced that the party will not forge any alliance for the upcoming Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand, adding, "The party will contest the elections in all Assembly constituencies on its own." Mayawati further announced that the BSP will provide COVID-19 vaccines to everyone free of cost in UP if it wins the Assembly elections.

news_headline: Cong called Jallikattu cruel: BJP leader on Rahul's TN visit for event
news_article: Commenting on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's visit to Madurai, BJP leader CT Ravi said that Congress in 2011 wanted to ban Jallikattu, and today he is in Tamil Nadu to watch Jallikattu. "Your Govt in 2011 labelled Jallikattu as cruel & barbaric," Ravi said. Gandhi had said he will witness Jallikattu to lend 'moral support' to protesting farmers in Delhi.

news_headline: Make national song compulsory in BMC-run schools: BJP corporator
news_article: BJP corporator Prabhakar Shinde has written a letter to Mayor Kishori Pednekar to immediately clear the proposal making the singing of national song Vande Mataram compulsory in all schools run by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). BJP further alleged that Shiv Sena is not taking the proposal seriously to appease its alliance partners, Congress and NCP.

news_headline: Ask high command: K'taka CM to BJP MLAs discontent over cabinet expansion
news_article: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Thursday said that BJP leaders, who are airing their discontent about missing out on a cabinet berth, to take up the matter with the national leadership. Earlier, some BJP leaders had accused the CM of including only those in his cabinet, who had "blackmailed" him or were in his inner circle.

news_headline: BJP names 4 candidates for biennial UP Legislative Council polls
news_article: BJP on Friday announced the names of four candidates for the upcoming biennial elections for the 12 Legislative Council seats in Uttar Pradesh, which will fall vacant on January 30, 2021. "The central election committee of the BJP has approved the names of Swatantra Dev Singh, Dr Dinesh Sharma, Laxman Prasad Acharya and Arvind Kumar Sharma as candidates," it stated.

news_headline: Will help BJP win in Bengal, UP: Sakshi Maharaj takes a dig at Owaisi
news_article: BJP MP Sakshi Maharaj on Wednesday took a dig at AIMIM Chief Asaduddin Owaisi and said that he helped the party in Bihar polls and will also help them win assembly elections in two major states. "May God give him [Owaisi] strength. He helped us in Bihar and will help in Uttar Pradesh and...in West Bengal too," he stated.

news_headline: I was with TMC and will remain with TMC: MP Satabdi Roy
news_article: Bengal's TMC MP Satabdi Roy said on Friday that she isn't going to Delhi and she "was with TMC and will remain with TMC". This comes after Roy had meeting with party leader and CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee. Roy had earlier said that she's not being informed about party events in her Birbhum constituency, leaving her "mentally pained".

news_headline: BJP's Faridkot district chief resigns, joins Akali Dal
news_article: Vijay Chhabra, the BJP president of Punjab's Faridkot district, quit the party on Wednesday to join the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) in the presence of SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal. Chhabra said, "I have quit the party to express my support to farmers and Punjabiyat." He quit the BJP ahead of the municipal polls in Punjab.

news_headline: AK Sharma, Gujarat cadre IAS officer who took VRS, joins BJP
news_article: Former Gujarat cadre IAS officer Arvind Kumar Sharma, on Thursday joined BJP in Uttar Pradesh, days after he took voluntary retirement. Sharma served as the secretary in the MSME Ministry in the Modi government after his six-year-long stint at the Prime Minister's Office. "I will always remain grateful to PM Modi," AK Sharma said after joining BJP.

news_headline: Will withdraw Republic Day procession if SC orders: Farmer leader
news_article: National spokesperson of Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) Rakesh Tikait on Friday said, "If the Supreme Court will order, farmers would not hold the proposed parade on Republic Day." He added, "We would conduct the rally on some different day." Earlier, BKU had said that the farmers will take out a procession from Red Fort to India Gate on Republic Day.

news_headline: Mark my words, Centre will be forced to repeal farm laws: Rahul
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday alleged that the government is "conspiring to destroy" farmers and wants to give what belongs to them to "two-three of their friends". "Mark my words...these laws...the government will be forced to take them back. Remember what I said," he added. Rahul further said that he is proud of what the farmers are doing.

news_headline: Cong holds nationwide protests against farm laws, observes 'Kisan Adhikar Diwas'
news_article: Congress party on Friday observed 'Kisan Adhikar Diwas' and held nationwide protests outside Governor houses against the farm laws and to show solidarity with the protesting farmers. "We demand that the government should repeal these laws. We and farmers are not going to withdraw the protest till...the demands of the farmers are met," senior Congress leader KC Venugopal said.

news_headline: Central government should withdraw farm laws now: Akhilesh Yadav
news_article: Former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that Centre should withdraw the new farm laws following the Supreme Court's decision to stay its implementation till further orders. The Samajwadi Party chief added that it was the responsibility of BJP government to provide MSP to the farmers as it had promised that it would double the farmers' income by 2024.

news_headline: Govt misled SC and people of India on 3 farm laws: Congress
news_article: Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi has said that the Centre has misled the Supreme Court and people of India regarding the pre-legislative consultations with various stakeholders on the three farm laws. Singhvi added that this amounted to contempt of court after a response to an RTI query made it clear that no consultations were held before enacting the farm laws.

news_headline: Cong always abused patriots: Pragya on Digvijaya calling Godse 'terrorist'
news_article: After Congress leader Digvijaya Singh called Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse "first terrorist", BJP MP Pragya Thakur said, "Congress has always abused the patriots." She added, "He has said 'Bhagwa aatank' (Saffron terror), what can be worse than this?" Singh's remark came after Hindu Mahasabha opened a study centre dedicated to Godse in MP's Gwalior.

news_headline: Don't hold pro-farm laws events: Amit Shah to H'yana govt after Karnal violence
news_article: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has asked the Haryana government to refrain from holding pro-farm laws events or outreach programmes in the state until further notice, according to state Education Minister Kanwar Pal. Earlier, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's event, 'Kisan Mahapanchayat', was cancelled as protesting farmers had vandalised the venue in Karnal on Sunday.

news_headline: BJP without Raje, Cong without Gehlot can't be imagined in Raj: Cong MLA
news_article: Congress MLA and Rajasthan's Industry Minister, Parsadi Lal Meena, has said that BJP without Vasundhara Raje is "zero" and Congress can't be "imagined" without Ashok Gehlot in the state. "They [Raje, Gehlot] have their own popularity...which cannot be snatched away from them. Neither Kirodi Lal Meena nor Sachin Pilot can have much impact," he added.

news_headline: Rumours of Bihar ministers being involved in IndiGo manager's murder: Tejashwi
news_article: Leader of Opposition in Bihar and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, in a Facebook live on Friday said that there are rumours of ministers in state government being involved in the murder of the IndiGo airlines manager Rupesh Kumar Singh. Singh was shot dead by unidentified bike-borne men in the Punaichak area of Patna on January 12.

news_headline: 69-yr-old actress trolled as people call her pics 'too sexy', says 'Was termed a sl*t"
news_article: Actress and ex-Bigg Boss Malayalam contestant Rajini Chandy has addressed criticism over her recent photoshoot, which some people trolled for being "too sexy". The 69-year-old housewife-turned-actress shared pictures shot by Kerala-based photographer Athira Joy. "I was called a sl*t. Someone asked me, 'Haven't you died yet?' Another suggested...I 'sit at home and read the Bible'," she told BBC.

news_headline: John Abraham shares pic showing veins on his muscular arm, fan calls it 'Google Maps'
news_article: Actor John Abraham reposted a picture on Instagram of his muscular arm shared by 'Satyameva Jayate 2' director Milap Zaveri. "Yeh haath nahi, John Abraham ka hathoda hai!" Zaveri captioned the picture. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "Google Maps", while another commented, "You have really good veins to do a blood test from." Meanwhile, Tiger Shroff wrote, "Insaneee."

news_headline: Priyanka never made us feel she was the biggest star on set: Co-star Rajkummar
news_article: Sharing his experience of working with Priyanka Chopra in the upcoming film 'The White Tiger', Rajkummar Rao said, "Priyanka is phenomenal." "She's...a global star who never made us feel she was the biggest star on our set," he added. "It's fun to work with great actors as it enhances your performance and Priyanka did just that to me," said Rajkummar.

news_headline: Robert De Niro joins Christian Bale in David O Russell's next film
news_article: Hollywood actor Robert De Niro will star in David O Russell's upcoming movie along with actors Mike Myers, Timothy Olyphant, Michael Shannon, Chris Rock, and Anya Taylor-Joy. The previously announced cast includes actors Christian Bale, Margot Robbie and John David Washington. According to The Hollywood Reporter, the filmmaker will be directing the movie from his own script.

news_headline: I was told TV actors come with baggage: Kritika on facing bias
news_article: Actress Kritika Kamra, who shared screen space with Saif Ali Khan in the web series 'Tandav', spoke about facing bias because of her television background and said, "I've...been told that TV actors come with certain baggage." She added, "I'm okay to go out there and prove myself as many times as I need to...I'll still say that I've been fortunate."

news_headline: 'Parasite' director Bong Joon Ho to head Venice Film Festival jury
news_article: South Korean filmmaker Bong Joon Ho, who directed the 2019 film 'Parasite', has been selected as jury president of the 78th Venice International Film Festival, organizers announced on Friday. "As president of the jury, and more importantly as a perpetual cinephile, I'm ready to admire and applaud...the great films selected by the festival," the Oscar-winner said in a statement.

news_headline: Don't want to go to Big B with 'Sarkar' for 4th time: Ram Gopal Varma
news_article: During a recent interview, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma mentioned that he is not planning on adding a fourth film to his 'Sarkar' franchise with Amitabh Bachchan. "I'd rather do something new, and explore a genre with...Bachchan that I haven't done before. I don't want to go...to him to do Sarkar for the fourth time," he told The Times of India.

news_headline: Author of Didda's biography accuses Kangana of copyright infringement
news_article: 'Didda: The Warrior Queen of Kashmir' author Ashish Kaul has accused Kangana Ranaut of "blatantly violating his sole rights" after she announced film 'Manikarnika Returns: The Legend Of Didda'. He claimed he has "exclusive copyrights to...life story of Didda". "No historian, apart from Kalhan who wrote...two pages, and me, who...spent six years on research, have information on her," he added.

news_headline: Feels great: Vidya on short film 'Natkhat' reaching Oscar 2021 race
news_article: Speaking about her short film 'Natkhat' entering the race for the Academy Awards 2021's Best Short Film (Live Action) category, actress Vidya Balan said, "It feels great to have our film qualify for the Oscars." The actress who starred in the film and co-produced it, said, "This film is incredibly close to me."

news_headline: Randeep to play real-life cop in debut web series Inspector Avinash
news_article: Actor Randeep Hooda is set to make his web series debut with a show titled 'Inspector Avinash'. The actor has also begun shooting for the series, which is inspired by the life of police officer Avinash Mishra. Talking about the show, Randeep said, "Portraying a super cop like Avinash...is exciting and challenging...I'm thrilled to start the year with this series."

news_headline: FIR registered against Bobby's 'Aashram' in Rajasthan under SC/ST Act
news_article: An FIR against Bobby Deol's web series 'Aashram' has been registered in Rajasthan's Jodhpur for allegedly promoting discrimination against Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe. The case was registered under relevant sections of SC/ST Act, 1989, after the complainant raised objections regarding the "negative portrayal" of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the first episode of the series.

news_headline: Paresh Rawal to complete Rishi's role in his last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'
news_article: Actor Paresh Rawal has been roped in to complete the remaining portions of Rishi Kapoor's role in 'Sharmaji Namkeen', film trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted. The shoot of the film was left incomplete after Rishi passed away in April last year. The Hitesh Bhatia directorial film is scheduled to release on Rishi Kapoor's birth anniversary, 4th September.

news_headline: We took risks, we believed in our story: Hansal Mehta on 'Scam 1992'
news_article: While speaking about the performance of his web series 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story', Hansal Mehta said, "We knew we were making something special...with a lot of courage and conviction." He further mentioned that the audience's response was "overwhelming", and added, "We took risks, we believed in our story...and gave a lot of ourselves to make this show."

news_headline: Had no plans of becoming an actress when I moved to Mumbai: Divya
news_article: Divya Khosla Kumar has said when she moved to Mumbai, she had no intention of joining the film industry. "I had not planned on becoming an actress, a director or...producer. I think it all happened spontaneously," she added. "I'm extremely hard working so my only intention was to...grow in my career...I'm...happy and proud of my journey so far," said Divya.

news_headline: Prakash Raj to feature in Aishwarya Rai starrer 'Ponniyin Selvan'
news_article: Actor Prakash Raj has joined the cast of filmmaker Mani Ratnam's upcoming multi-starrer film 'Ponniyin Selvan', which also stars Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. "On the sets of Mani Ratnam's Ponniyin Selvan. A journey with the master, which started 25 years back from Iruvar, continues," Prakash tweeted. The film also stars Karthi, Chiyaan Vikram, Aishwarya Lekshmi, Mohan Babu and Jayam Ravi.

news_headline: I pre-shot something already: Lisa Kudrow on 'Friends' reunion
news_article: Actress Lisa Kudrow, who played Phoebe Buffay in 'Friends', revealed that she has already started filming for the reunion special and mentioned, "There are different facets to it, and we already shot packages of things." She added during her appearance on Rob Lowe's podcast, "I pre-shot something for it already so we're definitely doing it...I already shot a little something."

news_headline: Rajeev Masand joins Johar's Dharma Cornerstone Agency as COO, Kangana reacts
news_article: Journalist and film critic Rajeev Masand has joined Karan Johar's talent management agency Dharma Cornerstone as Chief Operating Officer (COO). Johar had announced the venture in December last year in partnership with Bunty Sajdeh. Reacting to the news, Kangana Ranaut tweeted, "Even as a journalist he (Rajeev) was always KJO minion. Good he left journo facade and joined KJO officially."

news_headline: Mama bear is the best: Twinkle on Dimple's performance in 'Tandav'
news_article: Commenting on her mother Dimple Kapadia's performance in the web series 'Tandav', Twinkle Khanna wrote on Instagram, "Mother is...bloody good at what she does." Praising the show's other cast members, she tweeted, "Saif [Ali Khan] is in fine form and so are Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub, Sunil Grover and Kumud Mishra...But...mama bear is still the best and that's my biased opinion."

news_headline: I'm 68 and a half: Liam Neeson on retiring from action films
news_article: Hollywood actor Liam Neeson revealed that he is planning on retiring from the action genre and added, "I'm 68 and a half. 69 this [June]." He told ET Online, "There's a couple more [action films] I'm going to do this year...I think that'll probably be it." Liam added, "I love doing them. I love beating up guys half my age."

news_headline: Was replaced as lead actor thought someone else is better looking: Aahana
news_article: Aahana Kumra has revealed that she was once replaced in a film because the lead actor thought someone else is better looking or more worthy for the part. When asked how she copes up with the rejections and replacements, she said her mantra is "live and learn". "This is an uncertain industry and this only works on fate," Aahana added.

news_headline: Quitting 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' was like being born again: Hina
news_article: Actress Hina Khan has said quitting the show, 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', was like being "born again". "I'd to start again from the beginning, how I'm supposed to look, what I'm supposed to wear and say," she added. "Now things have changed, people's perceptions have changed. Now I'm given equal importance like other Bollywood celebs," Hina further said.

news_headline: My entire journey has been special: Kiara on B'wood journey
news_article: Speaking about her journey in the Hindi film industry, Kiara Advani said her entire journey has been special. "For me, I think every film mattered, right from my first film because that's what gave me my first step into...film industry," Kiara said, adding, "People...say 'Kabir Singh' and 'Lust Stories' but every film has been a turning point in my life."

news_headline: Akshay plays volleyball with soldiers on Army Day, shares video
news_article: On the occasion of Army Day, actor Akshay Kumar shared a video of himself playing volleyball with men from the Indian Army. He wrote, "Had the pleasure of meeting some of our bravehearts today to flag off a marathon on...#ArmyDay and what better way to warm up than a quick game of volleyball." India is celebrating 73rd Army Day today.

news_headline: TV actor Mohit Malik tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Actor Mohit Malik, who stars in show 'Lockdown Ki Lovestory', has tested positive for coronavirus. He shared the news on Friday and informed his fans that his pregnant wife Addite Malik is "fortunately safe". "I request all those who were in touch with me...to exercise caution and take...necessary tests if any symptoms show or even otherwise, as...safety measure," he wrote.

news_headline: Aprilia SXR 160 is here to maximise your life: Piaggio India
news_article: The all-new Aprilia SXR 160 brings together a premium combination of style, performance and extraordinary comfort for an unbelievable riding experience, the company mentioned. Designed in Italy for India, it represents the new Aprilia design philosophy. Here's a ride that will transform your everyday experiences and lead you to maximise every one of them, the company added.

news_headline: The all-new Volvo S60 is designed to help save lives: Volvo
news_article: Every car, Volvo said, is made to give people the journey of their lives while preparing them for every surprise on the way. The latest luxury sedan, the Volvo S60, lets you rediscover the thrill of driving, be it inside or outside, it is designed to help save lives while helping us keep our promise, it further mentioned.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: Who are the three directors in Tesla's new Indian subsidiary?
news_article: Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, David Jon Feinstein and Venkatrangam Sreeram as directors in its newly-registered Indian subsidiary, Tesla India Motors and Energy. While Taneja is Tesla's Chief Accounting Officer, Feinstein is Senior Director, Global Trade & New Markets. Sreeram is a Bengaluru entrepreneur who has co-founded automotive tech companies Xenon Automotive and ClearQuote.

news_headline: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
news_article: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

news_headline: General Motors unveils self-driving, flying Cadillac car concept
news_article: General Motors has unveiled a Cadillac-branded autonomous, flying vehicle concept at the 2021 CES show which is capable of carrying passengers from rooftop to rooftop. The single-seater electric vehicle takes off and lands vertically and can travel at speeds of up to 88.5 kmph. The concept is GM's first foray into aerial mobility and unlikely to go into production.

news_headline: As promised: Elon Musk on Tesla's India entry
news_article: Elon Musk has tweeted "as promised" in response to a news article about Tesla's entry into India. His response came after it was revealed that Tesla registered a new Indian subsidiary in Bengaluru and named its three directors. Last year, Elon Musk tweeted, "Next year for sure," in response to a user enquiring about Tesla's India entry.

news_headline: Tata Motors tweets 'tere mere pyaar ke charche' amid Tesla tie-up rumours, deletes it
news_article: Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday tweeted, "Aajkal tere mere pyaar ke charche har akhbaar mein, sabko malum hai aur sabko khabar ho gayi!", while tagging Elon Musk and Tesla, amid rumours of a joint venture between the two. The account, though unverified, is followed by Tata Motors' official handle. The tweet was deleted later.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Indians seek value for money even in luxury products: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
news_article: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk said Indians "look for value for money and that's even in a high-end product." He also remarked that usage in India is also different compared to other markets as many consumers here prefer the car to be chauffeur-driven. He said balancing between making car equally chauffeur and owner-friendly makes India "a slightly more difficult market".

news_headline: Mahindra & Mahindra cuts over half of its North America workforce: Reports
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra has reportedly cut over half of the workforce at its North American unit, which had over 500 employees in early 2020. Affected positions include engineers and manufacturing jobs at its Detroit plant that produces Roxor, as well as sales executives. Mahindra cited COVID-19 and a legal battle with Fiat Chrysler over an earlier Roxor model for layoffs.

news_headline: Apple adds more Tesla ex-execs to its self-driving car team: Report
news_article: A "small team" at Apple working on its self-driving car has seen the addition of more former Tesla executives, Bloomberg reported. The report said Apple recently hired Jonathan Sive, a vehicle engineer from Tesla and Waymo, as a senior manager on the car project. It also hired former Tesla engineering VP Steve MacManus, who is now working for the project.

news_headline: Tesla cars' sudden acceleration reports were due to user error: NHTSA
news_article: The US NHTSA has determined the reports of sudden unintended acceleration (SUA) involving four different Tesla models were due to user error. NHTSA is denying a petition to formally review over 6.62 lakh vehicles and potentially recall them. It said there is "no evidence" of any fault in the cars' systems that contributed to any of the incidents.

news_headline: General Motors changes logo for 1st time since 1964 to highlight EV focus
news_article: US-based automobile giant General Motors (GM) on Friday unveiled a new corporate logo, its first major logo change since 1964, to highlight its focus on electric vehicles (EVs). The "m" in the new logo is a nod to the shape of an electrical plug, the company said. GM has also said it will launch 30 new EVs by 2025-end.

news_headline: Tesla asks US safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla asked the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to declare its speed display issue as inconsequential to safety, reported Reuters. Over six lakh Tesla vehicles do not comply with safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements. Tesla said a majority of vehicles have since corrected the issue.

news_headline: Chip shortage forces Ford, Toyota, Nissan to cut vehicle production
news_article: Ford, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and Nissan said that they would cut vehicle production this month due to a shortage of semiconductors. Honda has also said its output in Japan could be affected by a shortage of semiconductors. Ford said it will idle its Louisville assembly plant. Fiat Chrysler will be delaying the restart of production at its Toluca plant.

news_headline: Tesla shares jump 4.9%, its market value crosses $800B for 1st time
news_article: Shares of Tesla jumped 4.9% on January 8, taking its market capitalisation to more than $800 billion for the first time ever. This comes right after Tesla's market value crossed $774 billion, making it Wall Street's fifth most valuable company, just behind Alphabet and ahead of Facebook. Tesla CEO Elon Musk surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's richest person.

news_headline: Apple, Hyundai to sign EV deal by March, start production by 2024: Report
news_article: Apple and Hyundai Motor plan to sign a partnership deal on autonomous electric vehicles (EVs) by March and start production as soon as 2024 in US, Korea IT News reported. The companies also plan to introduce a "beta version" of Apple cars next year, the report added. Earlier, Hyundai confirmed it was in talks with Apple, before retracting the statement.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, US startup Archer partner to build electric aircraft
news_article: Fiat Chrysler and US-based startup Archer have partnered to produce an electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. FCA will provide input that contributes to Archer's eVTOL cockpit's design, among other things. The aircraft will be powered by an electric motor and will be able to fly about 96 kilometres high at a ​top speed of around 241 kilometres/hour.

news_headline: Tesla looking for sale, charging sites in Mumbai: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla has launched an extensive exercise to look for sites for sale and marketing of its electric cars which will be imported initially, reported The Free Press Journal. The company will also reportedly speak to Tata Power and Adani Electricity for its charging facilities. The company has also sought the intervention of the Maharashtra government, it reported.

news_headline: Tesla's success should justify its share price: Raghuram Rajan
news_article: Economist and former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Raghuram Rajan said Tesla's success and spread of vehicles must be viewed firmly and should justify its rising stock price. He added that Tesla is a case of a stock that's being priced at many multiples of the price of automakers such as Toyota or General Motors.

news_headline: Passenger vehicle retail sales grow by 24% in December: FADA
news_article: Passenger vehicle (PV) retail sales in December rose by 24% year-on-year to 2,71,249 units, the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) said. Automobile registrations across the country grew by 11% in December from the year-ago period, showing positive growth for the first time in 2020-21, FADA added. Commercial vehicle sales fell 13.5% year-on-year to 51,454 units in December 2020.

news_headline: Tata Motors' shares rise 11% amid reports of tie-up with Tesla
news_article: Tata Motors' shares surged further 11% on Tuesday amid reports of it partnering with Tesla in India. On Monday, its shares had climbed 13%. Its shares also rose as it posted a 13.1% increase in the number of sales of Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) vehicles in the December quarter. The company added that China sales for JLR were "particularly encouraging".

news_headline: Jaguar Land Rover sales drop 24% in pandemic-hit 2020
news_article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover sales dropped nearly 24% in the calendar year 2020 owing to the ongoing pandemic. However, the company said that it saw a 13.1% quarter-on-quarter increase in sales during the October-December period. JLR's sales in China grew 19.1% year-on-year while it slipped by 16.3% in Europe and 17.2% in North America in the quarter.

news_headline: Retail auto sales grow for 1st time in FY21 in December
news_article: Retail automobile sales registered growth for the first time during the ongoing fiscal in December, data released by the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) showed. Retail sales across categories grew 11% during December due to "festive season and pre-buying due to price hike announcement". However, FADA said that the demand for vehicles in January looks "bleak".

news_headline: New species of 'orange and black' bat discovered in West Africa
news_article: A new species of orange and black bat from the Nimba Mountains in West Africa has been discovered by scientists from the American Museum of Natural History and Bat Conservation International. The species has been named Myotis nimbaensis in recognition of the Guinea mountain range it inhabits. "It has this bright-orange fur...it was so distinct," said scientist Winifred Frick.

news_headline: World's oldest cave painting of an animal drawn 45,500 yrs ago found in Indonesia
news_article: Archaeologists have discovered the world's oldest known animal cave painting in Indonesia believed to be drawn at least 45,500 years ago. The life-size painting of a wild pig also has two hand prints above the back of the animal. It was found in the Leang Tedongnge cave in a remote valley on Sulawesi island.

news_headline: 2020 was faster than usual, broke record for shortest day 28 times: Scientists
news_article: The 28 fastest days on record all occurred in 2020, with Earth completing its rotations around its axis milliseconds quicker than average, scientists said. The shortest day was July 19, when Earth completed one spin 1.4602 milliseconds faster than 86,400 seconds. Before 2020, the shortest day was noted on July 5, 2005, when the Earth's rotation was 1.0516 milliseconds faster.

news_headline: Astronomers capture a distant galaxy 'die' for the first time; share pic
news_article: Astronomers have captured for the first time a distant star-forming galaxy about to 'die' because of a massive cold gas ejection. "It's distant enough that its light takes some nine billion years to reach us," the astronomers said. The galaxy is ejecting nearly half of its star-forming gas at a rate equivalent to 10,000 Suns worth of gas a year.

news_headline: What is the Candida auris outbreak that was reported in a COVID-19 unit in US?
news_article: Candida auris is an emerging fungus that is often multidrug-resistant and some strains are resistant to all three available classes of antifungals, according to US' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC said it is difficult to identify with standard laboratory methods. A Candida auris outbreak was reported in a COVID-19 unit in Florida last year.

news_headline: 'Magic' mushrooms grow in US man's blood after he injects it in form of tea
news_article: A 30-year-old US man was hospitalised with organ failure after he injected himself with a tea made from psychedelic mushrooms, which later started growing in his veins. A case report said his liver was damaged and his kidneys weren't functioning properly. Doctors said he had tried to use the so-called "magic" mushrooms as an alternative treatment for his bipolar disorder.

news_headline: Yellow mealworms become first insect approved in EU as human food
news_article: Yellow mealworms have become the first insect approved by the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) as a human food. "Rich in protein, fat and fibre, they are likely to be the first of many insects to feature on European's plates in the coming years," an EFSA food scientist said. Mealworms are already used in Europe as a pet food ingredient.

news_headline: Indian student among winners of NASA app development challenge: Report
news_article: A high school student from Gurugram, Aryan Jain, is among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge, PTI reported. Jain had teamed up with six high school students from the US. The competition was a coding challenge in which NASA presented technical problems to students and sought their contributions to deep space exploration missions.

news_headline: Indian spacetech startup Agnikul builds 3D printed rocket engine
news_article: Chennai-based spacetech startup Agnikul Cosmos has developed a single piece, fully 3D printed rocket engine called Agnilet, which can be directly used in a rocket. The engine will be used in the second stage of Agnikul's launch vehicle Agnibaan, CEO and Co-founder Srinath Ravichandran said. Launched in 2017, the startup is involved in building India's private small satellite launch vehicle.

news_headline: Bezos' Blue Origin launches & lands latest New Shepard rocket, capsule
news_article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin has successfully launched and landed its latest New Shepard rocket and crew capsule. The capsule reached a maximum altitude of 107 kilometres, while the rocket flew up to a height of 106 kilometres. The capsule features six seats and has speakers with a microphone and a push-to-talk button at each seat.

news_headline: Astrophysicist Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passes away at 84
news_article: Renowned astrophysicist Professor Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passed away on January 11 aged 84. "He will be remembered for his work in astrophysics and subjects like solar physics, gravitational lensing and science education," PM said as he condoled Chitre's passing away. "His valuable work will continue inspiring students in the times to come," the PM added.

news_headline: US sees biggest drop in greenhouse gases emissions post WWll era: Report
news_article: The US' greenhouse gas emissions fell 10.3% in 2020, the largest drop in emissions in post-World War II era, due to COVID-19, the Rhodium Group reported. By comparison, the 2009 economic recession caused emissions to drop by 6.3%. Under the 2009 Copenhagen Accord, the US pledged that by 2020, it will have cut its emissions by 17% from 2005 levels.

news_headline: Scientists make film that absorbs sweat's moisture, helps power devices
news_article: NUS scientists have developed a film that is "extremely effective in evaporating sweat" from the skin and then absorbing the moisture from sweat. The film can rapidly release water on exposure to sunlight and can be "regenerated" and reused for more than 100 times. Scientists also made a wearable energy harvesting device comprising eight ECs, using the film as electrolyte.

news_headline: NASA finds FM signal coming from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the 1st time
news_article: NASA's Juno space probe has discovered an FM signal emanating from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the first time. One of NASA's ambassadors to Utah clarified that it is a ''natural function'' rather than a sign of extraterrestrial life. "Electrons spiralling in Jupiter's magnetic field are thought to be the cause of the radio noise we hear," NASA said.

news_headline: 2020 8th warmest year in India in 121 years: IMD
news_article: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that 2020 was the eighth warmest year India recorded in the last 121 years. Last year, the annual mean land surface air temperature average was 0.29°C above normal, for the period average considered between 1981 and 2010. However, it was much lower than 2016 (+0.71°C), which remains the warmest year recorded since 1901.

news_headline: Sunquakes may originate over 1,000 km beneath Sun's surface: NASA
news_article: NASA scientists suggested seismic activity on the Sun during solar flares, sunquakes, might be originating from 1,126.5 kilometres beneath its surface. Earlier, scientists believed magnetic forces or heating of Sun's outer atmosphere caused sunquakes. Scientists' new conclusion came after observing a sunquake with unusually sharp ripples produced from a moderately strong solar flare in 2011.

news_headline: 2 IAF doctors to soon leave for Russia to train for Gaganyaan: Report
news_article: Two Indian Air Force doctors who have specialised in aerospace medicine will soon fly to Russia to get hands-on experience in space medicine for the Gaganyaan mission, PTI reported. The flight surgeons will also get to train with the prospective astronauts. Four test pilots from IAF, chosen for the mission, have been undergoing training in Russia since last year.

news_headline: 2020 ties with 2016 as warmest year on record: EU
news_article: According to data published by the EU climate monitoring service, 2020 tied with 2016 for the warmest year worldwide. The year was also the warmest year in Europe since records began. It topped the previous temperature record of 2019 in Europe by 0.4°C. The data showed 2020 was 1.25°C warmer than during the pre-industrial period from 1850-1900.

news_headline: Bhaskaracharya found gravitational theory 500 yrs before Newton: Nepal PM
news_article: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told WION that Bhaskaracharya discovered the theory of gravitation about "500 years" before Issac Newton in 1150 AD. He added that Bhaskaracharya's book was published in 1210 AD. Oli said that even in his coursebook he was told that Newton found out the theory of gravitation.

news_headline: Megalodon babies, who ate siblings in womb, were larger than adult man: Study
news_article: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

news_headline: CO2 levels to be 50% higher than pre-industrial era in 2021: Report
news_article: Human activity will push concentrations of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere to levels 50% higher than before the Industrial Revolution, in 2021, the UK's Met Office reported. CO2 concentration is expected to exceed 417 ppm for several weeks from April to June for the first time. However, CO2 accumulation is expected to be slightly slower than usual in 2021.

news_headline: Scientists discover 2 dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda
news_article: Scientists have found two dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda. The Namibian giraffe is eight and a half feet tall, while the one in Uganda is nine feet and three inches tall. Both have standard long necks but short, stumpy legs. The medical condition that affects them is Skeletal Dysplasia, which the researchers say is rarely seen in wild animals.

news_headline: China to open world's largest radio telescope to int'l scientists in April
news_article: China will officially open the world's largest single-dish radio telescope to international scientists, starting April 1. The 500-metre Aperture Spherical radio Telescope (FAST) has a diameter of half a kilometre and had started operations in January last year. It has a receiving area equivalent to about 30 football fields.

news_headline: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
news_article: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

news_headline: New state of matter 'liquid glass' discovered: Scientists
news_article: University of Konstanz's researchers have uncovered a new state of matter, liquid glass, with previously unknown structural elements. They used a model system involving suspensions of tailor-made ellipsoidal colloids to uncover the state.
