news_headline: Megalodon babies, who ate siblings in womb, were larger than adult man: Study
news_article: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

news_headline: New chemical compounds to kill malaria parasite found: Scientists
news_article: A University of Pretoria-led research found new chemical compounds that could potentially be used for killing the malaria parasite in its infectious stage. It found that chemical compounds undergoing trials for treatment of tuberculosis and cancer can kill the parasite at a stage when it normally infects others. The compounds could also help create a new line of malaria drugs.

news_headline: OPPO Reno5 Pro 5G with AI Highlight Video feature to launch tomorrow
news_article: OPPO has announced that film director Imtiaz Ali will join stage in the launch of Reno5 Pro 5G that features industry-first AI Highlight Video. The 5G ready smartphone comes with Reno Glow process which makes the surface scratch and fingerprint resistant. The launch event will also introduce OPPO Enco X True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earphones.

news_headline: Twitter launches @SecondGentleman account for US VP-elect Harris' husband
news_article: Twitter has launched @SecondGentleman account for Douglas Emhoff, the husband of US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris. "I'm so incredibly honoured and humbled to be the first @SecondGentleman of the United States. As we countdown to Inauguration Day, I've been doing my homework—and looking to the past for inspiration," he tweeted from his personal Twitter account.

news_headline: FB bans ads for weapon accessories in US ahead of Biden's inauguration
news_article: Facebook said on Saturday it will ban advertisements for weapon accessories and protective gear in the US with immediate effect until at least two days after President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration on January 20. "We already prohibit ads for weapons, ammunition and weapon enhancements like silencers. But we will now also prohibit ads for accessories," Facebook said in a blog post.

news_headline: Direct WhatsApp to withdraw new policy: CAIT in SC petition
news_article: Traders' body CAIT has filed a petition in the Supreme Court asking to direct WhatsApp to withdraw its new privacy policy. "WhatsApp has been fraudulently collecting personal user data," CAIT National President BC Bhartia and Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said. They added that WhatsApp has "adopted the approach of 'my way or the highway'" that cannot be accepted in India.

news_headline: I made peace with potential loss: US man who forgot password to $220M bitcoins
news_article: The US man, who forgot the password to access his bitcoins worth $220 million, has said that he long ago "made peace" with the reality that he may never gain access to those bitcoins. Stefan Thomas' key for his digital wallet is locked in a hard drive that allows 10 password attempts. He is left with only two more tries.

news_headline: WhatsApp sets WhatsApp Status to explain privacy features to users, trolled
news_article: Amid backlash over its data sharing practices, WhatsApp posted its own 'WhatsApp Status' addressing concerns in different slides. While one slide read, "WhatsApp doesn't share your contacts with Facebook", another said, "WhatsApp can't see your shared location." A Twitter user trolled WhatsApp, "Height of damage control" while another tweet read, "This is how WhatsApp respects our privacy."

news_headline: Man threw away hard drive with bitcoins, offers $70M for permission to dig it up
news_article: A UK man who accidentally threw away his hard drive loaded with bitcoins in 2013 has offered the local authority a 25% share in the bitcoins (around $70 million) for permission to dig up the landfill. James Howells' hard drive had 7,500 bitcoins which are now worth nearly $270 million. The council says excavation isn't possible under its licensing permit.

news_headline: Nazara becomes first Indian gaming tech startup to seek IPO
news_article: Mumbai-based Nazara Technologies has become India's first gaming technology startup to seek a market debut as it filed Initial Public Offering (IPO) documents with the market regulator. Backed by billionaire business magnate Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, Nazara was founded in 2000 by gamer Nitish Mittersain when he was a college undergrad. He started Nazara with ₹3 crore borrowed from friends and family.

news_headline: Apple testing foldable screen prototypes for iPhones: Report
news_article: Apple has reportedly developed prototype foldable screens for iPhones and has started testing them internally. The company is, however, only testing the screen prototypes, rather than a full iPhone model, Bloomberg reported. The prototype screens have a "mostly invisible hinge" and several screen sizes have been discussed, including one that unfolds to a 6.7-inch display, the report added.

news_headline: Users might see errors in some chats: Signal after suffering worldwide outage
news_article: Signal app, which recently suffered a worldwide outage, on Sunday said, "As an unfortunate side effect of this outage, users might see errors in some of their chats." It added, "This does not affect your chat's security, but you may have missed a message from that contact." The next Signal app updates will fix these errors automatically.

news_headline: Zuckerberg, Facebook partially responsible for US Capitol riots: US Rep
news_article: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York, during a town hall meeting, said that Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook "bear partial responsibility" for the US Capitol violence on January 6. Facebook is currently trying to do as much "damage control" as possible, but they knew, Ocasio-Cortez said. She further suggested that Facebook has a "complete lack of accountability" to democracy.

news_headline: Cardinal says COVID-19 vaccines have 'satanic microchip', Facebook labels post
news_article: Facebook has put a warning on a video posted by retired Mexican Cardinal Juan Sandoval Iñiguez, claiming COVID-19 vaccines contain "satanic microchip". "The chip that they are planning to put in the vaccine to control you, it is the mark of the beast," the cardinal claimed in the video titled, "The plot to impose a new world order without Christ".

news_headline: Few issues came up with CoWIN app on 1st day of vaccination drive: Health Min
news_article: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) said that the CoWIN platform faced a few issues on the first day of COVID-19 vaccination drive on Saturday. There was a delay in uploading beneficiary lists at some session sites and some healthcare workers were vaccinated even though they were not scheduled on CoWIN, Manohar Agnani, Additional Secretary at MoHFW, said.

news_headline: Amazon, Uber among 3,000 new donors to Joe Biden's inauguration
news_article: Over 3,000 donors, including Amazon and Uber, made new contributions to US President-elect Joe Biden's inaugural ceremonies. The Biden Presidential Inaugural Committee disclosed the names of 3,184 additional donors after it made its first disclosure of 959 donors, which included Microsoft and Google, last week. Each donor has given at least $200, but individual amounts have not been disclosed.

news_headline: US Senate Republican asks tech firms to explain ban on conservative users
news_article: Outgoing Republican chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee Senator Roger Wicker has asked the CEOs of five major US tech firms to answer questions about their decisions to restrict or permanently ban accounts of "thousands of conservative users". The firms questioned are Apple, Facebook, Amazon, Alphabet and Twitter. He has also sought explanations for the moves against Parler.

news_headline: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
news_article: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage. It said the issue could diminish automakers' production and affect the US economy negatively. AAPC President Matt Blunt said he has also begun "nascent" discussions with the President-elect Joe Biden's administration.

news_headline: AI models to predict future of COVID-19 patients' condition made: Facebook
news_article: Facebook and NYU claim to have developed three machine learning models to help doctors predict how COVID-19 patients' condition may develop. Facebook said the model using sequential chest X-rays can predict up to "four days" in advance if a patient may need more intensive care solutions. The predictions could help doctors avoid sending at-risk patients home too soon, Facebook added.

news_headline: 6,000 Amazon workers to vote in Feb on its 1st US union formation
news_article: Around 6,000 workers at Amazon's warehouse in Alabama will begin voting next month on whether to unionise their workplace, potentially paving the way for the first US-based union at Amazon. The election will let workers cast a vote by mail-in ballots beginning February 8. Workers will be deciding on whether to join the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union.

news_headline: US consumers spent record $57 bn on video games in 2020: Report
news_article: US consumers set a new record by spending $56.9 billion on video games in 2020, according to a report by global market research company NPD Group. The figure marked a 27% increase compared to 2019. Annual hardware sales also hit $5.3 billion, 35% higher than in 2019. The report added that Nintendo Switch was the best-selling hardware platform of 2020.

news_headline: Posting grievances on social media can attract fraudsters: Delhi Police
news_article: The Cyber Crime Cell of Delhi Police has warned that posting grievances on platforms such as Twitter or public forums may attract fraudsters impersonating as customer care executives. It also shared a recent incident in which a user lost bitcoins worth ₹9 lakh after sharing his credentials with a Twitter handle impersonating as the customer care of a cryptocurrency wallet.

news_headline: Online publishing site Medium acquires social e-book app Glose
news_article: US-based online publishing platform Medium on Saturday said it has acquired French social digital book platform Glose. Glose CEO Nicolas Princen said the deal could help readers jump from an article directly into a book. "We're impressed...by Glose's reading products, technology [and] experience in partnering with book authors and publishers," Medium CEO Ev Williams said.

news_headline: Japan's Nintendo theme park's opening delayed due to COVID-19
news_article: Universal Studios Japan postponed the opening of Super Nintendo World theme park due to COVID-19. The park was originally scheduled to open on February 4, but the organisers said they will now re-evaluate and decide on a new date once COVID-19 restrictions are lifted. Japan earlier declared a state of emergency, in some prefectures, that will remain till February 7.

news_headline: Google to continue protecting our users' privacy: Fitbit CEO on acquisition
news_article: Fitbit CEO James Park in an online post said Google will continue to "protect Fitbit users' privacy". He added users' health and wellness data will be kept separate from other Google ad data and that Google will allow users to choose to connect to third party services. Earlier this week, Google announced it had completed $2.1 billion acquisition of Fitbit.

news_headline: Parler CEO and his family go into hiding after receiving death threats
news_article: Parler CEO John Matze has gone into hiding with his family after receiving death threats and security breaches, Matze's lawyer has revealed. Many Parler employees are also facing harassment and hostility and some of them have fled in order to escape persecution, the lawyer added. Earlier, Parler sued Amazon for discontinuing its services following the attack at the US Capitol.

news_headline: Facebook, Twitter officials summoned by Parliamentary panel on Jan 21
news_article: The Parliamentary standing committee on information technology has summoned Facebook and Twitter officials over the misuse of social media on January 21. The committee will hear the officials' views on the subject of "safeguarding citizens' rights and prevention of misuse of social/online news media platforms". The meet will also emphasise on the security of women in the digital space.

news_headline: 41-yr-old Santha Moorthy becomes oldest player to take a 5-for in T20 cricket
news_article: Puducherry's Santha Moorthy on Sunday became the oldest bowler ever to take a five-wicket haul in T20 cricket at the age of 41 years and 129 days. Santha registered figures of 4-0-20-5, helping his team defeat Mumbai in a Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. The previous record (41 years and 7 days) was held by Cayman Islands' Kenute Tulloch.

news_headline: I was sexually assaulted, an official performed a lewd act: Olympic champion
news_article: Olympic sailing champion Sofia Bekatorou of Greece has accused an unnamed sporting official of sexually assaulting her in 1998 during preparations for the Sydney Games. Bekatorou, who won gold at the 2004 Athens Olympics, said the male official performed a lewd act after inviting her to his hotel room. I was left feeling "exhausted and humiliated", she added.

news_headline: Washington Sundar smashes ball for six without even looking, video goes viral
news_article: India off-spinner Washington Sundar smashed a no-look six off Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon during his knock of 62 runs off 144 balls in the Brisbane Test. The 21-year-old went down on his back knee and launched the ball over mid-on. Washington kept looking at the pitch and didn't follow the trajectory of the ball as it sailed into the stands.

news_headline: Was he having a bad dream: Mark Waugh on Labuschagne's appeal against Sundar
news_article: During the 63rd over of India's first innings in Brisbane Test, Washington Sundar left a Josh Hazlewood delivery after which Marnus Labuschagne started appealing for caught behind despite a clear gap between the bat and the ball. "Do you think he was having a bad dream or something?" commentator Mark Waugh said. "What planet was he on?" Adam Gilchrist commented.

news_headline: Cricketer Mandeep Singh, wife Jagdeep blessed with a baby boy
news_article: Punjab captain Mandeep Singh and his wife Jagdeep Jaswal Singh have been blessed with a baby boy. The cricketer took to social media to announce the news. He wrote, "How wonderful life is now that he’s here...Me and Jagdeep are extremely happy to announce the arrival of our little prince, Rajveer Singh...Born January 16, 2021."

news_headline: Players criticise quality of food during quarantine ahead of Aus Open, share pics
news_article: Several tennis players have expressed their anger over the quality of food being provided at their designated hotel during quarantine ahead of Australian Open. Men's world number 15 Pablo Carreno Busta shared picture of salad, an apple and juice cup with the caption, "Really?" French player Benoit Paire opted against the quarantine meals and had McDonald’s delivered to his room.

news_headline: Kohli changes his Twitter bio to 'A proud husband and father' after birth of daughter
news_article: India captain Virat Kohli changed his bio on Twitter following the birth of his daughter. "A proud husband and father," his new Twitter bio reads. Earlier, his Twitter bio read, "The Official Twitter account of Virat Kohli. Indian cricketer, gamer, car lover, loves soccer and an enthusiast." Kohli and Anushka Sharma were blessed with their first child on January 11.

news_headline: Rohit Sharma shadow bats on crease in front of Steve Smith, video goes viral
news_article: A video of India vice-captain Rohit Sharma shadow batting on the crease in front of Australia batsman Steve Smith has gone viral. "Maybe Rohit was doing that to tease Smith or maybe he wasn't," commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said. Smith had faced criticism after he shadow batted and scuffed the crease to allegedly remove Rishabh Pant's batting mark in Sydney Test.

news_headline: When Washington was 9, he played a match with 5 stitches on his temple: Father
news_article: India off-spinner Washington Sundar's father M Sundar has revealed that when his son was around nine years old, he played an Under-14 inter-school match with five stitches on his temple. His father said that Washington was hit on the head during practice, but still played the match the next day and scored an unbeaten 39 to help his team win.

news_headline: Hardik Pandya pens note for his late father, shares pics
news_article: Cricketer Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to pen a note for his father Himanshu Pandya, who passed away due to a heart attack on Saturday. "Your sons are standing where they are right now only because of you, your hard work, your self-belief and [that] you were always happy," he wrote. "Rest in peace my king," he added.

news_headline: Australian Open player shares video of mouse in her hotel room amid quarantine
news_article: Women's world number 28 tennis player Yulia Putintseva of Kazakhstan took to Twitter to share a video of a mouse in her Melbourne hotel room, where she is quarantining ahead of the Australian Open. "Been trying to change the room for two hours already! And no one came to help due to quarantine situation," she wrote.

news_headline: Almost as if Kohli, Tendulkar were batting: Manjrekar lauds Sundar, Shardul
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has compared Washington Sundar and Shardul Thakur to Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli during their 123-run seventh wicket stand against Australia in the fourth Test. "Some of the shots they played, it was almost as if Kohli and Tendulkar were batting together...these are No. 7 and No. 8 batsman. It was that good," Manjrekar said.

news_headline: Natarajan, Washington understood what team expected from them: Rohit Sharma
news_article: Talking about the performance of debutants T Natarajan and Washington Sundar in the ongoing fourth Test against Australia, India's Rohit Sharma said both have showed a lot of character in the match so far. "Playing their first match, they showed...discipline and...the team was expecting them to do something and both Sundar and Natarajan did that really well," he added.

news_headline: PCB showed no vision at all: Inzamam-ul-Haq on Pak squad for SA Tests
news_article: Ex-Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that the PCB selection committee headed by Mohammad​ Wasim showed "no vision at all" in picking the squad for South Africa Tests. "Tabish Khan is a pacer [who] is over 36...Abdullah Shafique has played one first-class match...On the basis of just one match, we're making efforts to give Test cap to a player," Inzamam added.

news_headline: A very special day that I'll always remember: Sundar on Day 3 of 4th Test
news_article: India's Washington Sundar said it was a very special day for him after he scored 62 off 144 balls on the third day of the Brisbane Test to help India finish their innings at 336 runs. "Thank you so much for all the love, prayers and wishes. It was indeed a very special day that I'll remember always," Sundar tweeted.

news_headline: PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Mauricio Pochettino, the newly-appointed manager of Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) has tested positive for COVID-19, the club announced on Friday. "He will therefore enter isolation and is subject to the appropriate health protocols," PSG said. His assistants Jesus Perez and Miguel D'Agostino managed the side on Saturday against Angers. PSG currently top the French League 1 table after 20 matches.

news_headline: These are the moments for which we practice our batting: Pacer Shardul on 67(115)
news_article: Pacer Shardul Thakur has said he practices his batting whenever throwdowns take place in the nets for moments like the third day of the ongoing Test where he scored 67 off 115 balls. India were reduced to 186/6 in response to Australia's 369 when Thakur and Washington Sundar stitched 123-run partnership to help India finish their innings at 336 runs.

news_headline: India will have to dismiss Aus under 200 to win Brisbane Test: Gavaskar
news_article: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that India will have to dismiss Australia under 200 runs in their second innings to win the Brisbane Test. "Indian batsmen...will be under pressure [on the fifth day]...So it's necessary that the Indian bowlers on the fourth day...do not give too many runs. If that happens, we can save the match," he added.

news_headline: Australia weren't aggressive enough: Ponting on Day 3 of 4th Test
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said he's "disappointed" with the way Australia went about the third day of the Brisbane Test. "I don't think they were aggressive enough, didn't bowl enough short balls. They let the Indian batsmen be way too comfortable at the crease. They almost bowled the way those batsmen would have wanted them to bowl," he stated.

news_headline: Australia have identified where to bowl to Pujara: Glenn McGrath
news_article: Ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath has said Australia pacers have identified where to bowl to Cheteshwar Pujara to keep him away from scoring runs. "Pujara is getting out in similar ways...[Australia] have been able to execute [their plans]...and they've got the result they wanted," he added. Pujara has scored 215 runs in his seven innings so far in the four Tests.

news_headline: If you sit down to relax on Everest, you'll freeze to death: Man Utd manager Ole
news_article: On Manchester United being on the top of the English Premier League standings, club's manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said it's a product of all the hard work that everyone in the club has done. However, he also urged the team to not become complacent. "If you climb Mount Everest and...you sit down and relax...you'll freeze to death," he stated.

news_headline: Ex-cricketer BS Chandrasekhar admitted to Bengaluru hospital
news_article: Former India spinner BS Chandrasekhar had to be hospitalised in Bengaluru on Friday after he complained of tiredness, according to his wife. "He was fine and was watching match when he suddenly complained of fatigue and slurring in speech. So we took him to the hospital. He is fine and will be back home in two days," his wife said.

news_headline: I think India have been the best team in this series: Shane Warne
news_article: Former Australia spinner Shane Warne feels India have been the "best team" in the ongoing four-match Test series against Australia. "I think Australia have had so many opportunities to win this series, they just haven't taken them...At times their tactics haven't been good enough," Warne said. Team India lost many players due to injuries during the series.

news_headline: This half Indian team is better than fully-fit Australia: Akhtar
news_article: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar feels the Indian team playing the fourth Test, which is missing many of its senior players due to injuries, 'is better than the fully-fit Australian side'. "Inexperienced Indian players are up against a ball of fire but they are making sure that Australia is being tested...They're fighting. This is the character I'm talking about," said Akhtar.

news_headline: We had India 200/6, then Shardul, Sundar batted beautifully: Hazlewood
news_article: Talking about the third of the Brisbane Test, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said they thought they were on top when India lost six wickets before reaching the 200-run mark. "Washington Sundar and Shardul Thakur batted beautifully," he added. Sundar and Thakur stitched a partnership of 123 runs off 217 balls, India's highest partnership for the seventh wicket at the Gabba.

news_headline: Wuhan lab scientists may have had COVID-19 before first reported cases: US
news_article: The US has claimed that researchers inside the Wuhan lab became sick in autumn 2019, before the first identified case of COVID-19. The US said they had symptoms consistent with both COVID-19 and common seasonal illnesses. "This raises questions about the credibility of a senior researcher's public claim that there was 'zero infection' among the staff and students," it added.

news_headline: Worried about insider attack at Biden's inauguration: US defence officials
news_article: US defence officials have said they are worried about an insider attack or other threat from service members involved in securing President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration. The FBI is screening all of the 25,000 National Guard troops coming into Washington DC for the event. Army Secretary Ryan McCarthy warned commanders to be on the lookout for any problems within their ranks.

news_headline: Putin critic Navalny detained on return to Russia 5 months after being poisoned
news_article: Russian opposition leader and critic of President Vladimir Putin, Alexey Navalny, was detained by police on Sunday, moments after his return to the country and five months after he was poisoned with the nerve agent Novichok. The 44-year-old was placed on the country's federal wanted list last month for violating terms of probation related to a years-old fraud case.

news_headline: Biden to return US to Paris accord, end travel ban on Muslim nations on Day 1
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden plans to sign several executive orders, including rejoining the Paris climate accord and ending the travel ban on predominantly Muslim countries, on his first day in office, according to a memo from incoming chief of staff Ron Klain. He will also sign orders halting evictions and student loan payments during the coronavirus pandemic.

news_headline: Egypt unveils 3,000-year-old coffins in latest archaeological discovery
news_article: Egypt has unveiled a new archaeological discovery at the Saqqara necropolis south of Cairo, including 54 wooden coffins, many of which can be traced back 3,000 years to the New Kingdom period. Painted in bright colours, many of these coffins are still intact. The funerary temple of Queen Neit was also discovered near the pyramid of her husband, King Teti.

news_headline: Man held with 500 rounds of ammunition near Capitol ahead of Biden's inauguration
news_article: Ahead of US President-elect Joe Biden's oath-taking ceremony, a man from Virginia has been arrested at the inauguration checkpoint in Washington, DC, for carrying an unregistered handgun with over 500 rounds of ammunition in his car. He was denied passage through the checkpoint, located half a mile from the Capitol, police said. He was also carrying an "unauthorised" inauguration pass.

news_headline: Japan culled record 5.8 million chickens since Nov 2020 due to bird flu outbreak
news_article: Japan has culled record 5.8 million chickens since November 2020 due to bird flu, the country's public broadcaster NHK has reported. According to the NHK, a highly pathogenic variant of bird flu virus has been detected at 36 poultry farms in 15 prefectures. The total number of exterminated birds is expected to reach six million once the culling is over.

news_headline: 12 of 22 miners trapped underground for a week alive in China, send note
news_article: Rescuers have said that 12 miners trapped underground after an explosion in a Chinese gold mine a week ago are still alive. The workers managed to send a note to rescuers, state media reported. Twenty-two miners were trapped at the Hushan mine near Yantai on January 10 after the explosion that damaged the communications system of the mine.

news_headline: Man in wheelchair climbs 250m of HK skyscraper while being suspended in air
news_article: Lai Chi-wai became the first in Hong Kong to climb more than 250 meters of a skyscraper while strapped into a wheelchair as he pulled himself up for over 10 hours to raise money for spinal cord patients. The 37-year-old climber, who's paralysed from waist down, could not make it to the top of the 300 metre-tall tower.

news_headline: Cardinal says COVID-19 vaccines have 'satanic microchip', Facebook labels post
news_article: Facebook has put a warning on a video posted by retired Mexican Cardinal Juan Sandoval Iñiguez, claiming COVID-19 vaccines contain "satanic microchip". "The chip that they are planning to put in the vaccine to control you, it is the mark of the beast," the cardinal claimed in the video titled, "The plot to impose a new world order without Christ".

news_headline: Brazil halts Sputnik V vaccine approval due to lack of data
news_article: Brazil's health regulator Anvisa has sent back documents seeking approval for emergency use of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine due to lack of Phase 3 trials data. It stated that emergency approval to any vaccine will be given only after proving its long-term safety and efficacy. The promoters of Sputnik V said that the required data will be provided to Anvisa.

news_headline: Austria extends its 3rd COVID-19 lockdown until Feb 7
news_article: Austria's third COVID-19 lockdown, due to end on January 24, has been extended until February 7, Chancellor Sebastian Kurz announced on Sunday. Kurz said the country needs to bring its new infections down to 50 per one lakh residents over seven days from 130 now. This comes a day after thousands marched in Austria against restrictions imposed due to COVID-19.

news_headline: COVID-19 curbs should be eased for vaccinated people: German minister
news_article: German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas has said that the restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus pandemic should be eased for vaccinated people. "If there are only vaccinated people in a restaurant or a cinema, they can no longer endanger each other," he added. Over 10 lakh people in Germany have been given the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

news_headline: Biden's goal of 100mn vaccinations in 100 days absolutely doable: Fauci
news_article: Top US infectious diseases expert Anthony Fauci has said President-elect Joe Biden's goal of delivering 100 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine within 100 days of his presidency "is absolutely a doable thing". Two new vaccines under development by AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson could "very soon" be presented to regulators for approval, which would increase pace of vaccinations, Fauci added.

news_headline: Brazil authorises Sinovac, AstraZeneca vaccines for emergency use
news_article: Brazilian health regulator Anvisa approved emergency use of two COVID-19 vaccines on Sunday and the country started its mass vaccination drive. CoronaVac by China's Sinovac Biotech and UK's Oxford-AstraZeneca were approved amid the second wave of the outbreak in the country. Brazil is the third-worst coronavirus-hit country in the world with nearly 85 lakh COVID-19 cases.

news_headline: Zuckerberg, Facebook partially responsible for US Capitol riots: US Rep
news_article: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York, during a town hall meeting, said that Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook "bear partial responsibility" for the US Capitol violence on January 6. Facebook is currently trying to do as much "damage control" as possible, but they knew, Ocasio-Cortez said. She further suggested that Facebook has a "complete lack of accountability" to democracy.

news_headline: 1 COVID-19 patient admitted to hospital every 30 secs in England: NHS
news_article: Hospitals in England are admitting a new coronavirus patient every 30 seconds, National Health Service (NHS) England Chief Executive Sir Simon Stevens said. "The facts are very clear and I'm not going to sugar-coat them. Hospitals...and staff are under extreme pressure," he added. PM Boris Johnson recently said over 37,000 COVID-19 patients have been admitted to hospitals across the UK.

news_headline: Police use water cannon on anti-lockdown protesters in Amsterdam
news_article: Thousands of people on Sunday held an unauthorised protest in Amsterdam against the coronavirus lockdown in the Netherlands. The riot police used water cannon on the crowd after they refused to leave and threw fireworks at the police. The Dutch government had recently extended its lockdown, the toughest yet imposed in the nation, until February 9.

news_headline: Clashes leave 48 people dead in Sudan's Darfur region
news_article: At least 48 people were killed and 97 others were injured after clashes erupted in Sudan's West Darfur state, Sudan's state news agency said, quoting a local doctors' union. The fighting began between two tribes and later broadened into clashes involving armed militias in the area. A rights organisation has accused the militias of looting and human rights abuses.

news_headline: European Council Prez urges Russia to release Putin critic Navalny
news_article: European Council President Charles Michel on Sunday urged Russian authorities to immediately release opposition leader Alexey Navalny who was arrested following his return from Germany. A critic of President Vladimir Putin, Navalny was arrested by Russian detention authority after landing in Moscow for multiple probation violations. "The detainment of Alexey Navalny is unacceptable," Michel said.

news_headline: Poisoned Russian opp'n leader Navalny boards plane to Russia
news_article: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny, who was poisoned with Novichok nerve agent last year, boarded a plane to Russia from Germany, despite facing potential immediate arrest on arrival. "This is the best moment in...last five months...I feel great. Finally, I'm returning to my home town," he said. Navalny was flown to Germany after falling ill in August last year.

news_headline: US VP-elect Kamala Harris to resign her Senate seat on Monday
news_article: US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris will resign her Senate seat on Monday, two days before she is sworn in along with President-elect Joe Biden, according to her aides. Reportedly, Harris will not give a farewell Senate floor speech. California Governor Gavin Newsom will nominate Alex Padilla, California's Secretary of State, to serve the final two years of Harris' term.

news_headline: UN troops retake rebel-held city in Central African Republic
news_article: United Nations (UN) peacekeeping troops have retaken the control of Bangassou city from rebels in the Central African Republic (CAR), a spokesman said. The rebels fled the city after the UN peacekeeping force issued an ultimatum to the rebels on Friday. The rebels belong to armed groups waging an offensive against President Faustin Archange Touadera-led government.

news_headline: US military says its troop withdrawal from Somalia is complete
news_article: The US military has said that its troop withdrawal from Somalia is complete after US President Donald Trump ordered it in December. The troops, around 700 personnel, are being moved to other African countries such as neighbouring Kenya and Djibouti. This comes after the US military reduced the number of troops stationed in Afghanistan and Iraq to 2,500 each.

news_headline: Avoid publishing unnecessary details of nuke program: Iran to UN watchdog
news_article: Iran has asked United Nations' nuclear watchdog to not publish any "unnecessary details" of its nuclear program. Iran's nuclear department issued a statement asking the International Atomic Energy Agency to avoid publishing anything that may create confusion in the international community. This comes after Germany, France and UK said that Iran's uranium development was a violation of 2015 deal.

news_headline: 3 District Secretaries of Rajinikanth's party join DMK in Chennai
news_article: Three District Secretaries of actor Rajinikanth's political party Rajini Makkal Mandram joined Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) in presence of party chief MK Stalin in Chennai on Sunday. This comes after Rajinikanth announced he won't be entering politics or fighting Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. Rajini Makkal Mandram's District Secretaries for Thoothukudi, Ramanathapuram and Theni joined DMK.

news_headline: Samajwadi Janata Party (Rashtriya) President Kamal Morarka dies at 74
news_article: Former Union Minister and Samajwadi Janata Party (Rashtriya) President Kamal Morarka passed away at the age of 74 on Friday evening following a brief illness. Morarka had also served as vice-president of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). Rajasthan MLA Rajkumar Sharma condoled his demise, tweeting, "This is an irreparable loss to all of us."

news_headline: Yediyurappa will be removed from CM post after April: Siddaramaiah
news_article: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Sunday said that BJP's high command will remove Yediyurappa as the Chief Minister of Karnataka in April this year. Siddaramaiah's statement comes a day after Home Minister Amit Shah said Yediyurappa would continue as the CM and complete his term till 2023. "I'm saying this based on credible information from my sources in RSS," Siddaramaiah added.

news_headline: Do you know what's more dangerous than coronavirus? It's BJP: Nusrat Jahan
news_article: While addressing people at an event in West Bengal's Basirhat, actress-turned-TMC MP Nusrat Jahan said, "Do you know what is more dangerous than corona? It is the BJP." Adding that the party doesn't understand "humanity" and "culture", Jahan said, "They (BJP) turn people against each other on the basis of religion and trigger riots."

news_headline: BS Hooda, Surjewala detained during march to Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh
news_article: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda and Congress General Secretary Randeep Surjewala were among the several Congress leaders who were detained on Friday while marching towards Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh in protest against the farm laws. "We're not afraid of going to jail. No matter how many times we are put in jail, the government cannot stop us," Hooda said.

news_headline: Tell us why Indira Gandhi labelled Punjabis as Khalistanis: Harsimrat to Rahul
news_article: SAD leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal criticised Congress' Rahul Gandhi after he showed support for farmers by participating in protests in Delhi. Kaur tweeted, "Before...crying crocodile tears at why Punjabis (are) being called Khalistanis, you should tell why your grandmother (Indira Gandhi) used same words for Punjabis, why your father got them slaughtered and why you labelled them as drug addicts?"

news_headline: Shiv Sena will contest in West Bengal election: Sanjay Raut
news_article: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday took to Twitter to formally announce the decision of contesting in the upcoming election of West Bengal. "After discussions with Party Chief Shri Uddhav Thackeray, Shiv Sena has decided to contest the West Bengal Assembly Elections," he added. "We are reaching Kolkata soon," the Shiv Sena leader tweeted.

news_headline: I can't even kiss my wife because of pandemic: Farooq Abdullah
news_article: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Sunday said he can't even kiss his wife because of the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "There is no question of a hug, though the heart wants it. I am sincere in my words." Speaking at a book-release function in Jammu, Abdullah said one is even afraid of a handshake in the current situation.

news_headline: Insult to Kannada: Kumaraswamy as Shah unveils Hindi, Eng plaques in K'taka
news_article: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has criticised Home Minister Amit Shah for unveiling Hindi and English plaques and 'ignoring' Kannada during foundation laying ceremony for campus of CRPF's RAF in Shivamogga. Calling Kannada's exclusion "unpardonable", Kumaraswamy said, "Those who tolerate insult to dignity, honour of land [and] its language aren't fit to hold reigns of state's administration."

news_headline: Attempts to intimidate: SAD after NIA summons farmer leader, actor
news_article: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal said the Centre is trying to intimidate farmers through NIA after farmers' leader Baldev Singh Sirsa and Punjabi actor Deep Sidhu were summoned among 40 others. "Strongly condemn Centre's attempt...They aren't anti-nationals. And after failure of talks...it's absolutely clear that GOI is only trying to tire out farmers," Badal tweeted.

news_headline: 41 TMC MLAs want to join us in WB: BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya
news_article: Ahead of the West Bengal Assembly elections this year, BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said, "I have a list of 41 MLAs who want to join BJP. If I take these legislators in BJP's fold, the Mamata Banerjee government will fall." He added, "We have decided that among these legislators, we will not take those whose image is not good."

news_headline: Will withdraw Republic Day procession if SC orders: Farmer leader
news_article: National spokesperson of Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) Rakesh Tikait on Friday said, "If the Supreme Court will order, farmers would not hold the proposed parade on Republic Day." He added, "We would conduct the rally on some different day." Earlier, BKU had said that the farmers will take out a procession from Red Fort to India Gate on Republic Day.

news_headline: MP Satabdi Roy named Vice-President of TMC's West Bengal unit
news_article: After TMC MP Satabdi Roy met CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee, the actress-turned-politician was on Sunday named the Vice-President of the party's West Bengal unit. "If you take up the matter concerning the party with the top leadership, it is addressed. This development proves that. I welcome the decision," Roy said.

news_headline: Aurangabad is Sambhajinagar for us and will remain so: Sanjay Raut
news_article: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that Aurangabad is Sambhajinagar and will remain so for the party amid opposition from Congress over renaming the district. "It's a matter of people's feelings, so we can discuss it, but decision has been taken," he added. Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece Saamana said, large section of people are in favour of name change.

news_headline: Uddhav, Aaditya take part in Shiv Sena’s planning for 2022 BMC polls
news_article: Shiv Sena President and Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and Aadtiya Thackeray took part in the party's strategic planning for the 2022 Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) election, according to party functionaries. The CM has already asked the Mumbai legislators to start ground work in ward levels, a party functionary said. He is reportedly expected to convene a meeting of senior leaders.

news_headline: Shiv Sena-led coalition govt not affected by allegations: Sanjay Raut
news_article: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has said that the Shiv Sena-led coalition government is too strong to be affected by allegations levelled by the Opposition against the Maha Vikas Aghadi leaders. "As soon as something happens, [Opposition starts] demanding resignations...We too will have to demand the resignation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi every day over farmers' agitation," Raut said.

news_headline: Over 80% voter turnout in polling for 649 gram panchayats in Pune
news_article: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has said that polling in 649 gram panchayats have recorded over 80% voter turnout. "The gram panchayat elections are very closely contested and one expects a high turnout...All the COVID-19 protocols were followed," Deshmukh said. He further said that the polling took place in a peaceful manner in the entire district.

news_headline: Make national song compulsory in BMC-run schools: BJP corporator
news_article: BJP corporator Prabhakar Shinde has written a letter to Mayor Kishori Pednekar to immediately clear the proposal making the singing of national song Vande Mataram compulsory in all schools run by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). BJP further alleged that Shiv Sena is not taking the proposal seriously to appease its alliance partners, Congress and NCP.

news_headline: JD(U) student wing leader shot at in Patna, condition critical
news_article: A Janata Dal (United) student wing leader was allegedly shot at by criminals in Bakhtiyarpur area of Bihar's Patna on Sunday, police said. The victim, identified as Alok Tejashwi, has been admitted to a hospital and his condition is said to be critical. Tejashwi is the President of the youth unit of the party in Patna district rural.

news_headline: Cong holds nationwide protests against farm laws, observes 'Kisan Adhikar Diwas'
news_article: Congress party on Friday observed 'Kisan Adhikar Diwas' and held nationwide protests outside Governor houses against the farm laws and to show solidarity with the protesting farmers. "We demand that the government should repeal these laws. We and farmers are not going to withdraw the protest till...the demands of the farmers are met," senior Congress leader KC Venugopal said.

news_headline: BJP names 4 candidates for biennial UP Legislative Council polls
news_article: BJP on Friday announced the names of four candidates for the upcoming biennial elections for the 12 Legislative Council seats in Uttar Pradesh, which will fall vacant on January 30, 2021. "The central election committee of the BJP has approved the names of Swatantra Dev Singh, Dr Dinesh Sharma, Laxman Prasad Acharya and Arvind Kumar Sharma as candidates," it stated.

news_headline: Mamata Banerjee will have to take refuge in Bangladesh after WB polls: UP Min
news_article: Uttar Pradesh Minister Anand Swarup Shukla said on Sunday that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is an "Islamic terrorist". "[She'll] be defeated badly in the Assembly polls after which she'll have to take refuge in Bangladesh," he added. Shukla further said that Muslims who say "Bharat Mata ki Jai" and "Vande Mataram" will be honoured in the country.

news_headline: Rumours of Bihar ministers being involved in IndiGo manager's murder: Tejashwi
news_article: Leader of Opposition in Bihar and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, in a Facebook live on Friday said that there are rumours of ministers in state government being involved in the murder of the IndiGo airlines manager Rupesh Kumar Singh. Singh was shot dead by unidentified bike-borne men in the Punaichak area of Patna on January 12.

news_headline: I was with TMC and will remain with TMC: MP Satabdi Roy
news_article: Bengal's TMC MP Satabdi Roy said on Friday that she isn't going to Delhi and she "was with TMC and will remain with TMC". This comes after Roy had meeting with party leader and CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee. Roy had earlier said that she's not being informed about party events in her Birbhum constituency, leaving her "mentally pained".

news_headline: Army boosted country's morale during standoff with China: Rajnath
news_article: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said, "The charismatic performance by the [Indian] Army during the India-China standoff boosted the morale of the country and also enabled the citizens to hold their heads high." Singh said this while addressing a gathering during the foundation stone laying ceremony of a new Command Hospital in Lucknow.

news_headline: Jennifer Lopez goes nude for new music video, fans say 'Can't believe she's 51'
news_article: Singer Jennifer Lopez went nude for her new song 'In The Morning', the video of which was released on Friday. "The fact she's 51 YEARS OLD and has a better body than I do is outstanding," commented a user while another wrote, "Can't believe...she's 51...She looks younger and younger each day." "It's full of symbolism," Jennifer said about the video.

news_headline: Classical musician Ustad Ghulam Mustafa Khan dies at 89
news_article: Classical musician and Padma Vibhushan awardee Ustad Ghulam Mustafa Khan passed away aged 89 on Sunday afternoon at his Mumbai residence. His daughter-in-law said that he was fine this morning but during his massage, he vomited and started breathing slowly. "I tried connecting to the doctors and when they came, he had already died," his daughter-in-law said.

news_headline: Police seen stationed outside Saif's home amid 'Tandav' controversy, pics surface
news_article: A police van and a few police officers were seen stationed outside actor Saif Ali Khan's home in Mumbai on Sunday amid the controversy surrounding his web series 'Tandav'. Several politicians have been protesting against the show for 'hurting religious sentiments'. 'Tandav' is directed by Ali Abbas Zafar and also stars Sunil Grover, Dimple Kapadia and Gauahar Khan, among others.

news_headline: Hrithik said Kangana is sexually possessed with him: Arnab in leaked chats
news_article: In his alleged leaked WhatsApp chats with ex-BARC CEO Partho Dasgupta, Republic TV Editor-In-Chief Arnab Goswami talked about the Hrithik Roshan-Kangana Ranaut controversy. In one of the chats, he said, "Hrithik says Kangana has erotomania," after which Partho asked him, "What's that?" Arnab replied, "That she is sexually possessed with him."

news_headline: My choice of clothes is no one's business: Donal Bisht to trolls over bikini pics
news_article: TV actress Donal Bisht, speaking about being trolled for her bikini pictures on Instagram, said, "My choice of clothes is no one's business...Writing obscene comments...is nothing but a reflection of...pitiful mindset the trolls hold." "Women should be allowed to wear what they want...without being judged...I'm not the first person...who wore a bikini! Why make a big deal?" she added.

news_headline: BJP MLA files complaint against 'Tandav' makers for 'insulting Hindu Gods'
news_article: BJP MLA Ram Kadam on Sunday lodged a police complaint in Mumbai against the makers of web series 'Tandav' for allegedly insulting Hindu Gods. Kadam also urged authorities to take "strict action" against the actors, producers and director of the show. BJP MP Manoj Kotak wrote to Union Minister Prakash Javadekar alleging that 'Tandav' makers were deliberately disrespecting religious sentiments.

news_headline: My mom asked if I wanted my wife Ratna to change religion, I said no: Naseeruddin
news_article: Naseeruddin Shah, in an interview with 'Karwan e Mohabbat', said, "I'm...furious with...love jihad tamasha." He revealed when he was about to marry actress Ratna Pathak Shah, his mother asked if he'd want her to convert to his religion and his answer was no. "My mother agreed. She said, 'How can someone be asked to change their religion?'," said Naseeruddin.

news_headline: Ali Abbas Zafar & others booked over web series 'Tandav', warned of arrest
news_article: An FIR was registered in Lucknow against director Ali Abbas Zafar, Amazon Prime Video's India head of original content Aparna Purohit, producer Himanshu Mehra, writer Gaurav Solanki and others for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. They've been booked over web series 'Tandav'. "Preparations for arrest soon!!", tweeted Shalabh Mani Tripathi, UP CM Yogi Adityanath's Media Adviser.

news_headline: 'Angrezi Medium' will be special because of Irrfan: Radhika Madan
news_article: Remembering late actor and her 'Angrezi Medium' co-star Irrfan Khan, actress Radhika Madan said that the film will always be special to her because she got to work with one of the actors whose art has always "inspired" her. "There’s so much more to him [Irrfan] than just the performer that he was. He was so giving...and supportive," she added.

news_headline: Centre to bring in self-regulation law for OTT platforms, news websites: Report
news_article: According to a senior government official, the Centre has decided to introduce an "overarching statute" that will ensure self-regulation in digital media including OTT platforms and news websites. The move will reportedly address the issues of sensitive video content and fake news. Another official said that the I&B Ministry doesn't intend to curtail the freedom of the medium.

news_headline: It'll be a proud moment when we make India COVID-19 free: Big B
news_article: Commenting on India's COVID-19 vaccination drive, Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter and spoke about making India coronavirus-free. The actor, who had contracted the virus in July 2020, wrote, "It was a proud moment when we made India polio-free, it shall be just as proud a moment when we make India COVID-19 free. Jai Hind."

news_headline: Guru Dutt's daughter sends notice to director for copyright violation
news_article: Late actor-filmmaker Guru Dutt's daughter, Nina Memon, has sent a legal notice for copyright infringement to director Bhavna Talwar, who had announced a biopic on Dutt's life last year. Memon has stated in the notice that she's the sole copyright owner of the late actor's life story. "Memon hasn't assigned any rights to a third party," Memon's spokesperson told Mid-Day.

news_headline: It'll be more realistic: John Mathew Matthan on 'Sarfarosh' sequel
news_article: Speaking about the upcoming sequel to his Aamir Khan-starrer film 'Sarfarosh', director John Mathew Matthan said, "The sequel is about [the] internal security of the country." He added, "The film is more realistic because I don't have the compulsion to put songs in it. I had to do it then because that's how the business was."

news_headline: Shabana to reunite with director Shekhar Kapur after 38 yrs: Reports
news_article: Actress Shabana Azmi and director Shekhar Kapur are set to reunite for a film titled 'What’s Love Got To Do With It' after 38 years of the latter's directorial debut 'Masoom', according to a report in SpotboyE. Azmi plays the role of the male lead's mother in the project that is being shot in London, the report added.

news_headline: Salman exempted again from appearance in blackbuck poaching case
news_article: The district and sessions court on Saturday exempted actor Salman Khan from making an appearance in connection with the petition challenging trial court's sentence of five-year of imprisonment in the 1998 blackbucks poaching case in Jodhpur. Khan has now been asked to appear on February 6. The actor's counsel sought exemption considering the "pandemic situation".

news_headline: Tabu's Instagram account hacked, says 'don't click on any link'
news_article: After a promotional post was shared on her Instagram account, reportedly without her knowledge, actress Tabu informed her followers that her account has been hacked. "Hack alert. My account is hacked. Please do not click on any link from my account," she wrote on Instagram stories. Recently actresses Urmila Matondkar and Esha Deol's social media accounts were also hacked.

news_headline: Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Jersey' to release on November 5
news_article: Actor Shahid Kapoor starrer upcoming sports drama film 'Jersey' will release in theatres on November 5. Shahid, who will play the role of a cricketer in the film, shared the news on Instagram on Sunday. "Jersey releasing in theatres this Diwali, 5th November 2021...A journey I am so very proud of. This one's for the team," he wrote.

news_headline: Ram Charan joins father Chiranjeevi in upcoming film 'Acharya'
news_article: Actor Ram Charan will share screen space with his father, actor Chiranjeevi in the upcoming film 'Acharya'. "Our Siddha is ready. Welcoming our Ram Charan garu onto the sets of Acharya," director Koratala Siva tweeted alongside a poster featuring his character from the film. The actor, who tested positive for COVID-19 in December, joined the shoot after recovering from the virus.

news_headline: You still make my heart flutter: Akshay to Twinkle on 20th anniversary
news_article: To mark their 20th wedding anniversary, actor Akshay Kumar posted a picture with his wife Twinkle Khanna on Instagram and wrote, "The surest I've ever been of a partnership." He added, "Twenty years of togetherness and you still make my heart flutter and sometimes even drive me up the wall but then again I wouldn't have it any other way."

news_headline: Hang in there pal: Ryan to 11-year-old 'Deadpool' fan battling cancer
news_article: Actor Ryan Reynolds, who plays 'Deadpool', recorded a message for his 11-year old fan Brody Dery, who is currently battling cancer. "I'm sending you...love and I'm sending you strength, whatever strength I've got...I hope I get to meet you in person one of these days and hang in there," he told the 'Deadpool' fan.

news_headline: Story is the hero on OTT platforms, unlike theatres: Adah Sharma
news_article: Actress Adah Sharma has said that "story is the hero" on OTT platforms, unlike the movie theatres. The 28-year-old actress further said, "It’s not like in theatres [where] only big films with stars or star kids would get maximum timing, while small films would get neglected." She also said that the OTT can make "stars out of newcomers".

news_headline: 2020 was important to take a break and reflect: Anupria Goenka
news_article: Talking about the past year and the pandemic situation, actress Anupria Goenka said that the year was important to take a "break and reflect". "It has been a very different year, both good and difficult," she added. Goenka also spoke about how the OTT platforms have taken a centre stage because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

news_headline: Haasan to undergo leg surgery, says 'will resume campaign in few days'
news_article: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Sunday announced that he'll take a break from his professional commitments to undergo a follow-up leg surgery. Ahead of the Tamil Nadu assembly elections, the Makkal Needhi Maiam chief posted on Twitter, "Now I have an opportunity to take some rest...I'll come back fully rejuvenated within a few days to resume my campaign with renewed vigour."

news_headline: Sex without consent is sexual abuse, before and after marriage: Pankaj
news_article: Commenting on the issue of sexual abuse, actor Pankaj Tripathi shared his views on the importance of consent in a recent video posted on social media. "Sex without consent is sexual abuse, before marriage and after marriage," he said in the clip. The video also features actors Pratik Gandhi, Vijay Varma, Pavail Gulati, Karan Tacker and Nakuul Mehta.

news_headline: Passion is the only thing which stands the test of COVID-19: Sara
news_article: Actress Sara Ali Khan, who is currently shooting for her upcoming film 'Atrangi Re' alongside Akshay Kumar and Dhanush, said the cast and crew of the film worked together amid the pandemic because of their passion for filmmaking. "Passion...is the only thing which stands the test of COVID-19...We make movies to have fun," she added.

news_headline: The all-new Volvo S60 is designed to help save lives: Volvo
news_article: Every car, Volvo said, is made to give people the journey of their lives while preparing them for every surprise on the way. The latest luxury sedan, the Volvo S60, lets you rediscover the thrill of driving, be it inside or outside, it is designed to help save lives while helping us keep our promise, it further mentioned.

news_headline: Aprilia SXR 160 is here to maximise your life: Piaggio India
news_article: The all-new Aprilia SXR 160 brings together a premium combination of style, performance and extraordinary comfort for an unbelievable riding experience, the company mentioned. Designed in Italy for India, it represents the new Aprilia design philosophy. Here's a ride that will transform your everyday experiences and lead you to maximise every one of them, the company added.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Tata Motors tweets 'tere mere pyaar ke charche' amid Tesla tie-up rumours, deletes it
news_article: Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday tweeted, "Aajkal tere mere pyaar ke charche har akhbaar mein, sabko malum hai aur sabko khabar ho gayi!", while tagging Elon Musk and Tesla, amid rumours of a joint venture between the two. The account, though unverified, is followed by Tata Motors' official handle. The tweet was deleted later.

news_headline: Who are the three directors in Tesla's new Indian subsidiary?
news_article: Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, David Jon Feinstein and Venkatrangam Sreeram as directors in its newly-registered Indian subsidiary, Tesla India Motors and Energy. While Taneja is Tesla's Chief Accounting Officer, Feinstein is Senior Director, Global Trade & New Markets. Sreeram is a Bengaluru entrepreneur who has co-founded automotive tech companies Xenon Automotive and ClearQuote.

news_headline: As promised: Elon Musk on Tesla's India entry
news_article: Elon Musk has tweeted "as promised" in response to a news article about Tesla's entry into India. His response came after it was revealed that Tesla registered a new Indian subsidiary in Bengaluru and named its three directors. Last year, Elon Musk tweeted, "Next year for sure," in response to a user enquiring about Tesla's India entry.

news_headline: General Motors unveils self-driving, flying Cadillac car concept
news_article: General Motors has unveiled a Cadillac-branded autonomous, flying vehicle concept at the 2021 CES show which is capable of carrying passengers from rooftop to rooftop. The single-seater electric vehicle takes off and lands vertically and can travel at speeds of up to 88.5 kmph. The concept is GM's first foray into aerial mobility and unlikely to go into production.

news_headline: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
news_article: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

news_headline: Mahindra & Mahindra cuts over half of its North America workforce: Reports
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra has reportedly cut over half of the workforce at its North American unit, which had over 500 employees in early 2020. Affected positions include engineers and manufacturing jobs at its Detroit plant that produces Roxor, as well as sales executives. Mahindra cited COVID-19 and a legal battle with Fiat Chrysler over an earlier Roxor model for layoffs.

news_headline: Indians seek value for money even in luxury products: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
news_article: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk said Indians "look for value for money and that's even in a high-end product." He also remarked that usage in India is also different compared to other markets as many consumers here prefer the car to be chauffeur-driven. He said balancing between making car equally chauffeur and owner-friendly makes India "a slightly more difficult market".

news_headline: Chip shortage forces Ford, Toyota, Nissan to cut vehicle production
news_article: Ford, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and Nissan said that they would cut vehicle production this month due to a shortage of semiconductors. Honda has also said its output in Japan could be affected by a shortage of semiconductors. Ford said it will idle its Louisville assembly plant. Fiat Chrysler will be delaying the restart of production at its Toluca plant.

news_headline: Tesla asks US safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla asked the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to declare its speed display issue as inconsequential to safety, reported Reuters. Over six lakh Tesla vehicles do not comply with safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements. Tesla said a majority of vehicles have since corrected the issue.

news_headline: Apple, Hyundai to sign EV deal by March, start production by 2024: Report
news_article: Apple and Hyundai Motor plan to sign a partnership deal on autonomous electric vehicles (EVs) by March and start production as soon as 2024 in US, Korea IT News reported. The companies also plan to introduce a "beta version" of Apple cars next year, the report added. Earlier, Hyundai confirmed it was in talks with Apple, before retracting the statement.

news_headline: Tesla cars' sudden acceleration reports were due to user error: NHTSA
news_article: The US NHTSA has determined the reports of sudden unintended acceleration (SUA) involving four different Tesla models were due to user error. NHTSA is denying a petition to formally review over 6.62 lakh vehicles and potentially recall them. It said there is "no evidence" of any fault in the cars' systems that contributed to any of the incidents.

news_headline: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
news_article: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage. It said the issue could diminish automakers' production and affect the US economy negatively. AAPC President Matt Blunt said he has also begun "nascent" discussions with the President-elect Joe Biden's administration.

news_headline: Tesla looking for sale, charging sites in Mumbai: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla has launched an extensive exercise to look for sites for sale and marketing of its electric cars which will be imported initially, reported The Free Press Journal. The company will also reportedly speak to Tata Power and Adani Electricity for its charging facilities. The company has also sought the intervention of the Maharashtra government, it reported.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, US startup Archer partner to build electric aircraft
news_article: Fiat Chrysler and US-based startup Archer have partnered to produce an electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. FCA will provide input that contributes to Archer's eVTOL cockpit's design, among other things. The aircraft will be powered by an electric motor and will be able to fly about 96 kilometres high at a ​top speed of around 241 kilometres/hour.

news_headline: General Motors changes logo for 1st time since 1964 to highlight EV focus
news_article: US-based automobile giant General Motors (GM) on Friday unveiled a new corporate logo, its first major logo change since 1964, to highlight its focus on electric vehicles (EVs). The "m" in the new logo is a nod to the shape of an electrical plug, the company said. GM has also said it will launch 30 new EVs by 2025-end.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, PSA merge to create Stellantis, world's 4th largest automaker
news_article: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) and Peugeot owner PSA Group have sealed their $52 billion merger to create Stellantis, the world's fourth largest automaker. The merged entity will have annual sales of around 8.1 million vehicles. Stellantis can cut annual costs by around $6.1 billion without plant closures, a statement said. FCA and PSA first announced plans to merge in October 2019.

news_headline: Retail auto sales grow for 1st time in FY21 in December
news_article: Retail automobile sales registered growth for the first time during the ongoing fiscal in December, data released by the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) showed. Retail sales across categories grew 11% during December due to "festive season and pre-buying due to price hike announcement". However, FADA said that the demand for vehicles in January looks "bleak".

news_headline: Tesla's success should justify its share price: Raghuram Rajan
news_article: Economist and former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Raghuram Rajan said Tesla's success and spread of vehicles must be viewed firmly and should justify its rising stock price. He added that Tesla is a case of a stock that's being priced at many multiples of the price of automakers such as Toyota or General Motors.

news_headline: Jaguar Land Rover sales drop 24% in pandemic-hit 2020
news_article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover sales dropped nearly 24% in the calendar year 2020 owing to the ongoing pandemic. However, the company said that it saw a 13.1% quarter-on-quarter increase in sales during the October-December period. JLR's sales in China grew 19.1% year-on-year while it slipped by 16.3% in Europe and 17.2% in North America in the quarter.

news_headline: Tata Motors' shares rise 11% amid reports of tie-up with Tesla
news_article: Tata Motors' shares surged further 11% on Tuesday amid reports of it partnering with Tesla in India. On Monday, its shares had climbed 13%. Its shares also rose as it posted a 13.1% increase in the number of sales of Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) vehicles in the December quarter. The company added that China sales for JLR were "particularly encouraging".

news_headline: Passenger vehicle retail sales grow by 24% in December: FADA
news_article: Passenger vehicle (PV) retail sales in December rose by 24% year-on-year to 2,71,249 units, the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) said. Automobile registrations across the country grew by 11% in December from the year-ago period, showing positive growth for the first time in 2020-21, FADA added. Commercial vehicle sales fell 13.5% year-on-year to 51,454 units in December 2020.

news_headline: What is the Candida auris outbreak that was reported in a COVID-19 unit in US?
news_article: Candida auris is an emerging fungus that is often multidrug-resistant and some strains are resistant to all three available classes of antifungals, according to US' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC said it is difficult to identify with standard laboratory methods. A Candida auris outbreak was reported in a COVID-19 unit in Florida last year.

news_headline: Yellow mealworms become first insect approved in EU as human food
news_article: Yellow mealworms have become the first insect approved by the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) as a human food. "Rich in protein, fat and fibre, they are likely to be the first of many insects to feature on European's plates in the coming years," an EFSA food scientist said. Mealworms are already used in Europe as a pet food ingredient.

news_headline: 'Magic' mushrooms grow in US man's blood after he injects it in form of tea
news_article: A 30-year-old US man was hospitalised with organ failure after he injected himself with a tea made from psychedelic mushrooms, which later started growing in his veins. A case report said his liver was damaged and his kidneys weren't functioning properly. Doctors said he had tried to use the so-called "magic" mushrooms as an alternative treatment for his bipolar disorder.

news_headline: 2020 was faster than usual, broke record for shortest day 28 times: Scientists
news_article: The 28 fastest days on record all occurred in 2020, with Earth completing its rotations around its axis milliseconds quicker than average, scientists said. The shortest day was July 19, when Earth completed one spin 1.4602 milliseconds faster than 86,400 seconds. Before 2020, the shortest day was noted on July 5, 2005, when the Earth's rotation was 1.0516 milliseconds faster.

news_headline: Astronomers capture a distant galaxy 'die' for the first time; share pic
news_article: Astronomers have captured for the first time a distant star-forming galaxy about to 'die' because of a massive cold gas ejection. "It's distant enough that its light takes some nine billion years to reach us," the astronomers said. The galaxy is ejecting nearly half of its star-forming gas at a rate equivalent to 10,000 Suns worth of gas a year.

news_headline: World's oldest cave painting of an animal drawn 45,500 yrs ago found in Indonesia
news_article: Archaeologists have discovered the world's oldest known animal cave painting in Indonesia believed to be drawn at least 45,500 years ago. The life-size painting of a wild pig also has two hand prints above the back of the animal. It was found in the Leang Tedongnge cave in a remote valley on Sulawesi island.

news_headline: New species of 'orange and black' bat discovered in West Africa
news_article: A new species of orange and black bat from the Nimba Mountains in West Africa has been discovered by scientists from the American Museum of Natural History and Bat Conservation International. The species has been named Myotis nimbaensis in recognition of the Guinea mountain range it inhabits. "It has this bright-orange fur...it was so distinct," said scientist Winifred Frick.

news_headline: Indian student among winners of NASA app development challenge: Report
news_article: A high school student from Gurugram, Aryan Jain, is among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge, PTI reported. Jain had teamed up with six high school students from the US. The competition was a coding challenge in which NASA presented technical problems to students and sought their contributions to deep space exploration missions.

news_headline: AI models to predict future of COVID-19 patients' condition made: Facebook
news_article: Facebook and NYU claim to have developed three machine learning models to help doctors predict how COVID-19 patients' condition may develop. Facebook said the model using sequential chest X-rays can predict up to "four days" in advance if a patient may need more intensive care solutions. The predictions could help doctors avoid sending at-risk patients home too soon, Facebook added.

news_headline: Indian spacetech startup Agnikul builds 3D printed rocket engine
news_article: Chennai-based spacetech startup Agnikul Cosmos has developed a single piece, fully 3D printed rocket engine called Agnilet, which can be directly used in a rocket. The engine will be used in the second stage of Agnikul's launch vehicle Agnibaan, CEO and Co-founder Srinath Ravichandran said. Launched in 2017, the startup is involved in building India's private small satellite launch vehicle.

news_headline: Bezos' Blue Origin launches & lands latest New Shepard rocket, capsule
news_article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin has successfully launched and landed its latest New Shepard rocket and crew capsule. The capsule reached a maximum altitude of 107 kilometres, while the rocket flew up to a height of 106 kilometres. The capsule features six seats and has speakers with a microphone and a push-to-talk button at each seat.

news_headline: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
news_article: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

news_headline: US sees biggest drop in greenhouse gases emissions post WWll era: Report
news_article: The US' greenhouse gas emissions fell 10.3% in 2020, the largest drop in emissions in post-World War II era, due to COVID-19, the Rhodium Group reported. By comparison, the 2009 economic recession caused emissions to drop by 6.3%. Under the 2009 Copenhagen Accord, the US pledged that by 2020, it will have cut its emissions by 17% from 2005 levels.

news_headline: China to open world's largest radio telescope to int'l scientists in April
news_article: China will officially open the world's largest single-dish radio telescope to international scientists, starting April 1. The 500-metre Aperture Spherical radio Telescope (FAST) has a diameter of half a kilometre and had started operations in January last year. It has a receiving area equivalent to about 30 football fields.

news_headline: CO2 levels to be 50% higher than pre-industrial era in 2021: Report
news_article: Human activity will push concentrations of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere to levels 50% higher than before the Industrial Revolution, in 2021, the UK's Met Office reported. CO2 concentration is expected to exceed 417 ppm for several weeks from April to June for the first time. However, CO2 accumulation is expected to be slightly slower than usual in 2021.

news_headline: 2020 ties with 2016 as warmest year on record: EU
news_article: According to data published by the EU climate monitoring service, 2020 tied with 2016 for the warmest year worldwide. The year was also the warmest year in Europe since records began. It topped the previous temperature record of 2019 in Europe by 0.4°C. The data showed 2020 was 1.25°C warmer than during the pre-industrial period from 1850-1900.

news_headline: Scientists discover 2 dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda
news_article: Scientists have found two dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda. The Namibian giraffe is eight and a half feet tall, while the one in Uganda is nine feet and three inches tall. Both have standard long necks but short, stumpy legs. The medical condition that affects them is Skeletal Dysplasia, which the researchers say is rarely seen in wild animals.

news_headline: DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients made
news_article: The University of Cambridge said scientists have developed a DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients, who have double the risk of developing pneumonia while on ventilation than non-COVID-19 patients. The test gives doctors the information they need to start treatment within hours rather than days. It uses multiple PCR which detects the DNA of the bacteria.

news_headline: NASA finds FM signal coming from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the 1st time
news_article: NASA's Juno space probe has discovered an FM signal emanating from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the first time. One of NASA's ambassadors to Utah clarified that it is a ''natural function'' rather than a sign of extraterrestrial life. "Electrons spiralling in Jupiter's magnetic field are thought to be the cause of the radio noise we hear," NASA said.

news_headline: New chemical compounds to kill malaria parasite found: Scientists
news_article: A University of Pretoria-led research found new chemical compounds that could potentially be used for killing the malaria parasite in its infectious stage. It found that chemical compounds undergoing trials for treatment of tuberculosis and cancer can kill the parasite at a stage when it normally infects others. The compounds could also help create a new line of malaria drugs.

news_headline: New state of matter 'liquid glass' discovered: Scientists
news_article: University of Konstanz's researchers have uncovered a new state of matter, liquid glass, with previously unknown structural elements. They used a model system involving suspensions of tailor-made ellipsoidal colloids to uncover the state.
