news_article: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

news_headline: Bhaskaracharya found gravitational theory 500 yrs before Newton: Nepal PM
news_article: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told WION that Bhaskaracharya discovered the theory of gravitation about "500 years" before Issac Newton in 1150 AD. He added that Bhaskaracharya's book was published in 1210 AD. Oli said that even in his coursebook he was told that Newton found out the theory of gravitation.

news_headline: 2020 ties with 2016 as warmest year on record: EU
news_article: According to data published by the EU climate monitoring service, 2020 tied with 2016 for the warmest year worldwide. The year was also the warmest year in Europe since records began. It topped the previous temperature record of 2019 in Europe by 0.4°C. The data showed 2020 was 1.25°C warmer than during the pre-industrial period from 1850-1900.

news_headline: 2 IAF doctors to soon leave for Russia to train for Gaganyaan: Report
news_article: Two Indian Air Force doctors who have specialised in aerospace medicine will soon fly to Russia to get hands-on experience in space medicine for the Gaganyaan mission, PTI reported. The flight surgeons will also get to train with the prospective astronauts. Four test pilots from IAF, chosen for the mission, have been undergoing training in Russia since last year.

news_headline: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
news_article: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

news_headline: New chemical compounds to kill malaria parasite found: Scientists
news_article: A University of Pretoria-led research found new chemical compounds that could potentially be used for killing the malaria parasite in its infectious stage. It found that chemical compounds undergoing trials for treatment of tuberculosis and cancer can kill the parasite at a stage when it normally infects others. The compounds could also help create a new line of malaria drugs.

news_headline: OnePlus offers discounts on a wide selection of products from Jan 19-26
news_article: On the occasion of Republic Day, OnePlus is offering discounts on a wide selection of products from January 19-26. There's a ₹300 discount on OnePlus Power Bank, OnePlus Buds, and OnePlus Band while OnePlus TV Y series has a discount of ₹500. You can purchase the discounted products from Amazon or the OnePlus website.

news_headline: One of the greatest Test series wins ever: Sundar Pichai congratulates India
news_article: Google CEO Sundar Pichai congratulated the Indian cricket team for winning the fourth Test decider and the series 2-1 against Australia on Sunday. "One of the greatest Test series wins ever. Congrats India and well played Australia, what a series," he tweeted. India became the first team since the West Indies in 1988 to beat Australia at Brisbane.

news_headline: China unveils prototype of new high-speed train that can travel at 620 km/h
news_article: China has unveiled a prototype for a new high-speed maglev train that is capable of hitting speeds of 620 km/h. The China Railway Engineering Corporation (CREC) has said that it is expected to be the fastest land vehicle. The train runs on high-temperature superconducting power that makes it look as if the train is floating along the magnetised tracks.

news_headline: Signal can never be acquired by any tech company: Signal COO Aruna Harder
news_article: Signal COO Aruna Harder has said, "The Signal Foundation is an independent nonprofit. It's not tied to any major tech companies, and it can never be acquired by one either." She added, "Development is supported by grants and donations." The Signal Messenger COO also said that the app has no data with it to sell to anyone.

news_headline: Govt writes to WhatsApp, asks it to withdraw new privacy policy: Report
news_article: The government has reportedly written to WhatsApp asking the messaging app to withdraw the recent changes in the privacy policy. The government said that any unilateral changes wouldn't be fair and acceptable. In a letter to WhatsApp CEO Will Cathcart, the government said the proposed changes "raise grave concerns regarding the implications for the choice and autonomy of Indian citizens."

news_headline: WhatsApp must maintain sanctity of personal communication: Prasad
news_article: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday said all digital platforms, including WhatsApp and Facebook, must maintain the sanctity of personal communication. "You are free to do business in India but do it in a manner without impinging upon rights of Indians who operate there," he added. Further, he said the government is looking into WhatsApp's privacy policy changes.

news_headline: Mumbai Police lists fake shopping sites after 22,000 people cheated of ₹70 lakh
news_article: Mumbai Police has published a list of fake shopping websites after they busted a fake online shopping racket run by an IT expert from Gujarat. Using the fake websites selling household items, the 32-year-old accused cheated more than 22,000 people of more than ₹70 lakh. "Don't fall in the dark web of fake sites," the police warned.

news_headline: Selena Gomez warned Facebook of US militia groups on its site in Sept '20
news_article: Selena Gomez recently told AP that she had emailed Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg in September 2020 to warn her of US militia groups operating on Facebook. She had also pointed out several ads relating to election misinformation on Facebook. "I can't believe you can't check ads before you take money...you shouldn't be profiting from it," Selena wrote in the email.

news_headline: Google acting like super regulator: Fintech firms over loan apps case
news_article: Indian fintech firms have alleged Google is acting like a super regulator by asking for details that even the RBI does not ask for. They've sent a list of apps to Google, run mostly by Chinese companies, that have been allowed on Play Store despite offering 7-14 day loan products, ET reported. They have also demanded uniform regulations from Google.

news_headline: Probably won't sue you: Musk to man who's making SpaceX video game
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said he "probably won't sue" a developer who took his permission to use his space exploration company's name and logos for a video game. Developer Lyubomir Vladimirov said the game is called 'Mars Is Flat' and describes it as a "highly technical Mars survival simulator". He said 80% of the game's profits will go to SpaceX.

news_headline: Govt to build quantum computing lab in collaboration with Amazon
news_article: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology on Tuesday said it will collaborate with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to establish the MeitY Quantum Computing Applications Lab in India. The lab will provide access to quantum computing development environment for the developer, scientific and academic communities. Amazon will provide hosting with technical and programmatic support for the lab.

news_headline: Tesla to route India investment through Tesla Motors Amsterdam
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's investment for the Indian unit will be routed through the jurisdiction of Netherlands, as it has registered Tesla Motors Amsterdam as the parent organisation for Tesla India Motors and Energy, according to the company's incorporation documents. This would offer Tesla tax benefits related to capital gains and dividend payments, tax experts told Economic Times.

news_headline: Tesla starts delivering Shanghai-made Model Y SUVs in China
news_article: Tesla on Monday said that it has started delivering the Shanghai-made Model Y sports utility vehicles (SUVs) to its customers in China. The starting price of the Model Y vehicle has been set at 3,39,900 yuan (about $52,400). Tesla received permission from the Chinese government to start selling its cars in November last year.

news_headline: Hungary considering sanctions against social media firms
news_article: Hungarian Justice Minister Judit Varga has raised the prospect of sanctioning social media firms over "systematic abuses" and unfair commercial practices. "Tech companies...violate all those fundamental democratic legal norms that form the basis of Western-type culture," Varga said. She also claimed that Facebook limits visibility of "Christian, conservative, right-wing opinions".

news_headline: Online rummy industry urges NITI Aayog to set up self-regulatory body
news_article: The Online Rummy Federation (TORF) has urged NITI Aayog to set up a self-regulatory body to standardise regulations for the online skill gaming sector. The sector, like online fantasy sports, suffers from complicated set of state-by-state laws and regulations, TORF said. NITI Aayog had recently suggested setting up a single self-regulatory organisation for online fantasy sports industry.

news_headline: Scrap proposed laws to make Facebook, Google pay for news: US to Australia
news_article: The US government has asked the Australian government to scrap its proposed laws that will force Facebook and Google to pay for news sourced from local media outlets. The US said the laws may result in harmful outcomes for the two firms and could also "raise concerns with respect to Australia’s international trade obligations".

news_headline: HDFC Bank submits digital outage control plan to RBI
news_article: HDFC Bank's CFO Srinivasan Vaidyanathan on Saturday said the bank has submitted to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) a plan on how it will fix issues related to digital outages. In December, RBI had barred HDFC Bank from launching digital initiatives and signing up credit card customers following repeated outages of its services including ATMs and e-banking since 2018.

news_headline: 2021 onwards, every payments business will focus on profitability: Paytm CEO
news_article: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Tuesday, while addressing a summit, said that in the next two years starting 2021, every payments business will focus on profitability. He added that competition in payments is "getting mature". "Payments is so fundamental as a business that it will inevitably have n number of players," said Sharma.

news_headline: TikTok owner ByteDance launches payments app Douyin Pay in China
news_article: TikTok parent ByteDance on Tuesday launched a third-party payment service for its short video app Douyin called Douyin Pay. ByteDance had acquired a payments license when it bought out a payments solution provider called Wuhan Hezhong Yibao Technology in 2020. The license, in turn, allows Douyin, Toutiao and other ByteDance services to offer payment features.

news_headline: M'luru Police make prior approval for private drone operators mandatory
news_article: The Mangaluru City Police have made it mandatory for the operators of private unmanned aerial vehicles or drones to get prior approval from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and the Deputy Commissioner of Police (Law & Order)'s office. Drones that are being operated illegally will be seized and action will be initiated against operators, Mangaluru Police Commissioner added.

news_headline: Bill Gates-led clean tech fund Breakthrough Energy raises $1 billion
news_article: Clean tech venture capital fund Breakthrough Energy Ventures, led by Bill Gates, has raised $1 billion for a second round of investments which will be used to fund 40-50 startups. The fund previously backed 45 startups with initial $1 billion. Created in 2016, the principal investors of Breakthrough's first fund included Jeff Bezos, Mukesh Ambani, Richard Branson and Jack Ma.

news_headline: Microsoft, GM lead $2 bn investment in self-driving car startup Cruise
news_article: Self-driving car startup Cruise has raised $2 billion in a new equity round led by General Motors and Microsoft. The latest round has raised Cruise's valuation to $30 billion. Honda and other institutional investors also participated in the round. General Motors will continue to retain a majority stake in the startup, a Cruise spokesperson said.

news_headline: Telegram shuts down hundreds of calls for violence in US
news_article: Encrypted messaging app Telegram said it has shut down "hundreds" of public calls to violence on its platform by US channels. Founder Pavel Durov said the platform is open for political debate but explicitly prohibits public calls to violence. Durov said that the app's moderation team started receiving an increased number of reports about US-related public activity in early January.

news_headline: Apple sued for not removing Telegram app over violent content in US
news_article: A non-profit organisation has sued Apple in US for not removing Telegram from App Store despite knowing that it is "being used to intimidate, threaten, and coerce members of the public". The suit filed by Coalition for a Safer Web also alleges Telegram is being used to "coordinate and incite extreme violence" before the inauguration of US President-Elect Joe Biden.

news_headline: Our cyber world cannot be ruled by private company policies: Paytm CEO
news_article: "We cannot have our cyber world ruled and governed by private company policies," Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma told Indian Express while speaking at the India Digital Summit 2021. Sharing his views on an Indian app store, he added that if the store is controlled by the government or laws of the country, it does not matter who operates it.

news_headline: Every session we discovered new hero: Sachin after India's series win vs Aus
news_article: Describing India's 2-1 series win against Australia as "one of the greatest", Sachin Tendulkar highlighted how India discovered a new hero in every session of the four-match Test series. "Every time we got hit, we stayed put & stood taller. We pushed boundaries...to play fearless but not careless cricket. Injuries & uncertainties were countered with poise & confidence," Tendulkar tweeted.

news_headline: This is new India, ghar mein ghuskar maarta hai: Sehwag on India's win vs Australia
news_article: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to praise Team India after they won the Brisbane Test to clinch the four-match series against Australia 2-1. "Khushi ke maare pagal. This is the new India. Ghar mein ghuskar maarta hai," he wrote. "There have been World Cup wins but this is special," he further wrote.

news_headline: Ashwin trolls former England, Australia cricketers with Team India's 'Champions' photo
news_article: Following India's 2-1 series victory over Australia, Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took to Twitter to troll former England and Australian cricketers who had said India won't be able to win the Test series. Ashwin shared a picture which had quotes from the former cricketers. To troll them, he shared the group picture of Team India following their win.

news_headline: Egg on my face over here: Vaughan after his India series prediction goes wrong
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan, who had predicted that Australia will beat India 4-0 in the Test series, took to Twitter to react after India won the series 2-1. "Wow...That has to go down as one of the greatest if not the greatest Test victory of all time," he wrote. "Egg on my face over here in the UK," he added.

news_headline: Ravi Shastri delivers dressing room speech after historic win, BCCI shares video
news_article: The BCCI has shared a video of Team India head coach Ravi Shastri delivering a speech to the team in the dressing room after their historic win at the Gabba. "Today, forget India, the whole world will stand up and salute you," Shastri said. "You will be known as the ultimate warrior," he said addressing Cheteshwar Pujara.

news_headline: Ashwin mocks Paine over 'Gabba' sledge, tweets 'Good evening from Gabba' after win
news_article: Following Team India's victory at the Gabba, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin mocked Australia captain Tim Paine over the 'Can't wait to get you to Gabba' sledge. Tagging Paine in a tweet, Ashwin wrote, "Good evening from Gabba!" He added, "I am sorry I couldn’t play here but thanks for hosting us and playing some hard cricket during these tough times."

news_headline: Team India squad for the first 2 Tests against England announced
news_article: The BCCI today announced the Team India squad for the first two Tests of the upcoming four-match series against England. Captain Virat Kohli, fast bowler Ishant Sharma and all-rounder Hardik Pandya are back in the side, while uncapped all-rounder Axar Patel has also been included. The four-match Test series is scheduled to begin on February 5.

news_headline: Lyon 1st bowler to play 100 Tests without overstepping, has bowled 25,690 balls
news_article: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon has become the first bowler to play 100 Tests without overstepping. He has bowled a total of 25,690 deliveries without bowling a line no-ball. The Brisbane Test against India was his 100th Test. India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane presented Lyon a signed shirt from Team India to celebrate him reaching 100 Tests.

news_headline: Tharoor trolls Team Aus with word of the day 'epicaricacy' after Gabba loss
news_article: MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday trolled Team Australia with 'word of the day' tweet after India ended their 32-year unbeaten streak at Brisbane's Gabba to win the series 2-1. Tharoor shared the word 'epicaricacy', which means deriving pleasure from the misfortune of another. He also shared comments of former Australian cricketers who predicted trouble for India in the test series.

news_headline: Kevin Pietersen tweets in Hindi, asks Team India to be careful about England series
news_article: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to congratulate Team India on their Test series win against Australia. The 40-year-old tweeted in Hindi, saying India deserve to celebrate the historic victory as it came after several obstacles. He further said that the "real team" England are coming to tour India in two weeks and asked India to be careful.

news_headline: Indian fans troll, abuse wrong 'Tim Paine' on Instagram, he shares screenshots
news_article: Following India's 2-1 Test series victory over Australia, Indian fans ended up trolling and abusing a man named 'Tim Payne' on Instagram, mistaking him for Australia captain Tim Paine. Payne shared screenshots of the messages he got from Indian fans on his Instagram Stories. He said that he is being spammed and has received over 600 message requests.

news_headline: How does the WTC points table read after India's 2-1 win over Australia?
news_article: Following their 2-1 Test series victory against Australia, India jumped to the top of the World Test Championship (WTC) points table. India have accumulated 430 points and earned 71.7% points. With the defeat, Australia slipped to the number three position, with 69.2% points earned. Meanwhile, New Zealand are second with 70.0% points earned.

news_headline: Stayed up all night, now will sleep peacefully: SRK after India beat Australia
news_article: Shah Rukh Khan took to social media to congratulate the Indian cricket team for winning the Test series against Australia. "What an absolutely marvellous victory for our team," he wrote. "Stayed up all night to watch it unfold ball by ball. Now will sleep peacefully for a bit and savour this historic moment. Love to...our boys...Chak De India!" he added.

news_headline: You have left our house empty: Natasa on demise of Hardik's dad
news_article: Hardik Pandya's partner, actress Natasa Stankovic, took to Instagram on Monday to mourn the demise of his father Himanshu Pandya, who passed away due to a heart attack on Saturday. Sharing a few pictures, she wrote, "You've left so many beautiful memories but our house empty too." She added, "Fly high our angel...and thank you for everything, love you papa."

news_headline: Management always tells me you're a match-winner and I'm happy I did it today: Pant
news_article: India wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant remained unbeaten at 89 off 138 balls on the final day of the Brisbane Test and was named Man of the Match. Speaking at the presentation ceremony, Pant said it was one of the biggest days in his life. "The management always...tells me you are match-winner...and I'm happy I did it today," he added.

news_headline: Don't know how to describe this victory, just proud of the boys: Rahane
news_article: India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane said he doesn't know how to describe the series win against Australia which India won after using as many as 20 players in the four Tests. "It really means a lot to us...taking 20 wickets was the key...after Adelaide we didn't discuss about what happened, we just wanted to play our game," he stated.

news_headline: Time spent with Team India best time of my life: Natarajan
news_article: India bowler T Natarajan has described the last few months with Team India as the 'best time of his life'. "The last couple of months have been surreal...Playing Test cricket for India was a dream...Overwhelmed with your support," Natarajan tweeted. Natarajan came to Australia as a net bowler but went on to make his India debut in all three formats.

news_headline: Never ever underestimate Team India: Aus coach Justin Langer
news_article: After India won the four-Test series 2-1, Australia head coach Justin Langer said, "You cannot take anything for granted, never ever underestimate the Indians." He added, "I can't compliment India enough...We won [the first Test] in three days, bowled them out for 30 odd. For them to fight back like they did is amazing, credit to them."

news_headline: Still want to lead Australia, making WTC final still achievable: Paine
news_article: Amid criticism following their defeat to India in the four-Test series at home, Australia Test captain Tim Paine has said that he still wants to lead the side. "We've had a goal to make this World Test Championship final [and] I think that's still achievable," he added. Australia have slipped to the number three position in the WTC points table.

news_headline: Outplayed by disciplined, tough Indian side who fully deserve to win series: Tim Paine
news_article: Australia captain Tim Paine has said that they were outplayed by a "disciplined and tough Indian side" who "fully" deserved to win the four-Test series. "India turned up today, wore balls on the head, arm and chest, put their body in the line, so credit to them," he added. "There are many areas of improvement honestly," he further said.

news_headline: Messi suspended for 2 matches for swinging his arm at Athletic Bilbao player
news_article: Lionel Messi has been suspended for two matches for swinging his arm at an Athletic Bilbao player at the end of Barcelona's 2-3 loss on Sunday. After the incident, Messi was handed his first red in 753 appearances for Barcelona. Messi was facing a ban of up to 12 matches but his conduct was not deemed to be too serious.

news_headline: India become first team to beat Aus in a Test at The Gabba in 32 years
news_article: India ended Australia's 32-year long unbeaten streak in Tests at The Gabba in Brisbane on Tuesday with a three-wicket victory in the fourth Test. With the win, India clinched their second Test series victory in Australia on a trot. Australia's last defeat in Brisbane came against West Indies in 1988. They were undefeated at The Gabba in last 31 Tests.

news_headline: I looked good as captain because everyone contributed: Rahane
news_article: India's stand-in Test captain Ajinkya Rahane credited his team for making him look good while leading the side to 2-1 series win against Australia. "It's an honour to lead the country. It wasn't about me but about the team," Rahane said after the win in Brisbane. India have remained unbeaten in Tests under Rahane, with four wins and a draw.

news_headline: Smith, Warner were here, entire bowling brigade was here this time: Ponting
news_article: On Australia's series loss to India at home, ex-captain Ricky Ponting said, "It'll hurt, it'll dig really deep." He further said when India defeated Australia in 2018-19, experts said India got Australia when they were at their weakest, without David Warner and Steve Smith. "But guess what, Warner, Smith [were] here..our entire bowling brigade [was] here [this time]," he added.

news_headline: Whatever you say about Pujara, it will be very less: Sunil Gavaskar
news_article: Ex-India skipper Sunil Gavaskar has said Cheteshwar Pujara's 56-run innings off 211 balls on the final day of the Brisbane Test was extremely important as it gave confidence to his batting partners. "He held the fort together till the second new ball...[it] gave confidence to Rishabh Pant and then you see what happened," Gavaskar added.

news_headline: India to export COVID-19 vaccines to 6 countries from Jan 20
news_article: The Ministry of External Affairs has announced that India will export COVID-19 vaccines to Bhutan, Maldives, Bangladesh, Nepal, Myanmar and Seychelles from Wednesday. The government received several requests for the supply of Indian manufactured vaccines, the MEA added. "India is deeply honoured to be a long-trusted partner in meeting the healthcare needs of the global community," PM Modi said.

news_headline: New COVID-19 variant found in Germany
news_article: A new variant of the coronavirus was detected in 35 patients at a hospital in southern Germany on Monday. An official said that the new mutation was different from those found in the UK and South Africa. "The mere fact that it's a new variant doesn't mean it's more infectious," another official stated.

news_headline: China, WHO could have acted quicker to stop COVID-19 pandemic: Panel
news_article: The WHO and Beijing could have acted faster when Covid-19 first surfaced in China, a panel of experts commissioned by the WHO to investigate the global response has concluded. It stated that Chinese authorities could have applied their efforts "more forcefully" in January, 2020, adding that even WHO hadn't convened its emergency committee until January 22, 2020.

news_headline: China defends actions on COVID-19 after WHO panel says it could have acted sooner
news_article: China on Tuesday defended its actions taken to fight the COVID-19 outbreak, saying it immediately notified the WHO. Sun Yang from China's National Health Commission said China shared the virus genome sequence at the earliest possible time and took the most comprehensive, thorough, strict prevention and control measures. This comes after the WHO panel said China could have acted faster.

news_headline: China unveils prototype of new high-speed train that can travel at 620 km/h
news_article: China has unveiled a prototype for a new high-speed maglev train that is capable of hitting speeds of 620 km/h. The China Railway Engineering Corporation (CREC) has said that it is expected to be the fastest land vehicle. The train runs on high-temperature superconducting power that makes it look as if the train is floating along the magnetised tracks.

news_headline: What are the greatest threats the world faces in 2021 according to WEF's report?
news_article: According to World Economic Forum's latest Global Risks Report, Climate Action Failure is the biggest risk that may impact global prosperity in 2021. It is followed by Infectious Diseases, Livelihood Crises, Social Cohesion Erosion and Biodiversity Loss. Debt Crises has been ranked the 6th biggest risk, followed by Prolonged Stagnation of economies, Extreme Weather and Human Environmental Damage.

news_headline: Venezuela's Prez sends oxygen to help Brazil amid COVID-19 crisis
news_article: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has sent six tanker trucks loaded with oxygen to neighbour Brazil, as the latter battles its second wave of COVID-19 pandemic. Maduro said, "Let the people know that we are ready to support Brazil." The supply destined for Manaus and is equivalent to about one and a half days of oxygen demand in the city.

news_headline: Harris, Biden pay tribute to Americans who died of COVID-19
news_article: On the eve of the inauguration, US President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris paid tribute to Americans who have died of COVID-19. "To heal, we must remember...It's hard sometimes to remember, but that's how we heal. It's important to do that as a nation," Biden said during the vigil. The US has reported over 4 lakh coronavirus-related deaths.

news_headline: Over 40 lakh people in UK vaccinated against coronavirus
news_article: More than 40 lakh people in the UK have received the first dose of a coronavirus vaccine, official data showed. However, UK's Health Secretary Matt Hancock urged people to follow lockdown rules as data showed that more people were in hospitals with COVID-19 than ever. UK was the first country in the world to approve a vaccine against coronavirus.

news_headline: Taiwan cancels its annual lantern festival over COVID-19 pandemic
news_article: The Taiwanese government has cancelled its upcoming annual Taiwan Lantern Festival in Hsinchu city due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Hsinchu Mayor Lin Chih-chien said it would've been difficult to obtain contact tracing information for the expected 10 lakh visitors. The announcement came shortly after Taiwan reported four locally transmitted COVID-19 cases, the biggest daily rise in nearly 11 months.

news_headline: Russian policeman held over data leak about Navalny poisoners: Report
news_article: Russia has initiated a criminal case against a police officer accused of leaking confidential information that can help identify alleged poisoners of President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny, according to a report. He is accused of leaking information from a database about people's travel across the country. Currently under house arrest, the officer was detained last month.

news_headline: Trump orders assessment of security risks of Chinese drones in US fleet
news_article: President Donald Trump on Monday signed an executive order directing US agencies to assess any security risks from Chinese-made drones in American government fleets. If warranted, the use of drones should be discontinued and their removal should be prioritised, the order said. Trump also ordered an assessment of drones built by countries deemed as foreign adversaries, including Russia and Iran.

news_headline: Workers trapped for 10 days in China mine ask for pickles, porridge
news_article: Workers, who were trapped following an explosion in a Chinese gold mine on January 10, have asked pickles and porridge to be dropped to them, state media reported. The request came after a telephone line was dropped to 11 of the 12 miners who were found alive on Monday. The whereabouts of 10 of the 22 trapped miners remain unknown.

news_headline: Spain classifies Madrid, other storm-hit regions as disaster zones
news_article: Spain on Tuesday classified capital Madrid and other regions struck by Storm Filomena, the worst snowstorm to strike the country in 50 years, as disaster zones. The move will trigger emergency subsidies and other support measures from the government. This came as Madrid's regional government said the rains predicted for Wednesday would likely "cause floods when all...ice begins to melt".

news_headline: 68-year-old Putin takes dip in freezing water as part of ritual
news_article: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday took a dip in freezing water of a cross-shaped pool near Moscow as part of an Orthodox Christian ritual to mark the feast of Epiphany. The ritual commemorates the baptism of Jesus Christ in the River Jordan. The 68-year-old is often seen attending Russian Orthodox ceremonies.

news_headline: Iran holds 5th military drill in 2 weeks amid US Presidential transition
news_article: Iranian army commandos and paratroopers took part in exercises, its fifth military drill in two weeks, near the port of Jask on Tuesday. "The recent war games show to enemies [Iran's] will to defend its independence and territorial integrity," an Iranian general said. The drills come at a time when US President Donald Trump prepares to leave the White House.

news_headline: Trump leaves office with lowest approval rating of his presidency at 34%
news_article: US President Donald Trump's approval rating dropped to 34%, the lowest rating of his presidency, according to a Gallup poll. The survey showed that Trump's rating had fallen 12 percentage points since before the November 3 presidential election. Trump's average approval rating across his term is 41%, four points lower than any of his predecessors since Gallup began gathering data.

news_headline: Turkey to arrest 238 over links with cleric behind 2016 failed coup
news_article:
Turkey has ordered the arrest of 238 people over alleged links to the failed coup in 2016, state-run media reported. Of the 238 suspects, 218 were serving military personnel, including six colonels, three lieutenant colonels and nine majors. The suspects reportedly 
had links to cleric Fethullah Gülen, whom Turkey blames for leading the failed coup against President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

news_headline: Biden nominates transgender woman as his assistant health secretary
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden has nominated Pennsylvania Health Secretary Rachel Levine to be his assistant secretary of health. Levine will likely become the first openly transgender federal official to be confirmed by the US Senate, AP reported. "She is a historic and deeply qualified choice to help lead our administration's health efforts," Biden said in a statement.

news_headline: Snowstorm causes 134-car pile-up in Japan, 1 dead
news_article: A snowstorm has caused a 134-car pile-up on a highway in Japan's Miyagi prefecture, leaving one dead and injuring 17 others. Some 200 people were caught up in the crashes and rescuers are currently at the scene, officials said. The Japan Meteorological Agency registered a maximum wind speed of around 100 kilometres per hour at the time of the incident.

news_headline: Iran imposes symbolic sanctions on US President Trump
news_article: Iran has imposed symbolic sanctions on US President Donald Trump and various members of his administration, including State Secretary Mike Pompeo. Iran said the sanctions were result of Trump administration's role in killing top Iranian General Qassem Soleimani and for supporting "terrorism" against the country. The sanctions will have limited impact as Trump has no known commercial links to Iran.

news_headline: Iran, 6 others lose UN voting rights over non payment of dues
news_article: Seven countries including Iran have lost their right to vote in the UN General Assembly because of upaid dues, Secretary General Antonio Guterres said on Monday. The six other nations are Niger, Libya, Central African Republic, Congo Brazzaville, South Sudan and Zimbabwe. Iran has blamed US sanctions for being unable to pay $16.2 million to UNGA.

news_headline: Obama's ex-spiritual advisor gets 6 years in jail for $3.5 mn fraud
news_article: Kirbyjon H Caldwell, who was the spiritual advisor for both Barack Obama and George W Bush during their time as President, has been sentenced to six years in jail for his involvement in a $3.5 million investment fraud scheme. Caldwell, through his influence and with his accomplice, persuaded people to invest in historical Chinese bonds that aren't recognised anymore.

news_headline: North Korea's trade with China drops by 80% to ₹3,943 cr in 2020
news_article: North Korea's trade with China declined by more than 80% to over ₹3,943 crore in 2020, Chinese customs data showed. North Korea's exports to China accounted for over ₹351 crore of the total trade. This comes after North Korea closed its border with China last year to prevent the spread of coronavirus, that first emerged in China's Wuhan city.

news_headline: Swiss govt asks people to reject burqa ban in March referendum
news_article: The Swiss government has asked voters to reject a proposal seeking a ban on full facial coverings like burqa and niqabs in a planned March 7 referendum. The government said this move would hurt tourism and be unhelpful for certain groups of women. It has made a counter-proposal that requires women to reveal their faces for identification, when necessary.

news_headline: I'll defeat Mamata in Nandigram by 50k votes or quit politics: BJP's Adhikari
news_article: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Monday said he'll quit politics if he does not defeat West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by 50,000 votes from Nandigram in the state assembly elections. His statement came after Mamata Banerjee announced she will be contesting from Nandigram constituency. Adhikari also said that TMC is no longer a political party and has become a company.

news_headline: Cong forms 'grand alliance' with 5 parties in Assam ahead of Assembly polls
news_article: Congress and five other parties on Tuesday officially announced their 'grand alliance' for the upcoming Assembly elections in Assam. The CPI, CPI(M), CPI(ML), AIUDF and Anchalik Gana Morcha (AGM) are the five partners with Congress for the polls. Assam Congress President Ripun Bora said, "We will fight together to oust BJP. We'll keep our doors open for other regional parties."

news_headline: Tharoor trolls Team Aus with word of the day 'epicaricacy' after Gabba loss
news_article: MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday trolled Team Australia with 'word of the day' tweet after India ended their 32-year unbeaten streak at Brisbane's Gabba to win the series 2-1. Tharoor shared the word 'epicaricacy', which means deriving pleasure from the misfortune of another. He also shared comments of former Australian cricketers who predicted trouble for India in the test series.

news_headline: BJP sends people to disturb TMC meets, now I'll do the same: Mamata
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday alleged that BJP was sending people to TMC meetings to "create disturbance". "Now I'll send some people to disturb BJP, CPM meetings," said CM Banerjee while addressing a rally in Purulia. Referring to TMC leaders' defection to BJP, she said, "[They] can leave but we won't bow our heads before the saffron party."

news_headline: Stones pelted at BJP workers during party's roadshow in Kolkata
news_article: Stones were hurled at Bharatiya Janata Party workers during a roadshow in Kolkata on Monday. The workers were part of a rally attended by Union Minister Debasree Chaudhuri, state BJP chief Dilip Ghosh and BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari. "These tactics won't work because people of West Bengal are with us and they want a change," Adhikari said after the incident.

news_headline: J&K People's Conference pulls out of Gupkar Alliance over DDC polls
news_article: The Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference (JKPC) on Tuesday pulled out of the People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD). In a letter to PAGD President and National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah, JKPC chief Sajad Lone said that the votes cast against PAGD in the recent DDC elections were mostly by proxies of PAGD constituent parties against its official candidates.

news_headline: Why does Cong surrender to China time and again, Nadda asks Rahul
news_article: Ahead of Rahul Gandhi's presser, BJP chief JP Nadda tweeted, "Now that Mr Rahul has returned from his monthly vacation, I'd like to ask him some questions." Nadda added, "Can he deny that thousands of kms, including the one in Arunachal...was gifted by none other than Pandit Nehru to the Chinese? Time and again, why does Congress surrender to China?”

news_headline: New farm laws designed to destroy agriculture sector: Rahul Gandhi
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said new farm laws were designed to destroy Indian agriculture sector. He added that there is a tragedy unfolding in the country and India is now "owned by a limited small group of people who I term as crony capitalists". "We're seeing the last bastion which was protected from monopoly being overrun," he said.

news_headline: Reduced TMC to half in 2019, will wipe them out in 2021: WB BJP chief
news_article: Ahead of the West Bengal Assembly elections this year, state BJP chief Dilip Ghosh said, "We reduced TMC to half in 2019 and will wipe them out in 2021." Ghosh added, "Violent politics will continue under TMC rule... We will bring in a change in WB. As development is inching closer, they are getting uneasy".

news_headline: TMC engages in disaster management to stop leaders from leaving: BJP
news_article: West Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh on Sunday said, "TMC engages in disaster management to convince its leaders not to leave the party." "No credibility is left with TMC. Leaders and workers are fleeing from the party. It is disintegrating," he added. Ghosh announced that Union Home Minister Amit Shah will reach Bengal on a two-day visit on January 30.

news_headline: UP govt to take back 173 acres of land of Azam Khan's Jauhar Trust
news_article: Rampur district administration has passed an order to take back 173 acres of land of Jauhar Trust, headed by SP leader Azam Khan and his family, and register it in Uttar Pradesh government's name. The court found that the trust was not following conditions set by the UP government during sale of the land in 2005, ADGC (Revenue) said.

news_headline: Chidambaram questions govt on reports of Chinese village in Arunachal
news_article: Amid reports that China has built a village in Arunachal Pradesh, Congress leader P  Chidambaram on Monday said that "if this is true", it is clear that the Chinese have altered the status quo by converting a disputed area into a permanent settlement of Chinese nationals. "What has the government to say about these startling facts?" Chidambaram questioned.

news_headline: Will support Mamata Banerjee in Bengal Assembly polls: Akhilesh
news_article: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday extended his party's support to Trinamool Congress (TMC). "We will support Mamata Banerjee in the West Bengal Assembly elections to defeat Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) who wants to win by spreading hatred," Akhilesh said. "In 2017 as well, they (BJP) won in Uttar Pradesh by propagating hatred," he added.

news_headline: If anyone offers you money for your vote, take it: Mamata Banerjee
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said that the people of the state should take money for their vote if offered. She further said, "I have been seeing for a few days that some people are being sent by BJP to create disturbance in our meetings. Now, I will send some people to disturb BJP meetings."

news_headline: BJP more dangerous than Maoists: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
news_article: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has called BJP "more dangerous than Maoists" while addressing a rally in Bengal's Purulia district on Tuesday. In her address, she claimed that BJP leaders misled the Adivasi people of the Jangal Mahal area, within which Purulia is located, with false promises and didn't bother to visit them after winning Lok Sabha polls.

news_headline: Free to join any party: Rajini Makkal Mandram as some members move to DMK
news_article: Rajini Makkal Mandram (RMM) has announced that its members are free to join any other political party of their choice after tendering a resignation. The statement came after three district secretaries of the party joined Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) on Sunday. "They shouldn't forget they are always Rajinikanth fans even if they join other parties," RMM leader VM Sudhakar said.

news_headline: Party's Punjab unit to join tractor rally on R-Day as farmers: AAP
news_article: The Punjab unit of Aam Aadmi Party will join the farmers' tractor rally on January 26 in Delhi "not as a political party but as farmers", AAP's state unit president Bhagwant Mann announced on Tuesday. "The manner in which the...central government has been looting the constitutional rights...and working against the constitution, is very dangerous for the country," he said.

news_headline: Cong calls for 12-hr state-bandh after attack on Tripura party chief
news_article: In response to an attack on state party chief Pijush Kanti Biswas' vehicle, the Tripura Congress has called for a 12-hour state-bandh on January 19. Congress has alleged that the BJP workers were behind the attack. "It was a murder attempt. We don't support violence and are protesting peacefully," a Congress worker said.

news_headline: China occupied valley in Arunachal during Rajiv Gandhi's regime: BJP MP
news_article: BJP MP from Arunachal Pradesh Tapir Gao has said that China occupied Sumdorong Chu Valley in Tawang when Rajiv Gandhi was PM. He added that the then Army chief planned an operation but Rajiv Gandhi "denied him permission to push back" the People's Liberation Army troops. He further said, China has been constructing roads in Arunachal Pradesh since the 1980s.

news_headline: Lalu criticises Nitish government over increasing crime rate in Bihar
news_article: Citing a report, Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad Yadav criticised CM Nitish Kumar's government over rising crime rate in Bihar. "A total of 1,15,216 cases of crime were reported in the last year of RJD government in 2004, while under Nitish Kumar's government in 2019, crime figures increased to 2,69,096, more than double," Lalu tweeted.

news_headline: Time to throw Mamata Banerjee out of Nandigram: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
news_article: On Monday, BJP's Bengal chief Dilip Ghosh said time has come to throw Mamata Banerjee out of Nandigram after the Chief Minister announced that she will contest the upcoming assembly polls from there. "Mamata Banerjee can contest from anywhere, we are ready to defeat her. Senior BJP leaders had grabbed her hand and pushed her towards Nandigram," Ghosh added.

news_headline: Cannot  afford our voter base to shrink: Mumbai Cong President
news_article: Mumbai Congress President Ashok Arjunrao Jagtap said that their 'My Mumbai, My Congress' campaign aims at reaching out to "people and party workers" to understand their issues. Talking to The Indian Express, he further said Congress "can't afford" their north Indian voter base to "shrink". "There are other reasons also why we need to connect better with [them]," Jagtap added.

news_headline: TMC MP says he's not leaving party after meeting with WB CM's nephew Abhishek Banerjee
news_article: TMC MP Prasun Banerjee said that he's not leaving the party and urged those with grievances to "sink differences and work unitedly to fight BJP" in Assembly polls. This came after he held meeting with TMC MP and CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee. Recently, disgruntled TMC MP Satabdi Roy also decided to stay in party after meeting with Abhishek.

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi has run away from JP Nadda's questions: Javadekar
news_article: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has run away from giving replies to BJP President JP Nadda's questions for him. "A national party president is asking questions, you should reply," Javadekar said. "Who is he? Why should I answer him...I will answer the country," Gandhi had said in response to Nadda's questions.

news_headline: RSS' Pratinidhi Sabha meet to be held in B'luru in March: Reports
news_article: The RSS will reportedly hold a meeting of Akhil Bharatiya Pratinidhi Sabha (ABPS), its highest decision-making body, on March 19 and 20. As per reports, the meeting was scheduled to take place in Bengaluru in March last year but could not take place due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This year, the representatives are likely to elect new Sarkaryavah, reports stated.

news_headline: We've made the decision to implement changes: 'Tandav' director
news_article: 'Tandav' director Ali Abbas Zafar has issued a statement, announcing that the team has decided to implement changes to the web series "to address the concerns raised towards the same". "We thank the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting for the guidance & support in the matter," he added. An FIR was filed against the makers for allegedly hurting religious sentiments.

news_headline: Amitabh shares pic of rehearsing his first song for a film, Hrithik also seen in it
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan on Tuesday shared an old picture where the actor was seen rehearsing the first song he sang for a film. Bachchan's first-ever song that he sang for a film was 'Mere Paas Aao Mere Dosto' for the 1979 film 'Mr. Natwarlal'. "All this being overseen by...little one sitting on the bench...a certain Hrithik Roshan," the picture's caption read.

news_headline: He took his penis out and asked me to feel it: Sherlyn Chopra on Sajid Khan
news_article: Actress Sherlyn Chopra on Monday tweeted, "When I had met him (Sajid Khan) in April 2005, a few days after my father's demise, he had taken his penis out...and had asked me to feel it." "I remember having told him...that the purpose of my meeting with him was not to feel or rate his penis," she wrote.

news_headline: 'Radhe' to release in theatres on Eid 2021, Salman Khan confirms
news_article: Responding to an appeal made by the film exhibitors to release 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai' in theatres, actor Salman Khan on Tuesday tweeted, "I understand the financial problems that the theatre owners/exhibitors are going through...Enjoy 'Radhe' this year in theatres on Eid." The actor also urged the theatre owners to take utmost care and precautions for the audience.

news_headline: Even today, I don't think Ranveer knows everything about me: Deepika
news_article: Speaking about what attracted her to Ranveer Singh, actress Deepika Padukone said, "What attracted me to him was the fact...that we have been together for eight years and are still discovering each other." She added, "We are very different people. So, even today, I don't think he knows everything about me, and I can't say I know everything about him."

news_headline: You have left our house empty: Natasa on demise of Hardik's dad
news_article: Hardik Pandya's partner, actress Natasa Stankovic, took to Instagram on Monday to mourn the demise of his father Himanshu Pandya, who passed away due to a heart attack on Saturday. Sharing a few pictures, she wrote, "You've left so many beautiful memories but our house empty too." She added, "Fly high our angel...and thank you for everything, love you papa."

news_headline: There is no fight at all: Kiku on reports of tiff with Krushna
news_article: Kiku Sharda has refuted reports that said Krushna Abhishek got offended by one of his jokes about his uncle, actor Govinda, on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. "There's no fight at all, it's a part of script," he said. Meanwhile, Krushna also denied the reports and said, "There's no fight between me and Kiku...I love him, and I...love working with him."

news_headline: Want to tell that story to the world: Deepika on playing Draupadi
news_article: During a recent interview, actress Deepika Padukone confirmed that she will play the role of Draupadi in Madhu Mantena's upcoming production 'Mahabharat'. Commenting on the project, she told Femina, "The most famous story coming out of our country, Mahabharat, in which I am playing Draupadi, I want to tell that story to the world."

news_headline: We've regressed, people in 1950s and 60s weren't judged so much: Kajol
news_article: During a recent interview, actress Kajol said, "We have regressed as a society. I feel like, people in the 1950s and 60s weren't judged so much." While stating that earlier women could work more freely without being subjected to intense scrutiny, Kajol added, "Now...everything that you're doing is looked at with such minuteness...that's one of the biggest steps against feminism."

news_headline: Deepika Padukone's film based on 'Mahabharata' put on hold: Reports
news_article: Actress Deepika Padukone starrer upcoming film, based on 'Mahabharata', has been reportedly put on hold. According to reports, the makers of the movie are planning to revive work on the project at a later time frame. The project will be produced by Madhu Mantena Varma and will feature Deepika in the role of Draupadi.

news_headline: Stayed up all night, now will sleep peacefully: SRK after India beat Australia
news_article: Shah Rukh Khan took to social media to congratulate the Indian cricket team for winning the Test series against Australia. "What an absolutely marvellous victory for our team," he wrote. "Stayed up all night to watch it unfold ball by ball. Now will sleep peacefully for a bit and savour this historic moment. Love to...our boys...Chak De India!" he added.

news_headline: Quit my job as salesman and did Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar: Deven Bhojani
news_article: Deven Bhojani, who played a character named Ghanshyam in 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar', has said he was working as a salesman at that time and was supposed to go to Ooty for the shoot. "I quit...job and asked...father if I could go for...shoot," he added. "[Told] him to give me two years of my life...he happily gave me," said Deven.

news_headline: Tedious to find actors for film where actress has more screen time: Taapsee
news_article: Taapsee Pannu has said it's "tedious" to find actors for a film "where...actress might have 10-20% more screen time". "There have been times when actors, who've done lesser films than me, refused to co-star claiming there was nothing 'heroic' about their part," she added. "Not just me, Deepika...had to work with...Vikrant in Chhapaak, Kangana...with Jassie Gill for Panga," said Taapsee.

news_headline: Ayushmann's 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' had a no OTT clause: Reports
news_article: According to reports, actor Ayushmann Khurrana's contract with the producers of 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' included a strict theatrical release. Pinkvilla said quoting a source, "He [Ayushmann] along with his team has devised a plan to clearly bifurcate between OTT and theatrical content before coming onboard a film." Notably, Ayushmann's 'Gulabo Sitabo' was his first film to release on OTT.

news_headline: Always knew potential of OTT, I was a pioneer who jumped into it: Madhavan
news_article: Actor R Madhavan, who starred in 2018 web show 'Breathe', has said he always knew the potential of OTT platforms. "I was definitely a pioneer who jumped into it," he added. "Many platforms are cropping up, and thankfully become a great revenue earner not just for actors but everyone involved in the industry- technicians, junior artists, etc," Madhavan further said.

news_headline: When anything is free, your freedom is the price: Juhi on WhatsApp's policy
news_article: Taking a dig at WhatsApp's new privacy policy update, actress Juhi Chawla tweeted, "When anything is free, your freedom is the price." The 53-year-old actress further said, "They [WhatsApp and Facebook] said it's free. We closed our eyes. When we opened them, we had WhatsApp and Facebook, and they had our freedom."

news_headline: Tusshar Kapoor announces next film 'Maarrich' with Naseeruddin Shah
news_article: Tusshar Kapoor took to social media to announce his next production 'Maarrich', which will feature him sharing screen space with his former co-stars Naseeruddin Shah and Anita Hassanandani. "Beginning 2021 with Maarrich...a film that challenges me...to evolve as an actor...excited to share screen space with Naseer Sir after so long," he wrote alongside pictures from the film set.

news_headline: If something isn't working, part ways: Minissha Lamba on her separation
news_article: Actress Minissha Lamba, who announced her divorce from restaurateur Ryan Tham last year, in an interview opened up about her separation. She said, "Life goes on and the important thing is to be happy." Minissha added, "If something is not working, part ways amicably. Today we have options for that; there is no stigma attached to separation."

news_headline: MP govt will register a case against 'Tandav' makers: State Home Min
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said that the state government will register a case against the makers of 'Tandav'. Mishra added, "I condemn the way Zeeshan Ayyub, Saif Ali Khan and Ali Abbas Zafar reacted to our religion." CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also tweeted, "No one has the right to hurt our faith and insult our deities."

news_headline: Was asked to play dumb to get work: Bengali actress Ritabhari
news_article: Bengali actress Ritabhari Chakraborty, in an interview, said that she was once asked to "play dumb" to get work in films. The 28-year-old further said, "I was given example of other actors, who got projects because the heroes or producers aren’t intimidated by their presence...I am an educated person why should I not have a voice and be talking?"

news_headline: No hang-ups in doing intimate scenes on OTT if story demands: Shivin Narang
news_article: Talking about working on OTT platforms, actor Shivin Narang said that he is open to challenges and not apprehensive about doing intimate scenes on the medium. "I've no such hang-ups that I won't do them," he said. However, the actor added that such scenes need to be shot aesthetically and shouldn't be forced into a story to garner views.

news_headline: Varun's wedding outfit won't be anything over-the-top: Stylist
news_article: Talking about actor Varun Dhawan's wedding outfit, fashion stylist Akshay Tyagi said, "I don't know but I'm sure it won't be anything over-the-top, but rather something that's simple and subtle." Tyagi added, "As they plan to have a private ceremony, I think it will be very understated. But he is so unexpected, it can also be a suit."

news_headline: I don't think anyone did 'Zubeidaa' for money: Director on film's 20 yrs
news_article: On the 20th anniversary of 'Zubeidaa', director Shyam Benegal spoke about the film, which starred Karisma Kapoor, Manoj Bajpayee and Rekha. "None of them really earned money. I don't think anyone did 'Zubeidaa' for money. But [it] did win...National award," he said. "I don't think [it] did well financially. We were happy with the way it all happened," Shyam added.

news_headline: People think celebs fake mental health issues for publicity: Aakanksha Singh
news_article: Speaking about mental health, actress Aakanksha Singh said, "People in our industry often get targeted because people usually think that we're faking it for publicity." "We should rather be sensitive about it and shouldn't...jump to the conclusion that it's a publicity stunt," she added. "We should listen to people because it's a difficult thing to live with," Aakanksha further said.

news_headline: The whole legacy thing is limiting: Harsh Varrdhan on comparison with Anil
news_article: Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor talked about the expectations of carrying his father Anil Kapoor's legacy forward and said that he doesn't believe in the idea and added, "This whole legacy/lineage thing is a bit limiting." The actor further stated, "In our society there's not enough emphasis on embracing our own individuality...I didn't become an actor to do remakes."

news_headline: The all-new Volvo S60 is designed to help save lives: Volvo
news_article: Every car, Volvo said, is made to give people the journey of their lives while preparing them for every surprise on the way. The latest luxury sedan, the Volvo S60, lets you rediscover the thrill of driving, be it inside or outside, it is designed to help save lives while helping us keep our promise, it further mentioned.

news_headline: Aprilia SXR 160 is here to maximise your life: Piaggio India
news_article: The all-new Aprilia SXR 160 brings together a premium combination of style, performance and extraordinary comfort for an unbelievable riding experience, the company mentioned. Designed in Italy for India, it represents the new Aprilia design philosophy. Here's a ride that will transform your everyday experiences and lead you to maximise every one of them, the company added.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: General Motors unveils self-driving, flying Cadillac car concept
news_article: General Motors has unveiled a Cadillac-branded autonomous, flying vehicle concept at the 2021 CES show which is capable of carrying passengers from rooftop to rooftop. The single-seater electric vehicle takes off and lands vertically and can travel at speeds of up to 88.5 kmph. The concept is GM's first foray into aerial mobility and unlikely to go into production.

news_headline: As promised: Elon Musk on Tesla's India entry
news_article: Elon Musk has tweeted "as promised" in response to a news article about Tesla's entry into India. His response came after it was revealed that Tesla registered a new Indian subsidiary in Bengaluru and named its three directors. Last year, Elon Musk tweeted, "Next year for sure," in response to a user enquiring about Tesla's India entry.

news_headline: Tata Motors tweets 'tere mere pyaar ke charche' amid Tesla tie-up rumours, deletes it
news_article: Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday tweeted, "Aajkal tere mere pyaar ke charche har akhbaar mein, sabko malum hai aur sabko khabar ho gayi!", while tagging Elon Musk and Tesla, amid rumours of a joint venture between the two. The account, though unverified, is followed by Tata Motors' official handle. The tweet was deleted later.

news_headline: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
news_article: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

news_headline: Who are the three directors in Tesla's new Indian subsidiary?
news_article: Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, David Jon Feinstein and Venkatrangam Sreeram as directors in its newly-registered Indian subsidiary, Tesla India Motors and Energy. While Taneja is Tesla's Chief Accounting Officer, Feinstein is Senior Director, Global Trade & New Markets. Sreeram is a Bengaluru entrepreneur who has co-founded automotive tech companies Xenon Automotive and ClearQuote.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Mahindra & Mahindra cuts over half of its North America workforce: Reports
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra has reportedly cut over half of the workforce at its North American unit, which had over 500 employees in early 2020. Affected positions include engineers and manufacturing jobs at its Detroit plant that produces Roxor, as well as sales executives. Mahindra cited COVID-19 and a legal battle with Fiat Chrysler over an earlier Roxor model for layoffs.

news_headline: 200 iconic bikes thought to be lost in fire at Europe's highest motorcycle museum
news_article: More than 200 iconic bikes are thought to have been lost in a fire at Europe's highest motorcycle museum, located above 7,135 feet in Austria. Reports said that by the time firefighters arrived at the scene, the museum's building, mostly made of wood, was already engulfed in flames. The museum is known for housing classic motorbikes from 120 international manufacturers.

news_headline: Indians seek value for money even in luxury products: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
news_article: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk said Indians "look for value for money and that's even in a high-end product." He also remarked that usage in India is also different compared to other markets as many consumers here prefer the car to be chauffeur-driven. He said balancing between making car equally chauffeur and owner-friendly makes India "a slightly more difficult market".

news_headline: Microsoft, GM lead $2 bn investment in self-driving car startup Cruise
news_article: Self-driving car startup Cruise has raised $2 billion in a new equity round led by General Motors and Microsoft. The latest round has raised Cruise's valuation to $30 billion. Honda and other institutional investors also participated in the round. General Motors will continue to retain a majority stake in the startup, a Cruise spokesperson said.

news_headline: Tesla asks US safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla asked the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to declare its speed display issue as inconsequential to safety, reported Reuters. Over six lakh Tesla vehicles do not comply with safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements. Tesla said a majority of vehicles have since corrected the issue.

news_headline: Tesla starts delivering Shanghai-made Model Y SUVs in China
news_article: Tesla on Monday said that it has started delivering the Shanghai-made Model Y sports utility vehicles (SUVs) to its customers in China. The starting price of the Model Y vehicle has been set at 3,39,900 yuan (about $52,400). Tesla received permission from the Chinese government to start selling its cars in November last year.

news_headline: Tesla to route India investment through Tesla Motors Amsterdam
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's investment for the Indian unit will be routed through the jurisdiction of Netherlands, as it has registered Tesla Motors Amsterdam as the parent organisation for Tesla India Motors and Energy, according to the company's incorporation documents. This would offer Tesla tax benefits related to capital gains and dividend payments, tax experts told Economic Times.

news_headline: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
news_article: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage. It said the issue could diminish automakers' production and affect the US economy negatively. AAPC President Matt Blunt said he has also begun "nascent" discussions with the President-elect Joe Biden's administration.

news_headline: Tesla looking for sale, charging sites in Mumbai: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla has launched an extensive exercise to look for sites for sale and marketing of its electric cars which will be imported initially, reported The Free Press Journal. The company will also reportedly speak to Tata Power and Adani Electricity for its charging facilities. The company has also sought the intervention of the Maharashtra government, it reported.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, US startup Archer partner to build electric aircraft
news_article: Fiat Chrysler and US-based startup Archer have partnered to produce an electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. FCA will provide input that contributes to Archer's eVTOL cockpit's design, among other things. The aircraft will be powered by an electric motor and will be able to fly about 96 kilometres high at a ​top speed of around 241 kilometres/hour.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, PSA merge to create Stellantis, world's 4th largest automaker
news_article: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) and Peugeot owner PSA Group have sealed their $52 billion merger to create Stellantis, the world's fourth largest automaker. The merged entity will have annual sales of around 8.1 million vehicles. Stellantis can cut annual costs by around $6.1 billion without plant closures, a statement said. FCA and PSA first announced plans to merge in October 2019.

news_headline: Tesla's success should justify its share price: Raghuram Rajan
news_article: Economist and former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Raghuram Rajan said Tesla's success and spread of vehicles must be viewed firmly and should justify its rising stock price. He added that Tesla is a case of a stock that's being priced at many multiples of the price of automakers such as Toyota or General Motors.

news_headline: Tata Motors' shares rise 11% amid reports of tie-up with Tesla
news_article: Tata Motors' shares surged further 11% on Tuesday amid reports of it partnering with Tesla in India. On Monday, its shares had climbed 13%. Its shares also rose as it posted a 13.1% increase in the number of sales of Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) vehicles in the December quarter. The company added that China sales for JLR were "particularly encouraging".

news_headline: Audi delays output, puts 10,000 workers on furlough amid chip shortage
news_article: Audi will delay the production of some of its high-end cars due to a global shortage of computer chips, CEO Markus Duesmann said in an interview. The carmaker, part of the Volkswagen Group, has also put over 10,000 workers on furlough due to this, he added. Audi expects to make up for lost time in the second half of 2021.

news_headline: Jaguar Land Rover sales drop 24% in pandemic-hit 2020
news_article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover sales dropped nearly 24% in the calendar year 2020 owing to the ongoing pandemic. However, the company said that it saw a 13.1% quarter-on-quarter increase in sales during the October-December period. JLR's sales in China grew 19.1% year-on-year while it slipped by 16.3% in Europe and 17.2% in North America in the quarter.

news_headline: Retail auto sales grow for 1st time in FY21 in December
news_article: Retail automobile sales registered growth for the first time during the ongoing fiscal in December, data released by the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) showed. Retail sales across categories grew 11% during December due to "festive season and pre-buying due to price hike announcement". However, FADA said that the demand for vehicles in January looks "bleak".

news_headline: World's oldest cave painting of an animal drawn 45,500 yrs ago found in Indonesia
news_article: Archaeologists have discovered the world's oldest known animal cave painting in Indonesia believed to be drawn at least 45,500 years ago. The life-size painting of a wild pig also has two hand prints above the back of the animal. It was found in the Leang Tedongnge cave in a remote valley on Sulawesi island.

news_headline: New species of 'orange and black' bat discovered in West Africa
news_article: A new species of orange and black bat from the Nimba Mountains in West Africa has been discovered by scientists from the American Museum of Natural History and Bat Conservation International. The species has been named Myotis nimbaensis in recognition of the Guinea mountain range it inhabits. "It has this bright-orange fur...it was so distinct," said scientist Winifred Frick.

news_headline: 'Magic' mushrooms grow in US man's blood after he injects it in form of tea
news_article: A 30-year-old US man was hospitalised with organ failure after he injected himself with a tea made from psychedelic mushrooms, which later started growing in his veins. A case report said his liver was damaged and his kidneys weren't functioning properly. Doctors said he had tried to use the so-called "magic" mushrooms as an alternative treatment for his bipolar disorder.

news_headline: What is the Candida auris outbreak that was reported in a COVID-19 unit in US?
news_article: Candida auris is an emerging fungus that is often multidrug-resistant and some strains are resistant to all three available classes of antifungals, according to US' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC said it is difficult to identify with standard laboratory methods. A Candida auris outbreak was reported in a COVID-19 unit in Florida last year.

news_headline: Yellow mealworms become first insect approved in EU as human food
news_article: Yellow mealworms have become the first insect approved by the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) as a human food. "Rich in protein, fat and fibre, they are likely to be the first of many insects to feature on European's plates in the coming years," an EFSA food scientist said. Mealworms are already used in Europe as a pet food ingredient.

news_headline: Astronomers capture a distant galaxy 'die' for the first time; share pic
news_article: Astronomers have captured for the first time a distant star-forming galaxy about to 'die' because of a massive cold gas ejection. "It's distant enough that its light takes some nine billion years to reach us," the astronomers said. The galaxy is ejecting nearly half of its star-forming gas at a rate equivalent to 10,000 Suns worth of gas a year.

news_headline: 2020 was faster than usual, broke record for shortest day 28 times: Scientists
news_article: The 28 fastest days on record all occurred in 2020, with Earth completing its rotations around its axis milliseconds quicker than average, scientists said. The shortest day was July 19, when Earth completed one spin 1.4602 milliseconds faster than 86,400 seconds. Before 2020, the shortest day was noted on July 5, 2005, when the Earth's rotation was 1.0516 milliseconds faster.

news_headline: AI models to predict future of COVID-19 patients' condition made: Facebook
news_article: Facebook and NYU claim to have developed three machine learning models to help doctors predict how COVID-19 patients' condition may develop. Facebook said the model using sequential chest X-rays can predict up to "four days" in advance if a patient may need more intensive care solutions. The predictions could help doctors avoid sending at-risk patients home too soon, Facebook added.

news_headline: Indian student among winners of NASA app development challenge: Report
news_article: A high school student from Gurugram, Aryan Jain, is among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge, PTI reported. Jain had teamed up with six high school students from the US. The competition was a coding challenge in which NASA presented technical problems to students and sought their contributions to deep space exploration missions.

news_headline: Virgin Orbit launches rocket off a 747 aircraft, reaches orbit for 1st time
news_article: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit on Monday successfully launched its LauncherOne rocket into orbit for the first time, delivering nine satellites to low Earth orbit on behalf of NASA. The rocket took off from the ground attached to the wing of a modified Boeing 747 aircraft and detached and fired itself into Earth's orbit after reaching the launch altitude.

news_headline: Indian spacetech startup Agnikul builds 3D printed rocket engine
news_article: Chennai-based spacetech startup Agnikul Cosmos has developed a single piece, fully 3D printed rocket engine called Agnilet, which can be directly used in a rocket. The engine will be used in the second stage of Agnikul's launch vehicle Agnibaan, CEO and Co-founder Srinath Ravichandran said. Launched in 2017, the startup is involved in building India's private small satellite launch vehicle.

news_headline: Bezos' Blue Origin launches & lands latest New Shepard rocket, capsule
news_article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin has successfully launched and landed its latest New Shepard rocket and crew capsule. The capsule reached a maximum altitude of 107 kilometres, while the rocket flew up to a height of 106 kilometres. The capsule features six seats and has speakers with a microphone and a push-to-talk button at each seat.

news_headline: Bhaskaracharya found gravitational theory 500 yrs before Newton: Nepal PM
news_article: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told WION that Bhaskaracharya discovered the theory of gravitation about "500 years" before Issac Newton in 1150 AD. He added that Bhaskaracharya's book was published in 1210 AD. Oli said that even in his coursebook he was told that Newton found out the theory of gravitation.

news_headline: US sees biggest drop in greenhouse gases emissions post WWll era: Report
news_article: The US' greenhouse gas emissions fell 10.3% in 2020, the largest drop in emissions in post-World War II era, due to COVID-19, the Rhodium Group reported. By comparison, the 2009 economic recession caused emissions to drop by 6.3%. Under the 2009 Copenhagen Accord, the US pledged that by 2020, it will have cut its emissions by 17% from 2005 levels.

news_headline: 2020 ties with 2016 as warmest year on record: EU
news_article: According to data published by the EU climate monitoring service, 2020 tied with 2016 for the warmest year worldwide. The year was also the warmest year in Europe since records began. It topped the previous temperature record of 2019 in Europe by 0.4°C. The data showed 2020 was 1.25°C warmer than during the pre-industrial period from 1850-1900.

news_headline: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
news_article: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

news_headline: 2 IAF doctors to soon leave for Russia to train for Gaganyaan: Report
news_article: Two Indian Air Force doctors who have specialised in aerospace medicine will soon fly to Russia to get hands-on experience in space medicine for the Gaganyaan mission, PTI reported. The flight surgeons will also get to train with the prospective astronauts. Four test pilots from IAF, chosen for the mission, have been undergoing training in Russia since last year.

news_headline: Astrophysicist Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passes away at 84
news_article: Renowned astrophysicist Professor Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passed away on January 11 aged 84. "He will be remembered for his work in astrophysics and subjects like solar physics, gravitational lensing and science education," PM said as he condoled Chitre's passing away. "His valuable work will continue inspiring students in the times to come," the PM added.

news_headline: DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients made
news_article: The University of Cambridge said scientists have developed a DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients, who have double the risk of developing pneumonia while on ventilation than non-COVID-19 patients.
