The test gives doctors the information they need to start treatment within hours rather than days. It uses multiple PCR which detects the DNA of the bacteria.

news_headline: CO2 levels to be 50% higher than pre-industrial era in 2021: Report
news_article: Human activity will push concentrations of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere to levels 50% higher than before the Industrial Revolution, in 2021, the UK's Met Office reported. CO2 concentration is expected to exceed 417 ppm for several weeks from April to June for the first time. However, CO2 accumulation is expected to be slightly slower than usual in 2021.

news_headline: Scientists discover 2 dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda
news_article: Scientists have found two dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda. The Namibian giraffe is eight and a half feet tall, while the one in Uganda is nine feet and three inches tall. Both have standard long necks but short, stumpy legs. The medical condition that affects them is Skeletal Dysplasia, which the researchers say is rarely seen in wild animals.

news_headline: New state of matter 'liquid glass' discovered: Scientists
news_article: University of Konstanz's researchers have uncovered a new state of matter, liquid glass, with previously unknown structural elements. They used a model system involving suspensions of tailor-made ellipsoidal colloids to uncover the state. In liquid glass state, individual particles are able to move yet unable to rotate, a complex behaviour that has not previously been observed in bulk glasses.

news_headline: Megalodon babies, who ate siblings in womb, were larger than adult man: Study
news_article: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

news_headline: NASA finds FM signal coming from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the 1st time
news_article: NASA's Juno space probe has discovered an FM signal emanating from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the first time. One of NASA's ambassadors to Utah clarified that it is a ''natural function'' rather than a sign of extraterrestrial life. "Electrons spiralling in Jupiter's magnetic field are thought to be the cause of the radio noise we hear," NASA said.

news_headline: New chemical compounds to kill malaria parasite found: Scientists
news_article: A University of Pretoria-led research found new chemical compounds that could potentially be used for killing the malaria parasite in its infectious stage. It found that chemical compounds undergoing trials for treatment of tuberculosis and cancer can kill the parasite at a stage when it normally infects others. The compounds could also help create a new line of malaria drugs.

news_headline: OnePlus offers discounts on a wide selection of products from Jan 19-26
news_article: On the occasion of Republic Day, OnePlus is offering discounts on a wide selection of products from January 19-26. There's a ₹300 discount on OnePlus Power Bank, OnePlus Buds, and OnePlus Band while OnePlus TV Y series has a discount of ₹500. You can purchase the discounted products from Amazon or the OnePlus website.

news_headline: India's largest broking site Zerodha faces issues amid IRFC, Indigo Paints⁠ IPOs
news_article: Several users on Wednesday complained that they were facing issues with India's largest broking site Zerodha. They rushed to place orders for the IPOs of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) and Indigo Paints that opened on Wednesday. "This is not the first time it's happening," a user tweeted, while another complained, "I missed IRFC IPO just because of you Zerodha."

news_headline: Alibaba investors get $63 bn richer as shares soar after Jack Ma's video
news_article: Alibaba investors added $63 billion to their wealth after Alibaba Co-founder Jack Ma made a public appearance in a video, three months after his last public appearance in October. The stock rose 11% in Hong Kong, marking the biggest stock rally in six months for Alibaba Group Holding. Jack Ma spoke to 100 rural teachers through a video call.

news_headline: Jack Ma makes 1st public appearance in 3 months, speaks to teachers in video meeting
news_article: Alibaba's billionaire Co-Founder Jack Ma made his first public appearance since October last year, addressing 100 rural teachers in a video conference on Wednesday. "We'll meet again after the pandemic is over," he says in the video, released by the state media. Chinese authorities recently launched an anti-monopoly investigaton into Alibaba, after suspending its affiliate Ant Group's IPO.

news_headline: Mumbai Police lists fake shopping sites after 22,000 people cheated of ₹70 lakh
news_article: Mumbai Police has published a list of fake shopping websites after they busted a fake online shopping racket run by an IT expert from Gujarat. Using the fake websites selling household items, the 32-year-old accused cheated more than 22,000 people of more than ₹70 lakh. "Don't fall in the dark web of fake sites," the police warned.

news_headline: Electric car battery that can fully charge in 5 minutes produced for first time
news_article: Electric car batteries that can be fully charged in five minutes have been produced in a factory for the first time. The new lithium-ion batteries were developed by Israeli company StoreDot and manufactured by its strategic partner Eve Energy in China on a normal production line. StoreDot CEO Doron Myersdorf said the company is aiming for a 2025 mass roll-out.

news_headline: Elon Musk seen partying in Texas after confirming he has moved there
news_article: Elon Musk and his singer-girlfriend Grimes were seen partying in Austin, Texas days after the Tesla CEO moved to Texas. US comedians Joe Rogan, Dave Chappelle and others were also seen in the pictures. Earlier, Musk had criticised his former home state California's COVID-19 restrictions that forced Tesla to temporarily shut its factory in the San Francisco Bay Area.

news_headline: NITI Aayog releases India Innovation Index; Karnataka ranks top among states
news_article: The NITI Aayog on Wednesday released the India Innovation Index 2020 where Karnataka retained the top spot among the states. Maharashtra leapfrogged over Tamil Nadu to occupy the second place followed by Telangana, Kerala, Haryana, Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Punjab. While Himachal Pradesh topped among NE and hill states, Delhi topped among UTs and city states.

news_headline: Kangana Ranaut claims Twitter temporarily restricted her account
news_article: Actor Kangana Ranaut on Wednesday claimed that Twitter has temporarily restricted her account. This comes after she made controversial remarks about the creators of 'Tandav', a web series. In a tweet that she deleted later, Kangana had said it was "time to take their heads off", for allegedly insulting Hindu deities in the show.

news_headline: Biden admin plans position focused on antitrust, competition policy: Report
news_article: The incoming administration of US President-elect Joe Biden is considering creating a White House position focused on competition policy and issues relating to antitrust, reported Reuters. Currently, the US Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission share the work of antitrust enforcement and have been investigating Big Tech platforms such as Alphabet’s Google, Facebook, Amazon and Apple.

news_headline: YouTube extends ban on Trump over inauguration violence concerns
news_article: Ahead of President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration, YouTube has extended a ban on outgoing US President Donald Trump for another week "in light of concerns about the ongoing potential for violence." Trump's account still remains accessible but he is banned from uploading new content. YouTube had suspended Trump's channel on January 12 for violating its policy against inciting violence.

news_headline: Silicon Valley CEOs cannot lay down the law: EU chief
news_article: On Twitter's ban of US President Donald Trump, the chief of the European Commission said that such a decision must be taken according to the law and not by a "Silicon Valley CEO". Ursula von der Leyen added that Europe has a friend in the White House after "four long years" but it would strive to regulate US technology companies.

news_headline: Trump pardons ex-Google engineer guilty of stealing trade secret
news_article: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday gave full pardon to former Google engineer who was sentenced to 18 months in prison for stealing a trade secret. Anthony Levandowski worked for Google's self-driving car unit Waymo. He transferred over 14,000 Google files to his personal laptop before he left Google to found a self-driving truck company that was acquired by Uber.

news_headline: Apple patents tech that helps use Face ID even with masks
news_article: Apple has won a patent for facial recognition employing the use of heat maps to authenticate a user’s face, reported PatentlyApple. The patent also describes how Apple will counter obstructions such as hair, bandanas or face masks on a user’s face through the heat maps. The new technology will depend on the heat maps to create facial landmarks for recognition.

news_headline: Working to address the misinformation on policy changes: WhatsApp
news_article: WhatsApp on Wednesday said that it is working to address the misinformation around its proposed changes to privacy policy and is available to answer any question. "We wish to reinforce that this update does not expand our ability to share data with Facebook," a WhatsApp spokesperson said. The government has reportedly asked WhatsApp to withdraw its changes to privacy policy.

news_headline: Mobile unit generated $4.5 bn loss in 23 quarters, considering all options: LG
news_article: LG Electronics on Wednesday said it is considering all options for its mobile phone unit. It has generated losses for 23 consecutive quarters amounting to 5 trillion won ($4.5 billion) amid stiff competition, it added. "We have reached the point where we need to make the best decision about our mobile phone business, considering current and future competitiveness," LG said.

news_headline: Our cyber world cannot be ruled by private company policies: Paytm CEO
news_article: "We cannot have our cyber world ruled and governed by private company policies," Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma told Indian Express while speaking at the India Digital Summit 2021. Sharing his views on an Indian app store, he added that if the store is controlled by the government or laws of the country, it does not matter who operates it.

news_headline: Probably won't sue you: Musk to man who's making SpaceX video game
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said he "probably won't sue" a developer who took his permission to use his space exploration company's name and logos for a video game. Developer Lyubomir Vladimirov said the game is called 'Mars Is Flat' and describes it as a "highly technical Mars survival simulator". He said 80% of the game's profits will go to SpaceX.

news_headline: Microsoft, GM lead $2 bn investment in self-driving car startup Cruise
news_article: Self-driving car startup Cruise has raised $2 billion in a new equity round led by General Motors and Microsoft. The latest round has raised Cruise's valuation to $30 billion. Honda and other institutional investors also participated in the round. General Motors will continue to retain a majority stake in the startup, a Cruise spokesperson said.

news_headline: SpaceX delivers 60 satellites setting new rocket reusability record
news_article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX on Wednesday successfully delivered 60 satellites under its 17th Starlink mission. The Falcon 9 first stage rocket booster was launched and landed for the eighth time, breaking SpaceX's own record for the number of uses of single rocket core. SpaceX aims to provide global broadband coverage from up to 42,000 satellites and has delivered over 1,000 satellites.

news_headline: India plans foreign investment rule changes that may hit Amazon: Report
news_article: India is considering revising its foreign investment rules for e-commerce, Reuters reported citing government sources. The government may change rules to prevent foreign e-commerce firms from offering products from sellers in which they hold an indirect stake through their parent, it added. The move could reportedly compel firms, including Amazon, to restructure their ties with some major sellers.

news_headline: Govt to build quantum computing lab in collaboration with Amazon
news_article: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology on Tuesday said it will collaborate with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to establish the MeitY Quantum Computing Applications Lab in India. The lab will provide access to quantum computing development environment for the developer, scientific and academic communities. Amazon will provide hosting with technical and programmatic support for the lab.

news_headline: Facebook has no plan to reinstate Trump's account across apps: Instagram Head
news_article: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri, speaking at The Verge's weekly show, said Facebook has no plans to reinstate outgoing US President Donald Trump's accounts on its platforms. Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts were banned "indefinitely" following the US Capitol violence on January 6. Mosseri added that their focus is on avoiding the use of their platforms for violence at the inauguration.

news_headline: Wealthy investors worldwide exited Alibaba after monopoly probe: Citigroup
news_article: A large number of wealthy investors from Europe, Middle East and Africa region cut or exited their holdings in Alibaba Group after China ordered an antitrust probe into the company in December, Bloomberg reported, citing Citigroup's private bank. The investigation was launched, following the suspension of Alibaba-affiliate Ant Group's $35-billion IPO, for suspected monopolistic practices.

news_headline: Actress Manasi Naik, dubbed Aishwarya's lookalike, marries boxer Pardeep Kharera
news_article: Marathi actress Manasi Naik, who is also known for her TikTok videos and often referred to as Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's lookalike, got married to boxer Pardeep Kharera. The actress shared pictures of her wedding on social media and captioned the post, "Mr and Mrs Kharera". The couple got married in Pune.

news_headline: Samson named Rajasthan Royals captain after Smith released from team
news_article: Wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has been named the captain of Rajasthan Royals ahead of IPL 2021. The 26-year-old replaces Australian Steve Smith as the captain of the franchise. Smith has been released from the team ahead of the auction. Rajasthan Royals had finished last in IPL 2020, which was held in UAE.

news_headline: Kevin Pietersen tweets in Hindi, asks Team India to be careful about England series
news_article: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to congratulate Team India on their Test series win against Australia. The 40-year-old tweeted in Hindi, saying India deserve to celebrate the historic victory as it came after several obstacles. He further said that the "real team" England are coming to tour India in two weeks and asked India to be careful.

news_headline: Indian fans troll, abuse wrong 'Tim Paine' on Instagram, he shares screenshots
news_article: Following India's 2-1 Test series victory over Australia, Indian fans ended up trolling and abusing a man named 'Tim Payne' on Instagram, mistaking him for Australia captain Tim Paine. Payne shared screenshots of the messages he got from Indian fans on his Instagram Stories. He said that he is being spammed and has received over 600 message requests.

news_headline: Ravi Shastri delivers dressing room speech after historic win, BCCI shares video
news_article: The BCCI has shared a video of Team India head coach Ravi Shastri delivering a speech to the team in the dressing room after their historic win at the Gabba. "Today, forget India, the whole world will stand up and salute you," Shastri said. "You will be known as the ultimate warrior," he said addressing Cheteshwar Pujara.

news_headline: Which players have been released by CSK ahead of IPL 2021 auction?
news_article: Chennai Super Kings, who finished seventh in IPL 2020, have released six players from their squad and retained 18 players. Kedar Jadhav, Piyush Chawla, Murali Vijay, Harbhajan Singh and Monu Singh are the Indian players released by CSK. Meanwhile, Shane Watson, who retired from all forms of cricket, is the only foreigner released by CSK.

news_headline: Australian fan chants 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' at the Gabba, video goes viral
news_article: A video of an Australian fan chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' during India's Test against Australia at the Gabba has gone viral. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "I think he has an Indian girlfriend." Other tweets read, "Goosebumps!!!" and "Love is the best weapon to win anyone in this world."

news_headline: Team India squad for the first 2 Tests against England announced
news_article: The BCCI today announced the Team India squad for the first two Tests of the upcoming four-match series against England. Captain Virat Kohli, fast bowler Ishant Sharma and all-rounder Hardik Pandya are back in the side, while uncapped all-rounder Axar Patel has also been included. The four-match Test series is scheduled to begin on February 5.

news_headline: Harbhajan Singh and CSK part ways ahead of IPL 2021
news_article: Veteran off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to reveal that his contract with CSK has come to an end. "Playing for this team was a great experience...beautiful memories made and some great friends which I will remember fondly for years to come," he wrote. He added, "Thank you CSK management, staff and fans for a wonderful two years...All the best."

news_headline: Will forever be grateful, will never forget the sacrifices: Cricket Aus to BCCI
news_article: In an open letter, Cricket Australia (CA) thanked BCCI on Wednesday for their cooperation amid the global pandemic to 'help deliver a series that brought joy to millions'. "Australian cricket will forever be grateful to BCCI for their friendship, trust and commitment...We will never forget the sacrifices made by our friends at BCCI that made all this possible," CA wrote.

news_headline: Which players have been retained by RCB for IPL 2021?
news_article: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) have retained 12 players for IPL 2021 from their 2020 squad. They are Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers, Yuzvendra Chahal, Devdutt Padikkal, Washington Sundar, Mohammed Siraj, Navdeep Saini, Adam Zampa, Shahbaz Ahmed, Josh Philippe, Kane Richardson and Pawan Deshpande. Some prominent players released by RCB include Umesh Yadav, Aaron Finch, Chris Morris and Shivam Dube.

news_headline: Rajasthan Royals release captain Steve Smith ahead of IPL 2021 auction
news_article: Rajasthan Royals have released their captain Steve Smith ahead of  the IPL 2021 auction. Rajasthan Royals had finished last on the points table in IPL 2020, which had taken place in the UAE. Smith had played all the 14 league matches for the franchise last year, scoring 311 runs at a strike rate of 131.22.

news_headline: Latest rankings for Test batsmen out, Pant becomes top-ranked wicketkeeper-batsman
news_article: The ICC today announced the latest rankings for Test batsmen, with Team India's Rishabh Pant becoming the top-ranked wicketkeeper-batsman. Pant attained a career-best 13th position. South Africa's Quinton de Kock, who is ranked 15th, is the next wicketkeeper on the list. Team India captain Virat Kohli dropped one spot to be ranked fourth.

news_headline: KXIP retain 16 players from IPL 2020 squad, release list
news_article: KXIP, who had finished sixth on the points table in IPL 2020, have retained 16 players from their squad ahead of IPL 2021 auction. The players are: KL Rahul, Chris Gayle, Nicholas Pooran, Mohammad Shami, Chris Jordan, Mandeep Singh, Mayank Agarwal, Ravi Bishnoi, Prabhsimran Singh, Deepak Hooda, Sarfaraz Khan, Arshdeep Singh, M Ashwin, Ishan Porel, Harpreet Brar and Darshan Nalkande.

news_headline: Lyon 1st bowler to play 100 Tests without overstepping, has bowled 25,690 balls
news_article: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon has become the first bowler to play 100 Tests without overstepping. He has bowled a total of 25,690 deliveries without bowling a line no-ball. The Brisbane Test against India was his 100th Test. India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane presented Lyon a signed shirt from Team India to celebrate him reaching 100 Tests.

news_headline: Gill and Sundar's fathers disappointed with sons not scoring tons, Sehwag reacts
news_article: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to Instagram to share news clips showing Team India cricketers Shubman Gill and Washington Sundar's parents' 'disappointed' reaction on their sons not scoring hundreds in the Gabba Test. "Parents are parents after all. #parents #india #100sebadhkethacontribution (the contribution was even more than a hundred)," he wrote. "Typical Indian parents," a fan wrote.

news_headline: Formidable competitors on field, solid partners off it: PM Modi replies to Aus PM
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi thanked his Australian counterpart, Scott Morrison, after the latter congratulated him and Team India on winning the Test series against Australia. PM Modi tweeted, "It was a thrilling series with the best from both the teams on full display." He added, "India and Australia make for formidable competitors on the field, and solid partners off it."

news_headline: Time spent with Team India best time of my life: Natarajan
news_article: India bowler T Natarajan has described the last few months with Team India as the 'best time of his life'. "The last couple of months have been surreal...Playing Test cricket for India was a dream...Overwhelmed with your support," Natarajan tweeted. Natarajan came to Australia as a net bowler but went on to make his India debut in all three formats.

news_headline: Pant is an exceptional talent, played amazing on a day-five wicket: Smith
news_article: Australia cricketer Steve Smith has called India wicket-keeper batsman Rishabh Pant "an exceptional talent" for the way he batted on the final day of the Brisbane Test to win the series for India. "He (Pant) played a pretty amazing innings on a day-five wicket. He took the game on," the Australian said. "That was a pretty special innings," Smith added.

news_headline: I looked good as captain because everyone contributed: Rahane
news_article: India's stand-in Test captain Ajinkya Rahane credited his team for making him look good while leading the side to 2-1 series win against Australia. "It's an honour to lead the country. It wasn't about me but about the team," Rahane said after the win in Brisbane. India have remained unbeaten in Tests under Rahane, with four wins and a draw.

news_headline: Incredible Test & series win: Wasim Akram hails Team India
news_article: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram congratulated India for their Brisbane Test victory and 2-1 series win against Australia on Tuesday. Akram said he hasn't seen "a bold, brave and boisterous Asian team on a tougher tour of Australia". "No adversity could stop them, frontline players injured, & won after a remarkable turnaround from the depths of 36 all out," Akram tweeted.

news_headline: Sai Praneeth out of Thailand Open after testing COVID-19 positive
news_article: Indian shuttler Sai Praneeth pulled out of the ongoing Thailand Open on Tuesday after testing positive for COVID-19. According to Badminton World Federation (BWF), Praneeth returned a positive result on Monday and will remain in the hospital for around 10 days. BWF said Praneeth's roommate at the hotel Kidambi Srikanth has also withdrawn from the tournament and is in self-quarantine.

news_headline: Messi suspended for 2 matches for swinging his arm at Athletic Bilbao player
news_article: Lionel Messi has been suspended for two matches for swinging his arm at an Athletic Bilbao player at the end of Barcelona's 2-3 loss on Sunday. After the incident, Messi was handed his first red in 753 appearances for Barcelona. Messi was facing a ban of up to 12 matches but his conduct was not deemed to be too serious.

news_headline: Still want to lead Australia, making WTC final still achievable: Paine
news_article: Amid criticism following their defeat to India in the four-Test series at home, Australia Test captain Tim Paine has said that he still wants to lead the side. "We've had a goal to make this World Test Championship final [and] I think that's still achievable," he added. Australia have slipped to the number three position in the WTC points table.

news_headline: Whatever you say about Pujara, it will be very less: Sunil Gavaskar
news_article: Ex-India skipper Sunil Gavaskar has said Cheteshwar Pujara's 56-run innings off 211 balls on the final day of the Brisbane Test was extremely important as it gave confidence to his batting partners. "He held the fort together till the second new ball...[it] gave confidence to Rishabh Pant and then you see what happened," Gavaskar added.

news_headline: Sri Lanka minister tests COVID-19 +ve after drinking holy man's 'miracle' potion
news_article: A Sri Lankan minister who publicly drank a 'miracle' potion offered by a self-styled holy man, that was supposed to prevent COVID-19, was taken to hospital with the coronavirus. The women and child development minister, Piyal Nishantha de Silva, was among several politicians who consumed the concoction. Family members of another politician were also infected despite taking the syrup.

news_headline: Who is Vinay Reddy, Biden's speechwriter who has his roots in Telangana?
news_article: Indian-American Vinay Reddy is leading the speechwriting team of the new US President Joe Biden and also served as chief speechwriter when Biden was VP in Barack Obama's second term. While Reddy was born in the US, his family hails from Telangana's Pothireddypet village. He holds a bachelor's degree from Miami University and majored in political science and philosophy.

news_headline: Trump leaves White House for last time as US President, will skip Biden's inauguration
news_article: Donald Trump left the White House for the final time as US President, ahead of the inauguration of Joe Biden. Trump and his wife Melania will travel on Marine One to Joint Base Andrews, where they will board Air Force One to go to Florida. Trump will be the first US President in 152 years to skip his successor's inauguration.

news_headline: We will be back in some form: Donald Trump in final address as US President
news_article: In his final speech as US President, Donald Trump told his supporters, "We will be back in some form." He added, "We love the American people and again it has been something very special." He further said, "I want to thank all the great people of Washington, DC...all of the people that we worked with to put this miracle together."

news_headline: Trump pardons 73 people including ex-aide Bannon, rapper Lil Wayne
news_article: US President Donald Trump has pardoned 73 people including his former senior adviser Steve Bannon, who faced trial for siphoning money from an online fundraiser for Trump's border wall with Mexico. Rappers Lil Wayne and Kodak Black, who were prosecuted on federal weapons offences, were also granted pardons. A further 70 people had their sentences commuted.

news_headline: Tiffany Trump announces engagement on father's last full day in office, shares pic
news_article: Tiffany Trump, the youngest daughter of US President Donald Trump, announced her engagement to Michael Boulos on Tuesday. The news came on Trump's final full day in office. "It has been an honor to celebrate...milestones...with my family...at the White House, none more special than my engagement to my amazing fiancé! Feeling...excited...for the next chapter!" she wrote while sharing a picture.

news_headline: Woman arrested for making cupcakes with penis decorations in Egypt
news_article: A female pastry chef was arrested in Egypt for supplying cupcakes with penis and vagina-shaped decorations to a birthday party at a sports club after images of them went viral on social media. The Ministry of Youth and Sports has started an investigation into the matter. Egypt's top religious body warned that such baked goods were forbidden by Islam.

news_headline: Zimbabwe's Foreign Minister Sibusiso Moyo dies of COVID-19 at 61
news_article: Zimbabwe's Foreign Minister Sibusiso Moyo died of coronavirus on Wednesday, presidential spokesman George Charamba said. The 61-year-old was the one who announced the 2017 military coup that led to the removal of the late long-serving leader Robert Mugabe. "Zimbabwe has lost a devoted public servant and a true hero and I have lost a friend," Zimbabwe President Emmerson Mnangagwa tweeted.

news_headline: Tourists ordered to do push-ups for not wearing masks in Bali
news_article: Foreign tourists caught not wearing face masks in Indonesia's Bali are being ordered by the authorities to do push-ups as punishment. A security official said those not carrying a face mask had to do up to 50 push-ups, while those who were wearing the mask improperly were punished with 15 push-ups. Authorities had made wearing a mask mandatory last year.

news_headline: India to export 10 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses to Nepal
news_article: Nepal's Health Minister Hridayesh Tripathi has said India will export 10 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses to the country under VaccineMaitri programme, adding that the vaccine will arrive in Kathmandu on Thursday. Reiterating the friendship between two nations, Tripathi said the first lot of vaccines will be on grant assistance. Till now, India has exported vaccines to Maldives and Bhutan.

news_headline: New UK COVID-19 variant found in at least 60 countries: WHO
news_article: The World Health Organization (WHO) has said the new coronavirus variant that emerged in the UK has been found in at least 60 countries. The UK identified the new COVID-19 variant, that it said is 70% more transmissible, on December 14, 2020. The WHO further said that the South African-identified coronavirus variant has been detected in 23 countries and territories.

news_headline: Germany to extend COVID-19 lockdown until Feb 14: Merkel
news_article: German Chancellor Angela Merkel has said the government will extend lockdown until February 14 to combat coronavirus and prevent new variants from spreading. "Now is the time to take preventive measures against the threat of this virus," Merkel said. The extension comes after a new COVID-19 variant was detected in 35 patients at a hospital in southern Germany on Monday.

news_headline: 3rd Portuguese cabinet minister test +ve for COVID-19 in a week
news_article: Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Siza Vieira has become the third cabinet minister to test positive for coronavirus in a week. Vieira was already in quarantine at home as a precautionary measure after Finance Minister João Leão tested positive for COVID-19 following a meeting with European Union (EU) officials. Labour Minister Ana Mendes Godinho was the second minister to test positive.

news_headline: YouTube extends ban on Trump over inauguration violence concerns
news_article: Ahead of President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration, YouTube has extended a ban on outgoing US President Donald Trump for another week "in light of concerns about the ongoing potential for violence." Trump's account still remains accessible but he is banned from uploading new content. YouTube had suspended Trump's channel on January 12 for violating its policy against inciting violence.

news_headline: Biden admin plans position focused on antitrust, competition policy: Report
news_article: The incoming administration of US President-elect Joe Biden is considering creating a White House position focused on competition policy and issues relating to antitrust, reported Reuters. Currently, the US Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission share the work of antitrust enforcement and have been investigating Big Tech platforms such as Alphabet’s Google, Facebook, Amazon and Apple.

news_headline: Facebook has no plan to reinstate Trump's account across apps: Instagram Head
news_article: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri, speaking at The Verge's weekly show, said Facebook has no plans to reinstate outgoing US President Donald Trump's accounts on its platforms. Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts were banned "indefinitely" following the US Capitol violence on January 6. Mosseri added that their focus is on avoiding the use of their platforms for violence at the inauguration.

news_headline: Biden govt will elevate defence partnership with India: Austin
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden's nominee for Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin has said the Biden administration will continue to elevate the US' defence partnership with India. "I would further operationalise India's 'Major Defence Partner' status and continue to build upon existing strong defence cooperation to ensure the US & Indian militaries can collaborate to address shared interests," he added.

news_headline: Pray for the new administration: Trump in his farewell address
news_article: In his farewell address to the nation on Tuesday, US President Donald Trump urged the Americans to "pray" for the new administration in "keeping America safe and prosperous". "We extend our best wishes, and we also want them to have luck - a very important word," he added. Earlier, Trump had said that he would skip President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration.

news_headline: 12 US Guard troops removed from inauguration duty after probe
news_article: Pentagon on Tuesday said that 12 US National Guard members were removed from protecting the presidential inauguration of Joe Biden after vetting by the FBI. Of the 12, two guards were reportedly found to have ties with right-wing militia groups or posted extremist views online. The other 10 Guard members were removed for questionable behaviour found in the vetting process.

news_headline: Ball in US' court: Iran President Rouhani on nuclear dispute
news_article: Iran President Hassan Rouhani urged US President-elect Joe Biden to rejoin the nuclear deal, saying that "the ball is in the US court now". "If Washington returns to Iran's 2015 nuclear deal, we'll also fully respect our commitments under the pact," he added. Rouhani further said, "Trump's political career is over...and his 'maximum pressure' policy on Iran has completely failed."

news_headline: Jailed Navalny releases investigation into Putin's '$1.36 bn palace'
news_article: Jailed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny and his team have released a video investigation alleging that President Vladimir Putin owns a 100 billion-rubles ($1.36 billion) Black Sea palace. The video claims the palace contains a casino, theatre, ornate interiors and an underground ice rink. Russian government spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the palace allegations were old and untrue.

news_headline: Afghan peace talks moving at snail's pace due to Taliban: Govt
news_article: Speaking about the Afghan peace talks, a government spokesperson said that they are progressing "at a snail's pace". "The Taliban have no clear vision. We see no changes in them," he added. The government blamed the Taliban for a surge in violence and a spate of killings of officials, judges, journalists and activists in Afghanistan.

news_headline: US accuses China of genocide against Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang
news_article: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has accused China of committing "genocide and crimes against humanity" against Uighur Muslims and other minority groups in Xinjiang province. "We are witnessing the systematic attempt to destroy Uighurs by the Chinese party-state," he added. The US has determined that this has been going on since at least March 2017, he further said.

news_headline: Egypt and Qatar agree to resume diplomatic ties after over 3 yrs
news_article: Egypt and Qatar have agreed to resume diplomatic relations after over three years, the Egyptian Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday. This comes after Egypt reopened its airspace to Qatar earlier this month. In 2017, Egypt, along with Saudi Arabia, the UAE and Bahrain had imposed an embargo on Qatar after accusing the gulf country of supporting terrorism.

news_headline: Tyrant's era has come to an end: Iran Prez on Trump's departure
news_article: Commenting on US President Donald Trump's departure from the White House, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said that "a tyrant's era came to an end". Trump's four years "bore no fruit other than injustice and corruption and causing problems for his own people and the world", Rouhani added. During his presidency, Trump withdrew US from Iran's nuclear deal and reimposed sanctions.

news_headline: Cong forms 'grand alliance' with 5 parties in Assam ahead of Assembly polls
news_article: Congress and five other parties on Tuesday officially announced their 'grand alliance' for the upcoming Assembly elections in Assam. The CPI, CPI(M), CPI(ML), AIUDF and Anchalik Gana Morcha (AGM) are the five partners with Congress for the polls. Assam Congress President Ripun Bora said, "We will fight together to oust BJP. We'll keep our doors open for other regional parties."

news_headline: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh for families of those who died in Jalpaiguri accident
news_article: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended his prayers to the families of those who died in a road accident in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri. He also announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each to next of kin of those who lost their lives and ₹50,000 each for those who got injured. The Prime Minister's Office tweeted, "May the injured recover soon."

news_headline: Tharoor trolls Team Aus with word of the day 'epicaricacy' after Gabba loss
news_article: MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday trolled Team Australia with 'word of the day' tweet after India ended their 32-year unbeaten streak at Brisbane's Gabba to win the series 2-1. Tharoor shared the word 'epicaricacy', which means deriving pleasure from the misfortune of another. He also shared comments of former Australian cricketers who predicted trouble for India in the test series.

news_headline: Sasikala paid ₹10-cr fine, to be released from prison on Jan 27: Lawyer
news_article: VK Sasikala's lawyer said she will be released from Bengaluru jail on January 27. The lawyer added that he received official communication from the prison authorities regarding her release as she had completed her term and had paid the required ₹10-crore fine. CM Edappadi Palaniswami said Sasikala won't return to AIADMK after her release.

news_headline: BJP sends people to disturb TMC meets, now I'll do the same: Mamata
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday alleged that BJP was sending people to TMC meetings to "create disturbance". "Now I'll send some people to disturb BJP, CPM meetings," said CM Banerjee while addressing a rally in Purulia. Referring to TMC leaders' defection to BJP, she said, "[They] can leave but we won't bow our heads before the saffron party."

news_headline: J&K People's Conference pulls out of Gupkar Alliance over DDC polls
news_article: The Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference (JKPC) on Tuesday pulled out of the People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD). In a letter to PAGD President and National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah, JKPC chief Sajad Lone said that the votes cast against PAGD in the recent DDC elections were mostly by proxies of PAGD constituent parties against its official candidates.

news_headline: Cong, SP seek removal of Savarkar's portrait from UP assembly
news_article: The Congress and the Samajwadi Party have demanded the removal of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's portrait from the picture gallery of the Uttar Pradesh assembly. "His picture is nothing but an insult to our great freedom fighters," said Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav. "It should be removed immediately and can be placed at the BJP office," Congress leader Deepak Singh added.

news_headline: Rajasthan Congress MLA Gajendra Singh Shaktawat passes away aged 48
news_article: Rajasthan Congress MLA Gajendra Singh Shaktawat passed away aged 48 on Wednesday, following a prolonged illness. Shaktawat had been undergoing treatment for a liver-related ailment for over a month, said media reports. He was one of the 18 Congress MLAs who had sided with Sachin Pilot during the political crisis in Rajasthan last year.

news_headline: Reduced TMC to half in 2019, will wipe them out in 2021: WB BJP chief
news_article: Ahead of the West Bengal Assembly elections this year, state BJP chief Dilip Ghosh said, "We reduced TMC to half in 2019 and will wipe them out in 2021." Ghosh added, "Violent politics will continue under TMC rule... We will bring in a change in WB. As development is inching closer, they are getting uneasy".

news_headline: New farm laws designed to destroy agriculture sector: Rahul Gandhi
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said new farm laws were designed to destroy Indian agriculture sector. He added that there is a tragedy unfolding in the country and India is now "owned by a limited small group of people who I term as crony capitalists". "We're seeing the last bastion which was protected from monopoly being overrun," he said.

news_headline: Why does Cong surrender to China time and again, Nadda asks Rahul
news_article: Ahead of Rahul Gandhi's presser, BJP chief JP Nadda tweeted, "Now that Mr Rahul has returned from his monthly vacation, I'd like to ask him some questions." Nadda added, "Can he deny that thousands of kms, including the one in Arunachal...was gifted by none other than Pandit Nehru to the Chinese? Time and again, why does Congress surrender to China?”

news_headline: RSS' Pratinidhi Sabha meet to be held in B'luru in March: Reports
news_article: The RSS will reportedly hold a meeting of Akhil Bharatiya Pratinidhi Sabha (ABPS), its highest decision-making body, on March 19 and 20. As per reports, the meeting was scheduled to take place in Bengaluru in March last year but could not take place due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This year, the representatives are likely to elect new Sarkaryavah, reports stated.

news_headline: Will support Mamata Banerjee in Bengal Assembly polls: Akhilesh
news_article: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday extended his party's support to Trinamool Congress (TMC). "We will support Mamata Banerjee in the West Bengal Assembly elections to defeat Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) who wants to win by spreading hatred," Akhilesh said. "In 2017 as well, they (BJP) won in Uttar Pradesh by propagating hatred," he added.

news_headline: Party's Punjab unit to join tractor rally on R-Day as farmers: AAP
news_article: The Punjab unit of Aam Aadmi Party will join the farmers' tractor rally on January 26 in Delhi "not as a political party but as farmers", AAP's state unit president Bhagwant Mann announced on Tuesday. "The manner in which the...central government has been looting the constitutional rights...and working against the constitution, is very dangerous for the country," he said.

news_headline: Time to throw Mamata Banerjee out of Nandigram: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
news_article: On Monday, BJP's Bengal chief Dilip Ghosh said time has come to throw Mamata Banerjee out of Nandigram after the Chief Minister announced that she will contest the upcoming assembly polls from there. "Mamata Banerjee can contest from anywhere, we are ready to defeat her. Senior BJP leaders had grabbed her hand and pushed her towards Nandigram," Ghosh added.

news_headline: Chidambaram questions govt on reports of Chinese village in Arunachal
news_article: Amid reports that China has built a village in Arunachal Pradesh, Congress leader P  Chidambaram on Monday said that "if this is true", it is clear that the Chinese have altered the status quo by converting a disputed area into a permanent settlement of Chinese nationals. "What has the government to say about these startling facts?" Chidambaram questioned.

news_headline: BJP more dangerous than Maoists: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
news_article: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has called BJP "more dangerous than Maoists" while addressing a rally in Bengal's Purulia district on Tuesday. In her address, she claimed that BJP leaders misled the Adivasi people of the Jangal Mahal area, within which Purulia is located, with false promises and didn't bother to visit them after winning Lok Sabha polls.

news_headline: TMC engages in disaster management to stop leaders from leaving: BJP
news_article: West Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh on Sunday said, "TMC engages in disaster management to convince its leaders not to leave the party." "No credibility is left with TMC. Leaders and workers are fleeing from the party. It is disintegrating," he added. Ghosh announced that Union Home Minister Amit Shah will reach Bengal on a two-day visit on January 30.

news_headline: UP govt to take back 173 acres of land of Azam Khan's Jauhar Trust
news_article: Rampur district administration has passed an order to take back 173 acres of land of Jauhar Trust, headed by SP leader Azam Khan and his family, and register it in Uttar Pradesh government's name. The court found that the trust was not following conditions set by the UP government during sale of the land in 2005, ADGC (Revenue) said.

news_headline: China occupied valley in Arunachal during Rajiv Gandhi's regime: BJP MP
news_article: BJP MP from Arunachal Pradesh Tapir Gao has said that China occupied Sumdorong Chu Valley in Tawang when Rajiv Gandhi was PM. He added that the then Army chief planned an operation but Rajiv Gandhi "denied him permission to push back" the People's Liberation Army troops. He further said, China has been constructing roads in Arunachal Pradesh since the 1980s.

news_headline: TMC MP says he's not leaving party after meeting with WB CM's nephew Abhishek Banerjee
news_article: TMC MP Prasun Banerjee said that he's not leaving the party and urged those with grievances to "sink differences and work unitedly to fight BJP" in Assembly polls. This came after he held meeting with TMC MP and CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee. Recently, disgruntled TMC MP Satabdi Roy also decided to stay in party after meeting with Abhishek.

news_headline: If anyone offers you money for your vote, take it: Mamata Banerjee
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said that the people of the state should take money for their vote if offered. She further said, "I have been seeing for a few days that some people are being sent by BJP to create disturbance in our meetings. Now, I will send some people to disturb BJP meetings."

news_headline: Won't let you contest polls from two seats: Suvendu Adhikari to Mamata
news_article: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikhari on Tuesday said his party won't let Mamata Banerjee contest elections from two seats in the upcoming Assembly elections. The West Bengal Chief Minister had announced on Monday that if possible she would contest from Purba Medinipur's Nandigram and  Bhabanipur in Kolkata. "You've to contest the election from Nandigram only," Adhikhari said during a public meeting.

news_headline: New farm laws are an assault on middle class: Rahul Gandhi
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that agriculture was the last sector that was protected from monopoly but "is now being overrun". He added that Prime Minister Narendra Modi aims to give "the agricultural system to three or four of his friends" and that the farm laws were not an assault on the farmers but on the middle class.

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi has run away from JP Nadda's questions: Javadekar
news_article: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has run away from giving replies to BJP President JP Nadda's questions for him. "A national party president is asking questions, you should reply," Javadekar said. "Who is he? Why should I answer him...I will answer the country," Gandhi had said in response to Nadda's questions.

news_headline: Don't feel the need to know about biological parents: Sushmita's daughter
news_article: Sushmita Sen's daughter Renee Sen, in an interview with Bollywood Bubble, said that she doesn't "feel the need" to know about her biological parents. She further said, "My mom is my everything... I mean no disrespect to anyone who wants to know about it. Please go ahead if it makes you happy but it doesn’t make me happy."

news_headline: Actress Manasi Naik, dubbed Aishwarya's lookalike, marries boxer Pardeep Kharera
news_article: Marathi actress Manasi Naik, who is also known for her TikTok videos and often referred to as Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's lookalike, got married to boxer Pardeep Kharera. The actress shared pictures of her wedding on social media and captioned the post, "Mr and Mrs Kharera". The couple got married in Pune.

news_headline: Was asked to compromise for a role on OTT platform: Maanvi Gagroo
news_article: Actress Maanvi Gagroo, in an interview with Times of India, revealed that she was once asked to "compromise" for a role if she wanted to work with an OTT platform. However, the actress went ahead and complained about the offender to the platform and demanded an action to be taken. Notably, Maanvi has worked in several popular web series.

news_headline: 'Tandav' actors booked by Mumbai Police, MLA says 'Saif should also apologise'
news_article: An FIR has been registered against the makers and actors of 'Tandav', including Saif Ali Khan, at Mumbai's Ghatkopar Police station. "Mocking of our Hindu Gods will not be tolerated. We will not stop our Tandav until adequate punishment is meted out to the culprits...Saif Ali Khan should also apologise," tweeted BJP MLA Ram Kadam, who had filed the complaint.

news_headline: Had a great urge to drink yesterday after being sober for 4 yrs: Pooja
news_article: Filmmaker-actress Pooja Bhatt, who first opened up about battling alcoholism in 2017, on Wednesday talked about how she overcame a "great urge to drink yesterday" after being sober for almost four years. Pooja added she imagined opening a champagne bottle and pouring a glass for her as "resisting" would've led to giving in. She said, "Healing requires compassion, not bravado".

news_headline: We've made the decision to implement changes: 'Tandav' director
news_article: 'Tandav' director Ali Abbas Zafar has issued a statement, announcing that the team has decided to implement changes to the web series "to address the concerns raised towards the same". "We thank the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting for the guidance & support in the matter," he added. An FIR was filed against the makers for allegedly hurting religious sentiments.

news_headline: People's love is medicine: Kamal Haasan in 1st message after leg surgery
news_article: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Tuesday shared his first message after undergoing leg surgery. He said the operation was successful and added, "I'll be at...hospital until the wound heals. I'll continue to be active on social media and will remain in your hearts. People's love is medicine." Kamal also thanked the medical team at Sri Ramachandra Hospital in Chennai.

news_headline: Nothing has been finalised: Pratik on reports of doing Tigmanshu's web show
news_article: Pratik Gandhi, who was recently seen in web show 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story', has reacted to reports that said he has signed a series which will be produced and directed by Tigmanshu Dhulia. "I'm in talks with them...Nothing has been finalised as yet...I don't know where this report of my signing the series has come from," he said.

news_headline: Unique experience: Rana on filming Mission Frontline with BSF soldiers
news_article: Actor Rana Daggubati has said he realised how tough and hard the lives of Border Security Force (BSF) personnel are when he shot for the documentary 'Mission Frontline'. Rana, who features alongside BSF soldiers in the documentary, added, "Taking a leaf out of their [lives] and bringing it to the people was for me the most unique experience of all."

news_headline: Was asked to play dumb to get work: Bengali actress Ritabhari
news_article: Bengali actress Ritabhari Chakraborty, in an interview, said that she was once asked to "play dumb" to get work in films. The 28-year-old further said, "I was given example of other actors, who got projects because the heroes or producers aren’t intimidated by their presence...I am an educated person why should I not have a voice and be talking?"

news_headline: Always knew potential of OTT, I was a pioneer who jumped into it: Madhavan
news_article: Actor R Madhavan, who starred in 2018 web show 'Breathe', has said he always knew the potential of OTT platforms. "I was definitely a pioneer who jumped into it," he added. "Many platforms are cropping up, and thankfully become a great revenue earner not just for actors but everyone involved in the industry- technicians, junior artists, etc," Madhavan further said.

news_headline: MP govt will register a case against 'Tandav' makers: State Home Min
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said that the state government will register a case against the makers of 'Tandav'. Mishra added, "I condemn the way Zeeshan Ayyub, Saif Ali Khan and Ali Abbas Zafar reacted to our religion." CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also tweeted, "No one has the right to hurt our faith and insult our deities."

news_headline: Varun's wedding outfit won't be anything over-the-top: Stylist
news_article: Talking about actor Varun Dhawan's wedding outfit, fashion stylist Akshay Tyagi said, "I don't know but I'm sure it won't be anything over-the-top, but rather something that's simple and subtle." Tyagi added, "As they plan to have a private ceremony, I think it will be very understated. But he is so unexpected, it can also be a suit."

news_headline: Will be refreshing to portray good guy: Saif on Vikram Vedha remake
news_article: Saif Ali Khan, who will star in the Hindi remake of 2017 Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha', spoke about his role and said, "I'll play an idealistic cop." He added, "I'll have to find a way to make him fun. But it'll be a refreshing change to portray...good guy." Reportedly, Saif will share screen space with Hrithik Roshan in the film.

news_headline: British series 'Peaky Blinders' to be made into a movie
news_article: British drama series 'Peaky Blinders' will be made into a movie, creator Steven Wright said. "COVID-19 changed our plans. But I can say that my plan from the beginning was to end 'Peaky' with a movie. That is what is going to happen," Wright added. Notably, this comes after the announcement that 'Peaky Blinders' will conclude with the sixth season.

news_headline: Dadasaheb Phalke should be given Bharat Ratna: Grandson
news_article: Late filmmaker Dadasaheb Phalke, regarded as the father of Indian cinema, should be given Bharat Ratna, his grandson Chandrashekhar Pusalkar said at the 51st International Film Festival of India. "Also...industry should seriously think about making a biopic on him," he added. "Celebrities will come and go...as long as cinema is there, Dadasaheb Phalke will be remembered," Pusalkar stated.

news_headline: UP Police reaches Mumbai for investigation over 'Tandav' controversy
news_article: A team of UP Police reached Mumbai on Wednesday for investigation over the FIR registered against the web series 'Tandav'. FIR was registered in Lucknow against series makers for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. Tagging Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's official account, Shalabh Mani Tripathi, UP CM Yogi Adityanath's Media Adviser tweeted, "Hopefully, you will not come to their rescue."

news_headline: Nawazuddin flies to London for a shoot, says 'The show must go on'
news_article: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has left for London to commence the shooting of his thriller film 'Sangeen'. Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, the actor shared a picture of himself from the airport and wrote, "Off to London, aware of the tough conditions but...The Show Must Go On!" Directed by Jaideep Chopra, the film also features actress Elnaaz Norouzi.

news_headline: Some of that has carried through my life: Sunny on being bullied as kid
news_article: Actress Sunny Leone recently spoke about being bullied as a child and said that children used to tease her for the way she looked. "I was a light-skinned Indian girl with...dark hair on her arms and legs and...very awkward looking," she added. "Some of that bullying has carried through my entire life which isn't a great feeling," Sunny further said.

news_headline: No hang-ups in doing intimate scenes on OTT if story demands: Shivin Narang
news_article: Talking about working on OTT platforms, actor Shivin Narang said that he is open to challenges and not apprehensive about doing intimate scenes on the medium. "I've no such hang-ups that I won't do them," he said. However, the actor added that such scenes need to be shot aesthetically and shouldn't be forced into a story to garner views.

news_headline: Even today, I don't think Ranveer knows everything about me: Deepika
news_article: Speaking about what attracted her to Ranveer Singh, actress Deepika Padukone said, "What attracted me to him was the fact...that we have been together for eight years and are still discovering each other." She added, "We are very different people. So, even today, I don't think he knows everything about me, and I can't say I know everything about him."

news_headline: There is no fight at all: Kiku on reports of tiff with Krushna
news_article: Kiku Sharda has refuted reports that said Krushna Abhishek got offended by one of his jokes about his uncle, actor Govinda, on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. "There's no fight at all, it's a part of script," he said. Meanwhile, Krushna also denied the reports and said, "There's no fight between me and Kiku...I love him, and I...love working with him."

news_headline: Kangana Ranaut claims Twitter temporarily restricted her account
news_article: Actor Kangana Ranaut on Wednesday claimed that Twitter has temporarily restricted her account. This comes after she made controversial remarks about the creators of 'Tandav', a web series. In a tweet that she deleted later, Kangana had said it was "time to take their heads off", for allegedly insulting Hindu deities in the show.

news_headline: Salman plans to begin the shoot of 'Tiger 3' in March: Reports
news_article: According to reports, actor Salman Khan is all set to begin the shoot of 'Tiger 3' in March. Pinkvilla said quoting a source, "If everything goes as planned and the pandemic does not act as a spoilsport, he will be shooting for 'Tiger 3' from March till September." Reportedly, Salman would complete the shoot of 'Antim' by February end.

news_headline: Rapper Raja Kumari represents India at Joe Biden's inaugural gala
news_article: Grammy-nominated Indian-American rapper Raja Kumari on Tuesday represented India at the Asian American Pacific Islander (AAPI) Inaugural Ball: Breaking Barriers. "Performing 'NRI' for AAPI ball...shows how far we've come as a culture," Kumari added. "Watching Kamala Harris become the first South Asian...to hold the office of US Vice President will be the most awe-inspiring moment," Kumari stated.

news_headline: Aprilia SXR 160 is here to maximise your life: Piaggio India
news_article: The all-new Aprilia SXR 160 brings together a premium combination of style, performance and extraordinary comfort for an unbelievable riding experience, the company mentioned. Designed in Italy for India, it represents the new Aprilia design philosophy. Here's a ride that will transform your everyday experiences and lead you to maximise every one of them, the company added.

news_headline: The all-new Volvo S60 is designed to help save lives: Volvo
news_article: Every car, Volvo said, is made to give people the journey of their lives while preparing them for every surprise on the way. The latest luxury sedan, the Volvo S60, lets you rediscover the thrill of driving, be it inside or outside, it is designed to help save lives while helping us keep our promise, it further mentioned.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: As promised: Elon Musk on Tesla's India entry
news_article: Elon Musk has tweeted "as promised" in response to a news article about Tesla's entry into India. His response came after it was revealed that Tesla registered a new Indian subsidiary in Bengaluru and named its three directors. Last year, Elon Musk tweeted, "Next year for sure," in response to a user enquiring about Tesla's India entry.

news_headline: Electric car battery that can fully charge in 5 minutes produced for first time
news_article: Electric car batteries that can be fully charged in five minutes have been produced in a factory for the first time. The new lithium-ion batteries were developed by Israeli company StoreDot and manufactured by its strategic partner Eve Energy in China on a normal production line. StoreDot CEO Doron Myersdorf said the company is aiming for a 2025 mass roll-out.

news_headline: Tata Motors tweets 'tere mere pyaar ke charche' amid Tesla tie-up rumours, deletes it
news_article: Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday tweeted, "Aajkal tere mere pyaar ke charche har akhbaar mein, sabko malum hai aur sabko khabar ho gayi!", while tagging Elon Musk and Tesla, amid rumours of a joint venture between the two. The account, though unverified, is followed by Tata Motors' official handle. The tweet was deleted later.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
news_article: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

news_headline: General Motors unveils self-driving, flying Cadillac car concept
news_article: General Motors has unveiled a Cadillac-branded autonomous, flying vehicle concept at the 2021 CES show which is capable of carrying passengers from rooftop to rooftop. The single-seater electric vehicle takes off and lands vertically and can travel at speeds of up to 88.5 kmph. The concept is GM's first foray into aerial mobility and unlikely to go into production.

news_headline: Who are the three directors in Tesla's new Indian subsidiary?
news_article: Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, David Jon Feinstein and Venkatrangam Sreeram as directors in its newly-registered Indian subsidiary, Tesla India Motors and Energy. While Taneja is Tesla's Chief Accounting Officer, Feinstein is Senior Director, Global Trade & New Markets. Sreeram is a Bengaluru entrepreneur who has co-founded automotive tech companies Xenon Automotive and ClearQuote.

news_headline: 200 iconic bikes thought to be lost in fire at Europe's highest motorcycle museum
news_article: More than 200 iconic bikes are thought to have been lost in a fire at Europe's highest motorcycle museum, located above 7,135 feet in Austria. Reports said that by the time firefighters arrived at the scene, the museum's building, mostly made of wood, was already engulfed in flames. The museum is known for housing classic motorbikes from 120 international manufacturers.

news_headline: Mahindra & Mahindra cuts over half of its North America workforce: Reports
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra has reportedly cut over half of the workforce at its North American unit, which had over 500 employees in early 2020. Affected positions include engineers and manufacturing jobs at its Detroit plant that produces Roxor, as well as sales executives. Mahindra cited COVID-19 and a legal battle with Fiat Chrysler over an earlier Roxor model for layoffs.

news_headline: Indians seek value for money even in luxury products: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
news_article: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk said Indians "look for value for money and that's even in a high-end product." He also remarked that usage in India is also different compared to other markets as many consumers here prefer the car to be chauffeur-driven. He said balancing between making car equally chauffeur and owner-friendly makes India "a slightly more difficult market".

news_headline: Ford shuts plant in Chennai till Jan 24 amid global chip shortage
news_article: Ford India has shut its plant in Tamil Nadu's Chennai till January 24 amid a global semiconductor (chip) shortage. The company said that the shortage has disrupted part supplies from its vendors. The automaker, which also has a plant in Gujarat, expects the issue affecting the sector to continue for at least the first half of 2021.

news_headline: Tesla starts delivering Shanghai-made Model Y SUVs in China
news_article: Tesla on Monday said that it has started delivering the Shanghai-made Model Y sports utility vehicles (SUVs) to its customers in China. The starting price of the Model Y vehicle has been set at 3,39,900 yuan (about $52,400). Tesla received permission from the Chinese government to start selling its cars in November last year.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, US startup Archer partner to build electric aircraft
news_article: Fiat Chrysler and US-based startup Archer have partnered to produce an electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. FCA will provide input that contributes to Archer's eVTOL cockpit's design, among other things. The aircraft will be powered by an electric motor and will be able to fly about 96 kilometres high at a ​top speed of around 241 kilometres/hour.

news_headline: Tesla asks US safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla asked the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to declare its speed display issue as inconsequential to safety, reported Reuters. Over six lakh Tesla vehicles do not comply with safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements. Tesla said a majority of vehicles have since corrected the issue.

news_headline: Tesla to route India investment through Tesla Motors Amsterdam
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's investment for the Indian unit will be routed through the jurisdiction of Netherlands, as it has registered Tesla Motors Amsterdam as the parent organisation for Tesla India Motors and Energy, according to the company's incorporation documents. This would offer Tesla tax benefits related to capital gains and dividend payments, tax experts told Economic Times.

news_headline: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
news_article: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage. It said the issue could diminish automakers' production and affect the US economy negatively. AAPC President Matt Blunt said he has also begun "nascent" discussions with the President-elect Joe Biden's administration.

news_headline: Microsoft, GM lead $2 bn investment in self-driving car startup Cruise
news_article: Self-driving car startup Cruise has raised $2 billion in a new equity round led by General Motors and Microsoft. The latest round has raised Cruise's valuation to $30 billion. Honda and other institutional investors also participated in the round. General Motors will continue to retain a majority stake in the startup, a Cruise spokesperson said.

news_headline: Tesla looking for sale, charging sites in Mumbai: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla has launched an extensive exercise to look for sites for sale and marketing of its electric cars which will be imported initially, reported The Free Press Journal. The company will also reportedly speak to Tata Power and Adani Electricity for its charging facilities. The company has also sought the intervention of the Maharashtra government, it reported.

news_headline: Tesla's success should justify its share price: Raghuram Rajan
news_article: Economist and former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Raghuram Rajan said Tesla's success and spread of vehicles must be viewed firmly and should justify its rising stock price. He added that Tesla is a case of a stock that's being priced at many multiples of the price of automakers such as Toyota or General Motors.

news_headline: Tata Motors' shares rise 11% amid reports of tie-up with Tesla
news_article: Tata Motors' shares surged further 11% on Tuesday amid reports of it partnering with Tesla in India. On Monday, its shares had climbed 13%. Its shares also rose as it posted a 13.1% increase in the number of sales of Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) vehicles in the December quarter. The company added that China sales for JLR were "particularly encouraging".

news_headline: Audi delays output, puts 10,000 workers on furlough amid chip shortage
news_article: Audi will delay the production of some of its high-end cars due to a global shortage of computer chips, CEO Markus Duesmann said in an interview. The carmaker, part of the Volkswagen Group, has also put over 10,000 workers on furlough due to this, he added. Audi expects to make up for lost time in the second half of 2021.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, PSA merge to create Stellantis, world's 4th largest automaker
news_article: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) and Peugeot owner PSA Group have sealed their $52 billion merger to create Stellantis, the world's fourth largest automaker. The merged entity will have annual sales of around 8.1 million vehicles. Stellantis can cut annual costs by around $6.1 billion without plant closures, a statement said. FCA and PSA first announced plans to merge in October 2019.

news_headline: World's oldest cave painting of an animal drawn 45,500 yrs ago found in Indonesia
news_article: Archaeologists have discovered the world's oldest known animal cave painting in Indonesia believed to be drawn at least 45,500 years ago. The life-size painting of a wild pig also has two hand prints above the back of the animal. It was found in the Leang Tedongnge cave in a remote valley on Sulawesi island.

news_headline: 2020 was faster than usual, broke record for shortest day 28 times: Scientists
news_article: The 28 fastest days on record all occurred in 2020, with Earth completing its rotations around its axis milliseconds quicker than average, scientists said. The shortest day was July 19, when Earth completed one spin 1.4602 milliseconds faster than 86,400 seconds. Before 2020, the shortest day was noted on July 5, 2005, when the Earth's rotation was 1.0516 milliseconds faster.

news_headline: Astronomers capture a distant galaxy 'die' for the first time; share pic
news_article: Astronomers have captured for the first time a distant star-forming galaxy about to 'die' because of a massive cold gas ejection. "It's distant enough that its light takes some nine billion years to reach us," the astronomers said. The galaxy is ejecting nearly half of its star-forming gas at a rate equivalent to 10,000 Suns worth of gas a year.

news_headline: Yellow mealworms become first insect approved in EU as human food
news_article: Yellow mealworms have become the first insect approved by the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) as a human food. "Rich in protein, fat and fibre, they are likely to be the first of many insects to feature on European's plates in the coming years," an EFSA food scientist said. Mealworms are already used in Europe as a pet food ingredient.

news_headline: New species of 'orange and black' bat discovered in West Africa
news_article: A new species of orange and black bat from the Nimba Mountains in West Africa has been discovered by scientists from the American Museum of Natural History and Bat Conservation International. The species has been named Myotis nimbaensis in recognition of the Guinea mountain range it inhabits. "It has this bright-orange fur...it was so distinct," said scientist Winifred Frick.

news_headline: 'Magic' mushrooms grow in US man's blood after he injects it in form of tea
news_article: A 30-year-old US man was hospitalised with organ failure after he injected himself with a tea made from psychedelic mushrooms, which later started growing in his veins. A case report said his liver was damaged and his kidneys weren't functioning properly. Doctors said he had tried to use the so-called "magic" mushrooms as an alternative treatment for his bipolar disorder.

news_headline: What is the Candida auris outbreak that was reported in a COVID-19 unit in US?
news_article: Candida auris is an emerging fungus that is often multidrug-resistant and some strains are resistant to all three available classes of antifungals, according to US' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC said it is difficult to identify with standard laboratory methods. A Candida auris outbreak was reported in a COVID-19 unit in Florida last year.

news_headline: Indian student among winners of NASA app development challenge: Report
news_article: A high school student from Gurugram, Aryan Jain, is among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge, PTI reported. Jain had teamed up with six high school students from the US. The competition was a coding challenge in which NASA presented technical problems to students and sought their contributions to deep space exploration missions.

news_headline: AI models to predict future of COVID-19 patients' condition made: Facebook
news_article: Facebook and NYU claim to have developed three machine learning models to help doctors predict how COVID-19 patients' condition may develop. Facebook said the model using sequential chest X-rays can predict up to "four days" in advance if a patient may need more intensive care solutions. The predictions could help doctors avoid sending at-risk patients home too soon, Facebook added.

news_headline: Virgin Orbit launches rocket off a 747 aircraft, reaches orbit for 1st time
news_article: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit on Monday successfully launched its LauncherOne rocket into orbit for the first time, delivering nine satellites to low Earth orbit on behalf of NASA. The rocket took off from the ground attached to the wing of a modified Boeing 747 aircraft and detached and fired itself into Earth's orbit after reaching the launch altitude.

news_headline: Indian spacetech startup Agnikul builds 3D printed rocket engine
news_article: Chennai-based spacetech startup Agnikul Cosmos has developed a single piece, fully 3D printed rocket engine called Agnilet, which can be directly used in a rocket. The engine will be used in the second stage of Agnikul's launch vehicle Agnibaan, CEO and Co-founder Srinath Ravichandran said. Launched in 2017, the startup is involved in building India's private small satellite launch vehicle.

news_headline: Bezos' Blue Origin launches & lands latest New Shepard rocket, capsule
news_article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin has successfully launched and landed its latest New Shepard rocket and crew capsule. The capsule reached a maximum altitude of 107 kilometres, while the rocket flew up to a height of 106 kilometres. The capsule features six seats and has speakers with a microphone and a push-to-talk button at each seat.

news_headline: US sees biggest drop in greenhouse gases emissions post WWll era: Report
news_article: The US' greenhouse gas emissions fell 10.3% in 2020, the largest drop in emissions in post-World War II era, due to COVID-19, the Rhodium Group reported. By comparison, the 2009 economic recession caused emissions to drop by 6.3%. Under the 2009 Copenhagen Accord, the US pledged that by 2020, it will have cut its emissions by 17% from 2005 levels.

news_headline: 2 IAF doctors to soon leave for Russia to train for Gaganyaan: Report
news_article: Two Indian Air Force doctors who have specialised in aerospace medicine will soon fly to Russia to get hands-on experience in space medicine for the Gaganyaan mission, PTI reported. The flight surgeons will also get to train with the prospective astronauts. Four test pilots from IAF, chosen for the mission, have been undergoing training in Russia since last year.

news_headline: Megalodon babies, who ate siblings in womb, were larger than adult man: Study
news_article: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

news_headline: Bhaskaracharya found gravitational theory 500 yrs before Newton: Nepal PM
news_article: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told WION that Bhaskaracharya discovered the theory of gravitation about "500 years" before Issac Newton in 1150 AD. He added that Bhaskaracharya's book was published in 1210 AD. Oli said that even in his coursebook he was told that Newton found out the theory of gravitation.

news_headline: CO2 levels to be 50% higher than pre-industrial era in 2021: Report
news_article: Human activity will push concentrations of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere to levels 50% higher than before the Industrial Revolution, in 2021, the UK's Met Office reported. CO2 concentration is expected to exceed 417 ppm for several weeks from April to June for the first time. However, CO2 accumulation is expected to be slightly slower than usual in 2021.

news_headline: New chemical compounds to kill malaria parasite found: Scientists
news_article: A University of Pretoria-led research found new chemical compounds that could potentially be used for killing the malaria parasite in its infectious stage. It found that chemical compounds undergoing trials for treatment of tuberculosis and cancer can kill the parasite at a stage when it normally infects others. The compounds could also help create a new line of malaria drugs.

news_headline: DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients made
news_article: The University of Cambridge said scientists have developed a DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients, who have double the risk of developing pneumonia while on ventilation than non-COVID-19 patients.
