The test gives doctors the information they need to start treatment within hours rather than days. It uses multiple PCR which detects the DNA of the bacteria.

news_headline: 2020 ties with 2016 as warmest year on record: EU
news_article: According to data published by the EU climate monitoring service, 2020 tied with 2016 for the warmest year worldwide. The year was also the warmest year in Europe since records began. It topped the previous temperature record of 2019 in Europe by 0.4°C. The data showed 2020 was 1.25°C warmer than during the pre-industrial period from 1850-1900.

news_headline: Scientists discover 2 dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda
news_article: Scientists have found two dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda. The Namibian giraffe is eight and a half feet tall, while the one in Uganda is nine feet and three inches tall. Both have standard long necks but short, stumpy legs. The medical condition that affects them is Skeletal Dysplasia, which the researchers say is rarely seen in wild animals.

news_headline: New state of matter 'liquid glass' discovered: Scientists
news_article: University of Konstanz's researchers have uncovered a new state of matter, liquid glass, with previously unknown structural elements. They used a model system involving suspensions of tailor-made ellipsoidal colloids to uncover the state. In liquid glass state, individual particles are able to move yet unable to rotate, a complex behaviour that has not previously been observed in bulk glasses.

news_headline: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
news_article: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

news_headline: Astrophysicist Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passes away at 84
news_article: Renowned astrophysicist Professor Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passed away on January 11 aged 84. "He will be remembered for his work in astrophysics and subjects like solar physics, gravitational lensing and science education," PM said as he condoled Chitre's passing away. "His valuable work will continue inspiring students in the times to come," the PM added.

news_headline: NASA finds FM signal coming from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the 1st time
news_article: NASA's Juno space probe has discovered an FM signal emanating from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the first time. One of NASA's ambassadors to Utah clarified that it is a ''natural function'' rather than a sign of extraterrestrial life. "Electrons spiralling in Jupiter's magnetic field are thought to be the cause of the radio noise we hear," NASA said.

news_headline: Musk responds to game developer who sent him the same tweet for 154 days
news_article: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk responded to a game developer, Lyubomir Vladimirov, who tweeted to him for 154 days in a row asking for permission to use the name and logos of his companies. "You can steal our name/logos & we probably won't sue you," the billionaire said. Vladimirov described the game as a "highly technical Mars survival simulator".

news_headline: New policy does not expand our ability to share data with Facebook: WhatsApp
news_article: Facebook-owned messaging platform WhatsApp has said its updated terms and privacy policy "does not expand our ability to share data with Facebook". "Our aim is to provide transparency and new options available to engage with businesses so they can serve their customers and grow," it added. The Indian government has asked WhatsApp to withdraw the changes to its privacy policy.

news_headline: Volkswagen CEO joins Twitter, trolls Elon Musk in his first tweet
news_article: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess joined Twitter and in his first tweet took a jab at Tesla CEO Elon Musk. "I'm here to make an impact with Volkswagen, especially on political issues. And, of course, to get some of your market shares, Elon Musk," he tweeted. In September, Diess gave Musk a test drive of Volkswagen's ID.3 electric car in Berlin.

news_headline: India's largest broking site Zerodha faces issues amid IRFC, Indigo Paints⁠ IPOs
news_article: Several users on Wednesday complained that they were facing issues with India's largest broking site Zerodha. They rushed to place orders for the IPOs of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) and Indigo Paints that opened on Wednesday. "This is not the first time it's happening," a user tweeted, while another complained, "I missed IRFC IPO just because of you Zerodha."

news_headline: Biden's team adds hidden message for coders in new White House website
news_article: The redesigned website for US President Joe Biden's White House carried a hidden invitation for coders to join the US Digital Service, a technology unit within the White House. "If you're reading this, we need your help building back better," a line in the site's HTML source code reads. The new website also has dark mode and font size selector.

news_headline: Hacker leaks 19 lakh user records of free photo editing app Pixlr
news_article: A hacker has leaked 19 lakh user records stolen from popular free photo editing app Pixlr. The alleged database posted by hacker ShinyHunters has email addresses, login names, passwords, country names and other information that could be used to perform targeted phishing attacks on Pixlr users. The hacker said that the database was downloaded from the company's AWS bucket.

news_headline: CRED's Kunal Shah invests in OnePlus Co-founder Carl Pei's new venture
news_article: CRED Founder Kunal Shah on Thursday said he has invested an undisclosed sum in OnePlus Co-founder Carl Pei's new venture announced last month. "Carl is working on a new consumer electronics company that I am sure will be a disruptor in the tech industry," Shah said. Pei co-founded OnePlus in 2013 and left the company in October 2020.

news_headline: Alibaba investors get $63 bn richer as shares soar after Jack Ma's video
news_article: Alibaba investors added $63 billion to their wealth after Alibaba Co-founder Jack Ma made a public appearance in a video, three months after his last public appearance in October. The stock rose 11% in Hong Kong, marking the biggest stock rally in six months for Alibaba Group Holding. Jack Ma spoke to 100 rural teachers through a video call.

news_headline: Twitter transfers @POTUS account to US President Joe Biden
news_article: Twitter on Wednesday transferred the official President of the United States Twitter account, @POTUS, to Joe Biden after he was sworn in as the 46th President of US. The account was reset to zero, which means that President Biden did not inherit Donald Trump's 33.3 million followers. Other official accounts, including @WhiteHouse, @FLOTUS and @VP, were also transferred.

news_headline: We can help vaccinate 100M Americans in 100 days: Amazon to Biden admin
news_article: Amazon has offered to help US President Joe Biden's administration in the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines. Amazon's retail unit chief CEO Dave Clark has also promised to assist the administration in reaching their goal of vaccinating 100 million Americans in the first 100 days of their administration. "We have an agreement...to administer vaccines on-site at our Amazon facilities," Clark said.

news_headline: We applaud Biden's quick action on COVID relief, Paris accord: Sundar Pichai
news_article: Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai took to Twitter to applaud US President Joe Biden's "quick action on COVID relief, the Paris Climate Accord, and immigration reform". "Google has supported action on these important issues and we look forward to working with the new administration to help the US recover from the pandemic and grow our economy," he further wrote.

news_headline: Ant Group's valuation could drop to $108 billion: Bloomberg
news_article: Ant Group's valuation could drop to $108 billion under the draft rules proposed by China, according to Bloomberg Intelligence. The proposals aimed at curbing market concentration in Chinese online payments market could reduce the value of Ant's Alipay service by half, the report stated. Ant Group's valuation was estimated to reach over $320 billion before its $35-billion IPO was suspended.

news_headline: Bitcoin falls for second consecutive day, drops below $33,000-mark
news_article: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell for the second consecutive day on Thursday, dropping below the $33,000-mark to record its lowest in three weeks. Earlier this month, Bitcoin had surpassed the $41,000-mark to record an all time high, before dropping 21%. Bitcoin has rallied more than 900% since March 2020 and it had only breached the $20,000-mark around mid-December 2020.

news_headline: Google investigates ethical AI team member over handling of sensitive data
news_article: Google on Wednesday said it is investigating an ethical AI team member and has locked her corporate account after finding that thousands of files were shared with external accounts. Margaret Mitchell had been using automated scripts to find evidence of discriminatory treatment of Timnit Gebru, a former Black employee in the AI team who was controversially fired, reported Axios.

news_headline: China proposes antitrust rules for non-bank payments industry
news_article: China on Wednesday proposed draft rules to curb market concentration in its online payment market. Under the rules, any non-bank payment company with 50% market share in online transactions or two entities with a combined two-third share could be subjected to antitrust probes. Restrictive measures, including breaking up the entity, can be imposed in case a monopoly is confirmed.

news_headline: Facebook's improved AI to provide more detailed photo descriptions
news_article: Facebook has improved its AI technology used to generate captions for images for visually impaired users. It is now capable of recognising over 1,200 concept descriptions, where people are in the frame and the number of people in the scene. A more detailed description for images that outlines the position, size and nature of objects will also be provided.

news_headline: Twitter locks China's US embassy account over post on Uighur women
news_article: Twitter has locked the account of China's embassy in the US for a tweet that defended China's policies towards Uighur Muslims in the Xinjiang region after it violated the company's policy against "dehumanisation". Earlier this month, the embassy had tweeted Uighur women were no longer "baby-making machine", citing the state-run China Daily. The tweet was later removed by Twitter.

news_headline: Parliamentary panel to question WhatsApp's privacy policy today: Report
news_article: The Parliamentary panel on Thursday will question Facebook officials regarding the proposed changes to WhatsApp's privacy policy, Reuters reported. The panel will ask why the privacy policy needs to be changed and how it will impact users, the report added. The Parliamentary standing committee on information technology has also summoned Twitter officials over the misuse of social media.

news_headline: Working to address the misinformation on policy changes: WhatsApp
news_article: WhatsApp on Wednesday said that it is working to address the misinformation around its proposed changes to privacy policy and is available to answer any question. "We wish to reinforce that this update does not expand our ability to share data with Facebook," a WhatsApp spokesperson said. The government has reportedly asked WhatsApp to withdraw its changes to privacy policy.

news_headline: Tesla in talks to set up manufacturing facility in Gujarat
news_article: Tesla is in talks with the Gujarat government to set up a manufacturing facility in the state. "We are hopeful that...Tesla will prefer Gujarat," Additional Chief Secretary of Gujarat Chief Minister's Office told the Economic Times. The state government has assured the company all possible assistance and incentives for setting up base in Gujarat, the official further said.

news_headline: SpaceX delivers 60 satellites setting new rocket reusability record
news_article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX on Wednesday successfully delivered 60 satellites under its 17th Starlink mission. The Falcon 9 first stage rocket booster was launched and landed for the eighth time, breaking SpaceX's own record for the number of uses of single rocket core. SpaceX aims to provide global broadband coverage from up to 42,000 satellites and has delivered over 1,000 satellites.

news_headline: Android 12 to let users share WiFi passwords with Nearby Share: Report
news_article: Google is reportedly working on a feature for Android 12 that would allow users to share WiFi passwords with others using Nearby Share. This feature would let users send a QR code with compatible devices in the vicinity, XDA reported. Currently, Android 10 and Android 11 users can share WiFi passwords using QR code that needs to be scanned.

news_headline: SpaceX buys 2 offshore oil rigs to turn into floating launchpads: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX has purchased two former oil rigs off Texas' coast to convert them into spaceports for launching its Starship rockets, reported NASASpaceflight. Both rigs have been officially renamed as Deimos and Phobos, which are the names of Mars' moons. In June 2020, Musk tweeted about building floating spaceports for "Mars, the Moon & hypersonic travel around Earth".

news_headline: Google to pay French publishers for news previews
news_article: Google on Thursday signed an agreement with a group of French publishers over copyrights under which the US tech giant will pay news outlets for content online. In a first for Europe, the principles agreed upon include criteria such as daily volume of publications, monthly internet traffic and "contribution to political and general information", the two said in a statement.

news_headline: Actress Manasi Naik, dubbed Aishwarya's lookalike, marries boxer Pardeep Kharera
news_article: Marathi actress Manasi Naik, who is also known for her TikTok videos and often referred to as Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's lookalike, got married to boxer Pardeep Kharera. The actress shared pictures of her wedding on social media and captioned the post, "Mr and Mrs Kharera". The couple got married in Pune.

news_headline: Virat-Anushka seen for 1st time post child's birth, thank media for respecting privacy
news_article: Team India Captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, were seen in public for first time after their daughter's birth on January 11. "Thank you for respecting," said Anushka while referring to the couple's request to media photographers to "not take or carry any content" that has their child. "We'll...ensure...you get all the content...featuring us," they had said.

news_headline: KXIP retain 16 players from IPL 2020 squad, release list
news_article: KXIP, who had finished sixth on the points table in IPL 2020, have retained 16 players from their squad ahead of IPL 2021 auction. The players are: KL Rahul, Chris Gayle, Nicholas Pooran, Mohammad Shami, Chris Jordan, Mandeep Singh, Mayank Agarwal, Ravi Bishnoi, Prabhsimran Singh, Deepak Hooda, Sarfaraz Khan, Arshdeep Singh, M Ashwin, Ishan Porel, Harpreet Brar and Darshan Nalkande.

news_headline: Latest rankings for Test batsmen out, Pant becomes top-ranked wicketkeeper-batsman
news_article: The ICC today announced the latest rankings for Test batsmen, with Team India's Rishabh Pant becoming the top-ranked wicketkeeper-batsman. Pant attained a career-best 13th position. South Africa's Quinton de Kock, who is ranked 15th, is the next wicketkeeper on the list. Team India captain Virat Kohli dropped one spot to be ranked fourth.

news_headline: Which players have been released by CSK ahead of IPL 2021 auction?
news_article: Chennai Super Kings, who finished seventh in IPL 2020, have released six players from their squad and retained 18 players. Kedar Jadhav, Piyush Chawla, Murali Vijay, Harbhajan Singh and Monu Singh are the Indian players released by CSK. Meanwhile, Shane Watson, who retired from all forms of cricket, is the only foreigner released by CSK.

news_headline: Australian fan chants 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' at the Gabba, video goes viral
news_article: A video of an Australian fan chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' during India's Test against Australia at the Gabba has gone viral. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "I think he has an Indian girlfriend." Other tweets read, "Goosebumps!!!" and "Love is the best weapon to win anyone in this world."

news_headline: Rajasthan Royals release captain Steve Smith ahead of IPL 2021 auction
news_article: Rajasthan Royals have released their captain Steve Smith ahead of  the IPL 2021 auction. Rajasthan Royals had finished last on the points table in IPL 2020, which had taken place in the UAE. Smith had played all the 14 league matches for the franchise last year, scoring 311 runs at a strike rate of 131.22.

news_headline: Which players have Delhi Capitals retained and released ahead of IPL 2021 auction?
news_article: Delhi Capitals have retained a total of 19 players from their 2020 squad ahead of the IPL 2021 auction. Out of the 19 players, six are foreigners which include Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Marcus Stoinis and Shimron Hetmyer among others. Further, Delhi Capitals have released Mohit Sharma and Tushar Deshpande among their Indian players.

news_headline: Samson named Rajasthan Royals captain after Smith released from team
news_article: Wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has been named the captain of Rajasthan Royals ahead of IPL 2021. The 26-year-old replaces Australian Steve Smith as the captain of the franchise. Smith has been released from the team ahead of the auction. Rajasthan Royals had finished last in IPL 2020, which was held in UAE.

news_headline: Lasith Malinga retires from franchise cricket aged 37, confirm Mumbai Indians
news_article: Sri Lankan fast bowler Lasith Malinga has retired from franchise cricket at the age of 37, Mumbai Indians confirmed. The IPL franchise said that Malinga informed his decision to them earlier this month, making himself unavailable for the IPL champions' retention wish list. Malinga is the all-time leading wicket-taker in IPL history with 170 wickets to his name.

news_headline: Team India returns home after series win in Australia, pics surface
news_article: Following their 2-1 Test series victory against Australia, several members of Team India returned home on Thursday. Stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane, along with few other team members, were welcomed at the Mumbai airport. The contingent was felicitated by Mumbai Cricket Association at the airport. Rahane also cut a cake to celebrate the team's win.

news_headline: Rahane receives red-carpet welcome with dhol at home, refuses to cut kangaroo cake
news_article: Ajinkya Rahane, who led India to a 2-1 Test series win against Australia, received a red-carpet welcome after returning to his home in Mumbai. A video has surfaced online wherein people can be seen showering flowers on him and playing dhol and trumpet. Rahane also refused to cut a cake with kangaroo on top of it.

news_headline: Harbhajan Singh and CSK part ways ahead of IPL 2021
news_article: Veteran off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to reveal that his contract with CSK has come to an end. "Playing for this team was a great experience...beautiful memories made and some great friends which I will remember fondly for years to come," he wrote. He added, "Thank you CSK management, staff and fans for a wonderful two years...All the best."

news_headline: Which players have been retained by RCB for IPL 2021?
news_article: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) have retained 12 players for IPL 2021 from their 2020 squad. They are Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers, Yuzvendra Chahal, Devdutt Padikkal, Washington Sundar, Mohammed Siraj, Navdeep Saini, Adam Zampa, Shahbaz Ahmed, Josh Philippe, Kane Richardson and Pawan Deshpande. Some prominent players released by RCB include Umesh Yadav, Aaron Finch, Chris Morris and Shivam Dube.

news_headline: Will forever be grateful, will never forget the sacrifices: Cricket Aus to BCCI
news_article: In an open letter, Cricket Australia (CA) thanked BCCI on Wednesday for their cooperation amid the global pandemic to 'help deliver a series that brought joy to millions'. "Australian cricket will forever be grateful to BCCI for their friendship, trust and commitment...We will never forget the sacrifices made by our friends at BCCI that made all this possible," CA wrote.

news_headline: Siraj drives straight from airport to graveyard to pay last respects to late father
news_article: On his return from Australia, India pacer Mohammed Siraj drove straight from the airport to graveyard to pay last respects to his late father. "I went there to sit with my dad for some time. I couldn't speak to him but offered flowers to his grave," he said. Siraj was the top wicket-taker for India in the Australia Test series.

news_headline: Formidable competitors on field, solid partners off it: PM Modi replies to Aus PM
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi thanked his Australian counterpart, Scott Morrison, after the latter congratulated him and Team India on winning the Test series against Australia. PM Modi tweeted, "It was a thrilling series with the best from both the teams on full display." He added, "India and Australia make for formidable competitors on the field, and solid partners off it."

news_headline: Gill and Sundar's fathers disappointed with sons not scoring tons, Sehwag reacts
news_article: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to Instagram to share news clips showing Team India cricketers Shubman Gill and Washington Sundar's parents' 'disappointed' reaction on their sons not scoring hundreds in the Gabba Test. "Parents are parents after all. #parents #india #100sebadhkethacontribution (the contribution was even more than a hundred)," he wrote. "Typical Indian parents," a fan wrote.

news_headline: Nice to be compared to Dhoni, but want to make my own name: Pant
news_article: India wicket-keeper batsman Rishabh Pant said that though he feels good to be compared to ex-captain MS Dhoni, he wants to make his own name in the Indian cricket team. "That is the only thing I am focused on," Pant added after returning from Australia. Pant's 89 not out in Brisbane helped India win the Test and the series 2-1.

news_headline: Ronaldo on target as Juventus beat Napoli to win their 9th Italian Super Cup
news_article: Juventus saw goals from Cristiano Ronaldo and Alvaro Morata to win their record-extending ninth Italian Super Cup after beating Napoli 2-0 on Wednesday. With this win, former Juventus footballer Andrea Pirlo won his first trophy at the club as a manager. While Ronaldo scored the first goal in the 64th minute, Morata scored the second in the stoppage time.

news_headline: Shocked that Aus weren't good enough to win Test series vs India: Ponting
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he was "quite shocked" that hosts Australia didn't manage to win the Test series against an inexperienced Indian side that was plagued with injuries. "The cold hard facts of it are pretty much that was the India A team that played this Test match and still won...It's probably not even (India's) second-picked team," Ponting added.

news_headline: India's young players groomed into finished products unlike in Pak: Hafeez
news_article: Lauding India on their Test series win in Australia, Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez credited India for grooming young cricketers into finished products. "India's products play international cricket...in Pakistan's case only the talent does," Hafeez said. "We don't have a system which can make finished products...That's why so many of our young players fail to succeed at international level," he added.

news_headline: Pant is an exceptional talent, played amazing on a day-five wicket: Smith
news_article: Australia cricketer Steve Smith has called India wicket-keeper batsman Rishabh Pant "an exceptional talent" for the way he batted on the final day of the Brisbane Test to win the series for India. "He (Pant) played a pretty amazing innings on a day-five wicket. He took the game on," the Australian said. "That was a pretty special innings," Smith added.

news_headline: Shakib takes 4 wickets for 8 runs vs Windies on his international return
news_article: Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan picked up four wickets for eight runs on his return to international cricket in the 1st ODI against West Indies on Wednesday. The all-rounder was awarded Man of the Match for his effort. Shakib was back after being given a two-year ban by ICC, with one year suspended, for failing to report approaches from a bookmaker.

news_headline: Chennai stadium to have no crowd for Eng Tests: TN Cricket Association
news_article: The Tamil Nadu Cricket Association (TNCA) has confirmed that no spectators will be allowed for the first two Tests against England at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. "We won't have any fans coming in. What happens later in the series is a call for BCCI to take along with the English cricket board," the TNCA official said.

news_headline: Biden's team adds hidden message for coders in new White House website
news_article: The redesigned website for US President Joe Biden's White House carried a hidden invitation for coders to join the US Digital Service, a technology unit within the White House. "If you're reading this, we need your help building back better," a line in the site's HTML source code reads. The new website also has dark mode and font size selector.

news_headline: Oxford preparing COVID-19 vaccine versions to fight virus variants: Report
news_article: Oxford scientists are preparing to produce new versions of their vaccine to combat more contagious COVID-19 variants discovered in the UK, South Africa and Brazil, according to a report. The team behind the vaccine from Oxford and AstraZeneca is undertaking feasibility studies to reconfigure the technology, the report said citing confirmation from Oxford University.

news_headline: Trump left me 'very generous letter' before leaving White House: Biden
news_article: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said that former President Donald Trump left him a "very generous letter" before departing the White House. Biden said, "Because it's private, I will not talk about it until I talk to him." A senior Trump aide described the letter to CNN as a "personal note" that prays for the success of the country.

news_headline: Twin suicide bombings kill at least 13 in Baghdad market, injure over 30
news_article: A twin suicide bombing killed at least 13 and wounded over 30 in a Baghdad market on Thursday in the first such attack in years, Reuters said quoting security sources. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for attack. Suicide bombings have been rare in Baghdad since defeat of Islamic State in 2017. The last took place in January 2018.

news_headline: Trump discloses list of gifts worth ₹30 lakh he received during final year as US Prez
news_article: Former US President Donald Trump accepted more than $40,000 (₹30 lakh) in gifts in his last year in office, as per his final financial disclosure report. Ford Chairman Bill Ford Jr gave Trump a leather bomber jacket worth $529. Apple CEO Tim Cook gave him a $5,999 Mac Pro computer, the first built at an Apple factory in Austin, Texas.

news_headline: Minutes after Biden takes office, China sanctions 28 Trump-era officials
news_article: China imposed sanctions on outgoing Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and 27 other top officials under Donald Trump just minutes after Joe Biden was sworn in as the 46th President of the US. The ex-officials and their immediate family members will be banned from entering mainland China, Hong Kong or Macau, or doing business with China.

news_headline: Happy old man looking ahead at bright future: Greta as Trump leaves White House
news_article: Environmentalist Greta Thunberg tweeted the photo of Donald Trump exiting the White House as the US President for the last time and wrote, "He seems like a very happy old man looking forward to a bright and wonderful future. So nice to see!" Trump called Thunberg a "happy young girl" after her speech at the 2019 UN Climate Action Summit.

news_headline: If you treat a colleague with disrespect, I'll fire you on the spot: Biden to staff
news_article: During a virtual swearing-in ceremony for presidential appointees, US President Joe Biden said he'll fire staff "on the spot" if he hears they've shown "disrespect" to colleagues. "I'm not joking- If you're...working with me and I hear you treat another colleague with disrespect or talk down to someone, I promise you, I'll fire you...No ifs, ands or buts," Biden stated.

news_headline: Tough weeks ahead: UK PM on biggest daily rise in COVID-19 deaths
news_article: UK PM Boris Johnson has warned there will be "tough weeks to come" as Britain reported its highest daily rise in coronavirus deaths at 1,820. Calling it "appalling", Johnson said there was now a "race against time" to vaccinate the vulnerable. A total of 93,290 people have now died in the UK within 28 days of testing COVID-19 positive.

news_headline: Bharat Biotech applies for COVID-19 vaccine trial in Bangladesh
news_article: Bharat Biotech has applied to conduct trials in Bangladesh for its COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, that was recently approved for emergency use in India. Mahmood-uz-Jahan, a director at the government-run Bangladesh Medical Research Council, said that the ethics committee will review the application. If granted approval, this would be the first trial of any COVID-19 vaccine in Bangladesh.

news_headline: Hungary becomes 1st EU nation to approve Russia's Sputnik V vaccine
news_article: Hungary on Wednesday became the first EU nation to approve Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use. Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto, who's due to visit Moscow on Friday, said the government had received a draft contract to buy the vaccine from Russia's RDIF sovereign wealth fund. Hungary has vaccinated only a little over 1% of its population so far.

news_headline: We applaud Biden's quick action on COVID relief, Paris accord: Sundar Pichai
news_article: Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai took to Twitter to applaud US President Joe Biden's "quick action on COVID relief, the Paris Climate Accord, and immigration reform". "Google has supported action on these important issues and we look forward to working with the new administration to help the US recover from the pandemic and grow our economy," he further wrote.

news_headline: We can help vaccinate 100M Americans in 100 days: Amazon to Biden admin
news_article: Amazon has offered to help US President Joe Biden's administration in the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines. Amazon's retail unit chief CEO Dave Clark has also promised to assist the administration in reaching their goal of vaccinating 100 million Americans in the first 100 days of their administration. "We have an agreement...to administer vaccines on-site at our Amazon facilities," Clark said.

news_headline: S Africa to pay $5.25 per dose for Serum Institute's COVID-19 vaccine
news_article: South Africa will pay $5.25 per dose for Serum Institute of India's (SII) COVID-19 vaccine, more than what others, including developed nations, are paying, Health Department Deputy Director-General, Anban Pillay said. "The explanation we were given for why other high-income countries have a lower price is that they have invested in the (research and development)," he added.

news_headline: US COVID-19 deaths exceed its World War II troop fatalities: AFP
news_article: The US' death toll from coronavirus, the highest globally, has surpassed the number of fatalities the country suffered in World War II, AFP reported. Johns Hopkins University tracker showed that COVID-19 has killed 4,06,147 people in the US, as compared to 4,05,399 American deaths in WWII. The US has also reported the highest coronavirus cases at over 2.44 crore.

news_headline: Twitter locks China's US embassy account over post on Uighur women
news_article: Twitter has locked the account of China's embassy in the US for a tweet that defended China's policies towards Uighur Muslims in the Xinjiang region after it violated the company's policy against "dehumanisation". Earlier this month, the embassy had tweeted Uighur women were no longer "baby-making machine", citing the state-run China Daily. The tweet was later removed by Twitter.

news_headline: Ready to play constructive role in UNSC to end Syrian conflict: India
news_article: India on Wednesday said it's ready to play a "constructive and meaningful role" in United Nations Security Council (UNSC) to end the Syrian conflict. It's "disheartening" to see the ongoing crisis in Syria having no end in sight, TS Tirumurti, Indian Permanent Representative to UN, said. Tirumurti called on international community to give assistance to Syria for rebuilding its infrastructure.

news_headline: Avril Haines becomes US' 1st Woman Director of National Intelligence
news_article: The US Senate has approved Joe Biden's nomination of Avril Haines, making her the first woman to be Director of National Intelligence. The Senate voted 84-10 to confirm Haines to the post, with only Republicans opposing her nomination. The former deputy CIA director will become a core member of Biden's security team, overseeing agencies that make up US' intelligence community.

news_headline: Pak EC issues notices to 19 political parties over party funding case
news_article: Pakistan Election commission has issued notices to 19 parties in parliament regarding scrutiny of financial statements and funds. This comes a day after the Pakistan Democratic Movement (PDM) held protests outside the Election Commission office against delayed proceedings of the ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party's foreign funding case. The parties have time until February 24 to respond.

news_headline: US intends to join WHO-backed vaccine scheme 'COVAX': Fauci
news_article: US, under President Joe Biden, intends to join World Health Organization's (WHO) COVAX alliance designed to ensure equitable access to COVID-19 vaccines, Biden's chief medical adviser Anthony Fauci said. The US also intends to fulfil its "financial obligations" to the WHO, Fauci added. Earlier, Biden had reversed ex-President Donald Trump's decision to exit WHO on his first day in office.

news_headline: Unproductive: Biden admin on China's sanctions on Trump officials
news_article: China's sanctions on Trump administration officials, including outgoing State Secretary Mike Pompeo, is "unproductive and cynical", President Joe Biden's National Security Council spokeswoman Emily Horne said. "Imposing these sanctions on Inauguration Day is seemingly an attempt to play to partisan divides," she added. China had imposed sanctions minutes after Biden was sworn in as US President.

news_headline: Brexit responsible for food supply problems in N Ireland: Irish Min
news_article: Ireland's Foreign Affairs Minister Simon Coveney has said food supply problems in Northern Ireland are due to Brexit. He added that shortages were "part of the reality" of UK leaving the EU. "The supermarket shelves were full before Christmas and there are some issues now in terms of supply chains and so that's clearly a Brexit issue," Coveney further said.

news_headline: Brazil Prez writes to Biden, says wants free trade deal with US
news_article: Hours after Joe Biden took oath as US President, Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro issued a three-page letter congratulating him. In the letter, Bolsonaro said he hoped that the two nations would pursue free trade agreement during Biden's presidency. Bolsonaro, a close ally of ex-President Donald Trump, had initially refused to accept US Presidential election result, saying it was "fraud".

news_headline: UK Police discover 1st cannabis farm in London's financial district
news_article: The UK Police on Wednesday said that they have found the first cannabis farm in London's financial district, Square Mile, and arrested two people in connection with it. There were reports of a "strong smell of cannabis", which led to the raid, they added. The police also said that 826 plants were dismantled and destroyed by police officers.

news_headline: 3 US soldiers killed in helicopter crash in New York
news_article: Three US soldiers were killed on Wednesday when their helicopter crashed while on a routine training mission in New York, authorities said. New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said he was "devastated" by the soldiers' deaths and directed flags on all state buildings to be lowered to half-staff on Thursday to honour the victims. An investigation into the crash is underway.

news_headline: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh for families of those who died in Jalpaiguri accident
news_article: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended his prayers to the families of those who died in a road accident in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri. He also announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each to next of kin of those who lost their lives and ₹50,000 each for those who got injured. The Prime Minister's Office tweeted, "May the injured recover soon."

news_headline: Cong forms 'grand alliance' with 5 parties in Assam ahead of Assembly polls
news_article: Congress and five other parties on Tuesday officially announced their 'grand alliance' for the upcoming Assembly elections in Assam. The CPI, CPI(M), CPI(ML), AIUDF and Anchalik Gana Morcha (AGM) are the five partners with Congress for the polls. Assam Congress President Ripun Bora said, "We will fight together to oust BJP. We'll keep our doors open for other regional parties."

news_headline: Tejashwi Yadav bol rahe hain: Video of RJD leader's call to Patna DM goes viral
news_article: A video of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav introducing himself to the Patna District Magistrate on phone call, saying "Hum Tejashwi Yadav bol rahe hain, DM sahab", has gone viral online. Yadav calls him after being informed by teachers that their permission for the protest has been cancelled. When the DM says "You will seek accountability from me?", Yadav introduces himself.

news_headline: Tharoor trolls Team Aus with word of the day 'epicaricacy' after Gabba loss
news_article: MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday trolled Team Australia with 'word of the day' tweet after India ended their 32-year unbeaten streak at Brisbane's Gabba to win the series 2-1. Tharoor shared the word 'epicaricacy', which means deriving pleasure from the misfortune of another. He also shared comments of former Australian cricketers who predicted trouble for India in the test series.

news_headline: Rohingyas' names included in WB voter list, EC should look into it: BJP
news_article: Stating that the Election Commission has visited West Bengal to inspect arrangements for the Assembly elections, state BJP chief Dilip Ghosh said, "Names of Rohingyas have been included to the voter list in border areas, this should be looked into." TMC's Firhad Hakim responded, "We told the EC that it is direct blame on you since you make the list."

news_headline: Rajasthan Congress MLA Gajendra Singh Shaktawat passes away aged 48
news_article: Rajasthan Congress MLA Gajendra Singh Shaktawat passed away aged 48 on Wednesday, following a prolonged illness. Shaktawat had been undergoing treatment for a liver-related ailment for over a month, said media reports. He was one of the 18 Congress MLAs who had sided with Sachin Pilot during the political crisis in Rajasthan last year.

news_headline: J&K People's Conference pulls out of Gupkar Alliance over DDC polls
news_article: The Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference (JKPC) on Tuesday pulled out of the People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD). In a letter to PAGD President and National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah, JKPC chief Sajad Lone said that the votes cast against PAGD in the recent DDC elections were mostly by proxies of PAGD constituent parties against its official candidates.

news_headline: BJP youth wing district chief held for raising 'goli maro...' slogan in WB
news_article: BJP Yuva Morcha district chief Suresh Shaw and two party workers were arrested in West Bengal's Hooghly for allegedly raising 'desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro saalo ko' slogan on Wednesday. The incident happened at a roadshow of BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari. Meanwhile, BJP spokesperson said the party doesn't endorse the slogan raised by the participants holding the BJP flag.

news_headline: Aditya Birla Group senior vice-president Ranjan Banerjee joins BJP
news_article: Ahead of the 2021 West Bengal Assembly elections, senior vice-president of Aditya Birla Group Ranjan Banerjee joined the BJP in Kolkata on Wednesday. He said, "The whole environment of West Bengal needs to be changed so that industries itself come here. I want to see West Bengal as the number one state, will do whatever it takes."

news_headline: BJP won't project CM face for WB elections at present: Kailash Vijayvargiya
news_article: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Wednesday said the party won't project a CM face for the West Bengal Assembly elections at present. Vijayvargiya added that this is in line with the party's approach in the states where it's not in power. "After securing the majority, party leadership and MLAs will decide who will become the CM," he said.

news_headline: Siddaramaiah, Shivakumar detained while marching to Raj Bhavan in B'luru
news_article: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah and Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee president DK Shivakumar were among several party leaders who were detained while marching towards Raj Bhavan in Bengaluru to protest against the farm laws. "I urge farmers to stop wherever they are and protest, block the highways, roads," Shivakumar had stated earlier in the day.

news_headline: Will take decision on CM post after securing majority in WB polls: BJP leader
news_article: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Wednesday said that the party will not project any chief ministerial candidate ahead of the upcoming Assembly elections in West Bengal. He added, "After securing the majority, the party leadership and MLAs will decide who will become the chief minister." The state Assembly elections are due in April-May.

news_headline: Over 51,000 health workers vaccinated so far in Maharashtra
news_article: Maharashtra had vaccinated over 51,000 health workers till Wednesday, reaching 60% of its target for the first three days, according to a report in The Indian Express. Meanwhile, district officials stated that the number of vaccine recipients can improve and the daily immunisation targets could be achieved if technical difficulties on the Co-WIN app were resolved.

news_headline: K'taka CM allocates portfolios to 7 newly-inducted Cabinet members
news_article: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Thursday assigned portfolios to the new inductees in the state Cabinet, while reshuffling departments of some ministers. MTB Nagaraj was made Excise Minister while M Nirani was given the Mines and Geology ministry. JC Madhuswamy was divested of Law, Parliamentary Affairs and Legislation portfolio while Forest Department was taken back from Anand Singh.

news_headline: Sasikala paid ₹10-cr fine, to be released from prison on Jan 27: Lawyer
news_article: VK Sasikala's lawyer said she will be released from Bengaluru jail on January 27. The lawyer added that he received official communication from the prison authorities regarding her release as she had completed her term and had paid the required ₹10-crore fine. CM Edappadi Palaniswami said Sasikala won't return to AIADMK after her release.

news_headline: Cong, SP seek removal of Savarkar's portrait from UP assembly
news_article: The Congress and the Samajwadi Party have demanded the removal of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's portrait from the picture gallery of the Uttar Pradesh assembly. "His picture is nothing but an insult to our great freedom fighters," said Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav. "It should be removed immediately and can be placed at the BJP office," Congress leader Deepak Singh added.

news_headline: UP to mark 3rd 'UP Diwas' with street plays, charkha distribution
news_article: Uttar Pradesh will celebrate its 71st Foundation Day and third 'UP Diwas' on January 24, the day United Provinces was renamed as Uttar Pradesh in 1950. A government spokesperson said the three-day celebrations will include street plays, cultural programmes, and the distribution of 1,000 solar charkhas among women. CM Yogi Adityanath will inaugurate several events in Lucknow on January 24.

news_headline: Won't let you contest polls from two seats: Suvendu Adhikari to Mamata
news_article: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikhari on Tuesday said his party won't let Mamata Banerjee contest elections from two seats in the upcoming Assembly elections. The West Bengal Chief Minister had announced on Monday that if possible she would contest from Purba Medinipur's Nandigram and  Bhabanipur in Kolkata. "You've to contest the election from Nandigram only," Adhikhari said during a public meeting.

news_headline: TMC MLA from Santipur joins BJP ahead of WB Assembly elections
news_article: Trinamool Congress MLA from West Bengal's Santipur, Arindam Bhattacharya, has joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) ahead of the Assembly elections in the state this year. Bhattacharya said that the Mamata Banerjee-led party "lacks the vision for West Bengal and the youth". Bhattacharya had won the Assembly election on a Congress ticket in 2016 and joined TMC in 2017.

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi has run away from JP Nadda's questions: Javadekar
news_article: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has run away from giving replies to BJP President JP Nadda's questions for him. "A national party president is asking questions, you should reply," Javadekar said. "Who is he? Why should I answer him...I will answer the country," Gandhi had said in response to Nadda's questions.

news_headline: BSF threatening voters in border areas of West Bengal: TMC to ECI
news_article: Trinamool Congress (TMC) has alleged that the Border Security Force (BSF) is "threatening voters" in the border areas of West Bengal to vote in favour of BJP. The party has informed the Election Commission of India (ECI) officials and they will cross-check it, TMC leader Firhad Hakim said. Responding to the allegations, the BSF said it is an "apolitical" force.

news_headline: Best wishes to US President Biden and VP Harris: Rahul Gandhi
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted, "Best wishes to [US] President [Joe] Biden and Vice President [Kamala] Harris." "Congratulating the USA on a new chapter of their democracy," he said. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "Wishing President Biden and Vice President Harris all success in promoting the healing of their fractured society."

news_headline: Hindustan may soon be Kamalastan: NCP on renaming of dragon fruit
news_article: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Wednesday criticised BJP over Gujarat government's decision to rename dragon fruit as Kamalam. NCP's Chief Spokesperson Mahesh Tapase, in a statement, said that the day is maybe not far when BJP would "address Hindustan as Kamalastan”. "BJP has now started branding itself on fruits also," he added.

news_headline: New farm laws are an assault on middle class: Rahul Gandhi
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that agriculture was the last sector that was protected from monopoly but "is now being overrun". He added that Prime Minister Narendra Modi aims to give "the agricultural system to three or four of his friends" and that the farm laws were not an assault on the farmers but on the middle class.

news_headline: Party's Punjab unit to join tractor rally on R-Day as farmers: AAP
news_article: The Punjab unit of Aam Aadmi Party will join the farmers' tractor rally on January 26 in Delhi "not as a political party but as farmers", AAP's state unit president Bhagwant Mann announced on Tuesday. "The manner in which the...central government has been looting the constitutional rights...and working against the constitution, is very dangerous for the country," he said.

news_headline: Lucknow team seeks Mumbai police chief's help in 'Tandav' probe
news_article: The Lucknow Police team on Wednesday asked the Mumbai Commissioner of Police to aid them in investigating the case lodged against the 'Tandav' makers. A senior police official informed that a four-member team from Lucknow arrived in Mumbai on Tuesday after an FIR was filed at Hazratganj police station against the web series for promoting enmity and causing public mischief.

news_headline: Police-couple transferred to same city in MP after Bachchan's request on KBC
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan, on KBC, urged Madhya Pradesh government to depute a police-couple, one of whom participated in the show, together at one place. Vivek Kumar, a traffic constable from Mandsaur, stated his wife is posted in Gwalior because of which he's facing issues. After Bachchan's appeal, the state government has now ordered the transfer of the constable's wife to Mandsaur.

news_headline: Sushant's sister announces ₹25L scholarship at UC Berkeley on his birth anniversary
news_article: Shweta Singh Kirti has set up a scholarship fund in the name of her brother, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput to mark his birth anniversary today. The Sushant Singh Rajput Memorial Fund is of $35,000 (over ₹25 lakh) and has been set up in University of California, Berkeley for students interested in pursuing Astrophysics. "Hope you...stay happy...wherever you...are!" wrote Shweta.

news_headline: UP Police reaches 'Tandav' maker's house to serve him notice, pics surface
news_article: The Uttar Pradesh Police on Thursday reached 'Tandav' director Ali Abbas Zafar's Mumbai residence to hand him a legal notice. Ali was reportedly in Dehradun with his family when the police entered his residential building in Andheri. A four-member team from Lucknow's Hazratganj police station had arrived in Mumbai on Wednesday to probe the case lodged against the series makers.

news_headline: Want public apology from Sajid: Sherlyn after alleging he asked her to feel his penis
news_article: Actress Sherlyn Chopra, who had alleged that filmmaker Sajid Khan had taken his penis out and had asked her to feel it when she had met him in April 2005, has now demanded a public apology from him. "He has been a habitual offender...I don't understand how serial offenders like him get support from the film industry," she stated.

news_headline: After denying reports, Varun's uncle confirms actor will marry Natasha on Jan 24
news_article: Actor Varun Dhawan's uncle Anil Dhawan has told SpotboyE that the actor is set to get married to Natasha Dalal on January 24. "My nephew Varun is getting married on 24 January. I am looking forward to it," he stated. Anil had previously denied reports of their wedding. As per reports, Varun and Natasha's wedding will take place in Alibaug.

news_headline: Supreme Court issues notice to 'Mirzapur' makers, Amazon Prime
news_article: Supreme Court on Thursday issued notice to makers and producers of web series 'Mirzapur' and Amazon Prime Video. This comes following a petition about the portrayal of Mirzapur district, UP in a bad light in the series. SC has sought response from the OTT platform and series makers, ANI reported. FIR was lodged at Mirzapur's Kotwali Dehat Police Station.

news_headline: Virat-Anushka seen for 1st time post child's birth, thank media for respecting privacy
news_article: Team India Captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, were seen in public for first time after their daughter's birth on January 11. "Thank you for respecting," said Anushka while referring to the couple's request to media photographers to "not take or carry any content" that has their child. "We'll...ensure...you get all the content...featuring us," they had said.

news_headline: Bombay HC rejects Sonu Sood's bail plea against BMC notice
news_article: The Bombay High Court has dismissed actor Sonu Sood's appeal and interim application against Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) notice on alleged illegal construction at his Mumbai residence. Sood's lawyer had sought 10 weeks to comply with the BMC's notice. The court, however, dismissed the appeal and said Sood had ample opportunity in the past.

news_headline: Mumbai Police summons Kangana in Javed Akhtar defamation case
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has been summoned by Mumbai Police on Friday in connection with a defamation case filed by Javed Akhtar. He had filed a complaint last year over allegations that he threatened her to not speak about her alleged relationship with Hrithik Roshan. Javed also alleged that she unnecessarily dragged his name in Sushant Singh Rajput's death case.

news_headline: Bobby Deol to play lead in 'Arth' remake, producer confirms
news_article: Actor Bobby Deol is all set to reprise the role of Kulbhushan Kharbanda in the remake of 'Arth'. Informing about the same, producer Sharat Chandra told Pinkvilla, "Yes, the supremely talented Bobby Deol will reprise Kulbhushan Kharbanda Ji's role in the 'Arth' remake. We are in the final stage of discussions with him.”

news_headline: Malayalam actor Unnikrishnan Namboothiri passes away at 98
news_article: Malayalam actor Unnikrishnan Namboothiri, who worked in films like 'Desadanam' and 'Kalyanaraman', passed away aged 98 in Kannur. According to The Indian Express, he was undergoing treatment for coronavirus at a hospital. He was sent home on Tuesday after he tested negative. However, on Wednesday, his health deteriorated and was taken back to the hospital, where he breathed his last.

news_headline: My confidence was stripped: Priyanka on facing racism as a student in US
news_article: Priyanka Chopra spoke about the racist bullying she experienced while attending a high school in America at the age of 15. "I took it very personally...I went into a shell. I was like, 'I...want to be invisible'," she said. "My confidence was stripped. I've always considered myself a confident person, but I was very unsure...of who I was," Priyanka added.

news_headline: Not Anupamaa, I am more like Monisha Sarabhai: Rupali Ganguly
news_article: Actress Rupali Ganguly, who is currently playing the lead in the show 'Anupamaa', said that she is like Monisha Sarabhai, from the show 'Sarabhai VS Sarabhai', in real life. In an interview with Bombay Times, the actress added, "I like watching lots of television when I have time on my hands. Family...is my priority and nothing replaces them for me."

news_headline: Ankita shares old videos of Sushant on his birth anniversary
news_article: Remembering late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his birth anniversary, actress Ankita Lokhande took to Instagram to share old videos of the actor and wrote, "I'm gonna share few of your old videos...to celebrate you. These are the only memories I have with you." Lokhande further said, "I pray and I know you are very happy, wherever you are."

news_headline: Barely had any struggle when I joined the TV industry: Urvashi Dholakia
news_article: Actress Urvashi Dholakia has said she "barely had any struggle" when she joined the TV industry. The actress, who joined the industry at the age of six, added, "Times were different at that point in time...At that time, there was barely any struggle." Urvashi further said she always loved acting and never saw it as a struggle.

news_headline: Another FIR filed against web series 'Tandav' in Greater Noida
news_article: An FIR was lodged against makers of web series 'Tandav' at Rabupura Police Station in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, police said on Tuesday. FIR states that 'Tandav' showcases "depiction of Dalit insult, casteism and content inflammatory to religious sentiments". It has been filed against Saif Ali Khan, Dimple Kapadia, Sunil Grover, director Ali Abbas Zafar, writer Gaurav Solanki and others.

news_headline: Arjun signs Vishal Bhardwaj's son Aasmaan's directorial debut: Reports
news_article: According to reports, actor Arjun Kapoor has been signed for filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj's son Aasmaan's directorial debut. "Arjun loved the script when he heard it for the first time," a source said. Aasmaan is in the process of zeroing in on the cast and is planning to begin the shoot depending on the pandemic situation, reports added.

news_headline: Another team of UP Police arrives in Mumbai to probe 'Mirzapur' case
news_article: Two days after an FIR was lodged against the makers of 'Mirzapur', a team of Uttar Pradesh Police reached Mumbai on Thursday to probe the case. An FIR was filed on Tuesday at UP's Mirzapur district against the creators of the web series for allegedly tarnishing the image of the town and hurting religious sentiments.

news_headline: I don't like malice when it comes to feedback: Kunaal Roy Kapur
news_article: Actor Kunaal Roy Kapur said he does not like "malice" when it comes to feedback about his acting, adding that he is up for constructive criticism from the audience. "As long as I am getting work and...some sort of feedback, I am happy with it," Kapur said. The actor added he still feels there are areas where he can improve.

news_headline: Ambulance service started in Telangana under Sonu Sood's name
news_article: An ambulance service has been started under actor Sonu Sood's name in Telangana to help the needy patients who can't afford medical facilities. The service will be spread across states of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The ambulance service has been started by a swimmer, who has reportedly saved over 100 people from drowning in a lake when they attempted suicide.

news_headline: Cheating case against Telugu actor Viswant Duddumpudi
news_article: A man filed a case against Telugu actor Viswant Duddumpudi, his father and others for cheating him in connection with the sale of a car worth ₹25 lakh for ₹17 lakh in September 2017. Police said that the victim has alleged he paid ₹12.5 lakh to the accused and took the car but was not given the vehicle ownership documents.

news_headline: SC grants bail to Kannada actress Ragini Dwivedi in Sandalwood drugs case
news_article: Supreme Court on Thursday granted bail to 30-year-old Kannada actress Ragini Dwivedi, arrested in September 2020 by the Bengaluru Police, in connection to the Sandalwood drugs case. She allegedly had links with an international drug cartel involved in supplying psychedelic drugs to customers. Karnataka High Court in November 2020 had refused to grant bail to Dwivedi and others accused.

news_headline: Katrina's sister Isabelle to star in 'Suswagatam Khushaamadeed'
news_article: Katrina Kaif's sister, actress Isabelle Kaif, will star opposite Pulkit Samrat in the film 'Suswagatam Khushaamadeed'. Pulkit will essay the role of a Delhi boy, while Isabelle will be playing the role of Noor who hails from the city of Agra. Talking about working with Isabelle, he said that she's extremely hard-working and has brought fresh energy on the set.

news_headline: Thank you for choosing me: Ayushmann on wife Tahira's birthday
news_article: Ayushmann Khurrana took to his Instagram handle on Thursday, to wish his wife Tahira Kashyap on her birthday. He posted photos of Tahira and captioned the post, "Happy birthday to the best human I know!"  Ayushmann further wrote, "This day in 2001 was the first time I'd attended your birthday."

news_headline: Aprilia SXR 160 is here to maximise your life: Piaggio India
news_article: The all-new Aprilia SXR 160 brings together a premium combination of style, performance and extraordinary comfort for an unbelievable riding experience, the company mentioned. Designed in Italy for India, it represents the new Aprilia design philosophy. Here's a ride that will transform your everyday experiences and lead you to maximise every one of them, the company added.

news_headline: The all-new Volvo S60 is designed to help save lives: Volvo
news_article: Every car, Volvo said, is made to give people the journey of their lives while preparing them for every surprise on the way. The latest luxury sedan, the Volvo S60, lets you rediscover the thrill of driving, be it inside or outside, it is designed to help save lives while helping us keep our promise, it further mentioned.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: Volkswagen CEO joins Twitter, trolls Elon Musk in his first tweet
news_article: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess joined Twitter and in his first tweet took a jab at Tesla CEO Elon Musk. "I'm here to make an impact with Volkswagen, especially on political issues. And, of course, to get some of your market shares, Elon Musk," he tweeted. In September, Diess gave Musk a test drive of Volkswagen's ID.3 electric car in Berlin.

news_headline: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
news_article: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

news_headline: General Motors unveils self-driving, flying Cadillac car concept
news_article: General Motors has unveiled a Cadillac-branded autonomous, flying vehicle concept at the 2021 CES show which is capable of carrying passengers from rooftop to rooftop. The single-seater electric vehicle takes off and lands vertically and can travel at speeds of up to 88.5 kmph. The concept is GM's first foray into aerial mobility and unlikely to go into production.

news_headline: As promised: Elon Musk on Tesla's India entry
news_article: Elon Musk has tweeted "as promised" in response to a news article about Tesla's entry into India. His response came after it was revealed that Tesla registered a new Indian subsidiary in Bengaluru and named its three directors. Last year, Elon Musk tweeted, "Next year for sure," in response to a user enquiring about Tesla's India entry.

news_headline: Electric car battery that can fully charge in 5 minutes produced for first time
news_article: Electric car batteries that can be fully charged in five minutes have been produced in a factory for the first time. The new lithium-ion batteries were developed by Israeli company StoreDot and manufactured by its strategic partner Eve Energy in China on a normal production line. StoreDot CEO Doron Myersdorf said the company is aiming for a 2025 mass roll-out.

news_headline: Tata Motors tweets 'tere mere pyaar ke charche' amid Tesla tie-up rumours, deletes it
news_article: Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday tweeted, "Aajkal tere mere pyaar ke charche har akhbaar mein, sabko malum hai aur sabko khabar ho gayi!", while tagging Elon Musk and Tesla, amid rumours of a joint venture between the two. The account, though unverified, is followed by Tata Motors' official handle. The tweet was deleted later.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Who are the three directors in Tesla's new Indian subsidiary?
news_article: Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, David Jon Feinstein and Venkatrangam Sreeram as directors in its newly-registered Indian subsidiary, Tesla India Motors and Energy. While Taneja is Tesla's Chief Accounting Officer, Feinstein is Senior Director, Global Trade & New Markets. Sreeram is a Bengaluru entrepreneur who has co-founded automotive tech companies Xenon Automotive and ClearQuote.

news_headline: Mahindra & Mahindra cuts over half of its North America workforce: Reports
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra has reportedly cut over half of the workforce at its North American unit, which had over 500 employees in early 2020. Affected positions include engineers and manufacturing jobs at its Detroit plant that produces Roxor, as well as sales executives. Mahindra cited COVID-19 and a legal battle with Fiat Chrysler over an earlier Roxor model for layoffs.

news_headline: 200 iconic bikes thought to be lost in fire at Europe's highest motorcycle museum
news_article: More than 200 iconic bikes are thought to have been lost in a fire at Europe's highest motorcycle museum, located above 7,135 feet in Austria. Reports said that by the time firefighters arrived at the scene, the museum's building, mostly made of wood, was already engulfed in flames. The museum is known for housing classic motorbikes from 120 international manufacturers.

news_headline: Ford shuts plant in Chennai till Jan 24 amid global chip shortage
news_article: Ford India has shut its plant in Tamil Nadu's Chennai till January 24 amid a global semiconductor (chip) shortage. The company said that the shortage has disrupted part supplies from its vendors. The automaker, which also has a plant in Gujarat, expects the issue affecting the sector to continue for at least the first half of 2021.

news_headline: Indians seek value for money even in luxury products: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
news_article: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk said Indians "look for value for money and that's even in a high-end product." He also remarked that usage in India is also different compared to other markets as many consumers here prefer the car to be chauffeur-driven. He said balancing between making car equally chauffeur and owner-friendly makes India "a slightly more difficult market".

news_headline: Microsoft, GM lead $2 bn investment in self-driving car startup Cruise
news_article: Self-driving car startup Cruise has raised $2 billion in a new equity round led by General Motors and Microsoft. The latest round has raised Cruise's valuation to $30 billion. Honda and other institutional investors also participated in the round. General Motors will continue to retain a majority stake in the startup, a Cruise spokesperson said.

news_headline: Tesla starts delivering Shanghai-made Model Y SUVs in China
news_article: Tesla on Monday said that it has started delivering the Shanghai-made Model Y sports utility vehicles (SUVs) to its customers in China. The starting price of the Model Y vehicle has been set at 3,39,900 yuan (about $52,400). Tesla received permission from the Chinese government to start selling its cars in November last year.

news_headline: Tesla to route India investment through Tesla Motors Amsterdam
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's investment for the Indian unit will be routed through the jurisdiction of Netherlands, as it has registered Tesla Motors Amsterdam as the parent organisation for Tesla India Motors and Energy, according to the company's incorporation documents. This would offer Tesla tax benefits related to capital gains and dividend payments, tax experts told Economic Times.

news_headline: Tesla asks US safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla asked the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to declare its speed display issue as inconsequential to safety, reported Reuters. Over six lakh Tesla vehicles do not comply with safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements. Tesla said a majority of vehicles have since corrected the issue.

news_headline: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
news_article: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage. It said the issue could diminish automakers' production and affect the US economy negatively. AAPC President Matt Blunt said he has also begun "nascent" discussions with the President-elect Joe Biden's administration.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, US startup Archer partner to build electric aircraft
news_article: Fiat Chrysler and US-based startup Archer have partnered to produce an electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. FCA will provide input that contributes to Archer's eVTOL cockpit's design, among other things. The aircraft will be powered by an electric motor and will be able to fly about 96 kilometres high at a ​top speed of around 241 kilometres/hour.

news_headline: Tesla in talks to set up manufacturing facility in Gujarat
news_article: Tesla is in talks with the Gujarat government to set up a manufacturing facility in the state. "We are hopeful that...Tesla will prefer Gujarat," Additional Chief Secretary of Gujarat Chief Minister's Office told the Economic Times. The state government has assured the company all possible assistance and incentives for setting up base in Gujarat, the official further said.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler, PSA merge to create Stellantis, world's 4th largest automaker
news_article: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) and Peugeot owner PSA Group have sealed their $52 billion merger to create Stellantis, the world's fourth largest automaker. The merged entity will have annual sales of around 8.1 million vehicles. Stellantis can cut annual costs by around $6.1 billion without plant closures, a statement said. FCA and PSA first announced plans to merge in October 2019.

news_headline: Audi delays output, puts 10,000 workers on furlough amid chip shortage
news_article: Audi will delay the production of some of its high-end cars due to a global shortage of computer chips, CEO Markus Duesmann said in an interview. The carmaker, part of the Volkswagen Group, has also put over 10,000 workers on furlough due to this, he added. Audi expects to make up for lost time in the second half of 2021.

news_headline: Tesla's success should justify its share price: Raghuram Rajan
news_article: Economist and former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Raghuram Rajan said Tesla's success and spread of vehicles must be viewed firmly and should justify its rising stock price. He added that Tesla is a case of a stock that's being priced at many multiples of the price of automakers such as Toyota or General Motors.

news_headline: World's oldest cave painting of an animal drawn 45,500 yrs ago found in Indonesia
news_article: Archaeologists have discovered the world's oldest known animal cave painting in Indonesia believed to be drawn at least 45,500 years ago. The life-size painting of a wild pig also has two hand prints above the back of the animal. It was found in the Leang Tedongnge cave in a remote valley on Sulawesi island.

news_headline: New species of 'orange and black' bat discovered in West Africa
news_article: A new species of orange and black bat from the Nimba Mountains in West Africa has been discovered by scientists from the American Museum of Natural History and Bat Conservation International. The species has been named Myotis nimbaensis in recognition of the Guinea mountain range it inhabits. "It has this bright-orange fur...it was so distinct," said scientist Winifred Frick.

news_headline: Oxford preparing COVID-19 vaccine versions to fight virus variants: Report
news_article: Oxford scientists are preparing to produce new versions of their vaccine to combat more contagious COVID-19 variants discovered in the UK, South Africa and Brazil, according to a report. The team behind the vaccine from Oxford and AstraZeneca is undertaking feasibility studies to reconfigure the technology, the report said citing confirmation from Oxford University.

news_headline: 'Magic' mushrooms grow in US man's blood after he injects it in form of tea
news_article: A 30-year-old US man was hospitalised with organ failure after he injected himself with a tea made from psychedelic mushrooms, which later started growing in his veins. A case report said his liver was damaged and his kidneys weren't functioning properly. Doctors said he had tried to use the so-called "magic" mushrooms as an alternative treatment for his bipolar disorder.

news_headline: What is the Candida auris outbreak that was reported in a COVID-19 unit in US?
news_article: Candida auris is an emerging fungus that is often multidrug-resistant and some strains are resistant to all three available classes of antifungals, according to US' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC said it is difficult to identify with standard laboratory methods. A Candida auris outbreak was reported in a COVID-19 unit in Florida last year.

news_headline: 2020 was faster than usual, broke record for shortest day 28 times: Scientists
news_article: The 28 fastest days on record all occurred in 2020, with Earth completing its rotations around its axis milliseconds quicker than average, scientists said. The shortest day was July 19, when Earth completed one spin 1.4602 milliseconds faster than 86,400 seconds. Before 2020, the shortest day was noted on July 5, 2005, when the Earth's rotation was 1.0516 milliseconds faster.

news_headline: Yellow mealworms become first insect approved in EU as human food
news_article: Yellow mealworms have become the first insect approved by the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) as a human food. "Rich in protein, fat and fibre, they are likely to be the first of many insects to feature on European's plates in the coming years," an EFSA food scientist said. Mealworms are already used in Europe as a pet food ingredient.

news_headline: Astronomers capture a distant galaxy 'die' for the first time; share pic
news_article: Astronomers have captured for the first time a distant star-forming galaxy about to 'die' because of a massive cold gas ejection. "It's distant enough that its light takes some nine billion years to reach us," the astronomers said. The galaxy is ejecting nearly half of its star-forming gas at a rate equivalent to 10,000 Suns worth of gas a year.

news_headline: AI models to predict future of COVID-19 patients' condition made: Facebook
news_article: Facebook and NYU claim to have developed three machine learning models to help doctors predict how COVID-19 patients' condition may develop. Facebook said the model using sequential chest X-rays can predict up to "four days" in advance if a patient may need more intensive care solutions. The predictions could help doctors avoid sending at-risk patients home too soon, Facebook added.

news_headline: Indian student among winners of NASA app development challenge: Report
news_article: A high school student from Gurugram, Aryan Jain, is among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge, PTI reported. Jain had teamed up with six high school students from the US. The competition was a coding challenge in which NASA presented technical problems to students and sought their contributions to deep space exploration missions.

news_headline: Virgin Orbit launches rocket off a 747 aircraft, reaches orbit for 1st time
news_article: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit on Monday successfully launched its LauncherOne rocket into orbit for the first time, delivering nine satellites to low Earth orbit on behalf of NASA. The rocket took off from the ground attached to the wing of a modified Boeing 747 aircraft and detached and fired itself into Earth's orbit after reaching the launch altitude.

news_headline: Bezos' Blue Origin launches & lands latest New Shepard rocket, capsule
news_article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin has successfully launched and landed its latest New Shepard rocket and crew capsule. The capsule reached a maximum altitude of 107 kilometres, while the rocket flew up to a height of 106 kilometres. The capsule features six seats and has speakers with a microphone and a push-to-talk button at each seat.

news_headline: Indian spacetech startup Agnikul builds 3D printed rocket engine
news_article: Chennai-based spacetech startup Agnikul Cosmos has developed a single piece, fully 3D printed rocket engine called Agnilet, which can be directly used in a rocket. The engine will be used in the second stage of Agnikul's launch vehicle Agnibaan, CEO and Co-founder Srinath Ravichandran said. Launched in 2017, the startup is involved in building India's private small satellite launch vehicle.

news_headline: New chemical compounds to kill malaria parasite found: Scientists
news_article: A University of Pretoria-led research found new chemical compounds that could potentially be used for killing the malaria parasite in its infectious stage. It found that chemical compounds undergoing trials for treatment of tuberculosis and cancer can kill the parasite at a stage when it normally infects others. The compounds could also help create a new line of malaria drugs.

news_headline: CO2 levels to be 50% higher than pre-industrial era in 2021: Report
news_article: Human activity will push concentrations of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere to levels 50% higher than before the Industrial Revolution, in 2021, the UK's Met Office reported. CO2 concentration is expected to exceed 417 ppm for several weeks from April to June for the first time. However, CO2 accumulation is expected to be slightly slower than usual in 2021.

news_headline: US sees biggest drop in greenhouse gases emissions post WWll era: Report
news_article: The US' greenhouse gas emissions fell 10.3% in 2020, the largest drop in emissions in post-World War II era, due to COVID-19, the Rhodium Group reported. By comparison, the 2009 economic recession caused emissions to drop by 6.3%. Under the 2009 Copenhagen Accord, the US pledged that by 2020, it will have cut its emissions by 17% from 2005 levels.

news_headline: DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients made
news_article: The University of Cambridge said scientists have developed a DNA test to quickly identify secondary infections in COVID-19 patients, who have double the risk of developing pneumonia while on ventilation than non-COVID-19 patients. The test gives doctors the information they need to start treatment within hours rather than days. It uses multiple PCR which detects the DNA of the bacteria.

news_headline: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
news_article: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

news_headline: Bhaskaracharya found gravitational theory 500 yrs before Newton: Nepal PM
news_article: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told WION that Bhaskaracharya discovered the theory of gravitation about "500 years" before Issac Newton in 1150 AD. He added that Bhaskaracharya's book was published in 1210 AD. Oli said that even in his coursebook he was told that Newton found out the theory of gravitation.

news_headline: Megalodon babies, who ate siblings in womb, were larger than adult man: Study
news_article: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

news_headline: 2 IAF doctors to soon leave for Russia to train for Gaganyaan: Report
news_article: Two Indian Air Force doctors who have specialised in aerospace medicine will soon fly to Russia to get hands-on experience in space medicine for the Gaganyaan mission, PTI reported. The flight surgeons will also get to train with the prospective astronauts. Four test pilots from IAF, chosen for the mission, have been undergoing training in Russia since last year.

news_headline: NASA finds FM signal coming from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the 1st time
news_article: NASA's Juno space probe has discovered an FM signal emanating from Jupiter's moon Ganymede for the first time. One of NASA's ambassadors to Utah clarified that it is a ''natural function'' rather than a sign of extraterrestrial life. "Electrons spiralling in Jupiter's magnetic field are thought to be the cause of the radio noise we hear," NASA said.

news_headline: New state of matter 'liquid glass' discovered: Scientists
news_article: University of Konstanz's researchers have uncovered a new state of matter, liquid glass, with previously unknown structural elements. They used a model system involving suspensions of tailor-made ellipsoidal colloids to uncover the state. In liquid glass state, individual particles are able to move yet unable to rotate, a complex behaviour that has not previously been observed in bulk glasses.

news_headline: Astrophysicist Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passes away at 84
news_article: Renowned astrophysicist Professor Shashikumar Madhusudan Chitre passed away on January 11 aged 84. "He will be remembered for his work in astrophysics and subjects like solar physics, gravitational lensing and science education," PM said as he condoled Chitre's passing away. "His valuable work will continue inspiring students in the times to come," the PM added.

news_headline: Scientists discover 2 dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda
news_article: Scientists have found two dwarf giraffes in Namibia and Uganda. The Namibian giraffe is eight and a half feet tall, while the one in Uganda is nine feet and three inches tall. Both have standard long necks but short, stumpy legs. The medical condition that affects them is Skeletal Dysplasia, which the researchers say is rarely seen in wild animals.
